The goal of her loan is to increase production to make more profit; her intent is to help support her family, for example helping with healthcare, food, and her children's school fees.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Mariama Kesso

texts.fr: Mariama kesso D. est une femme de 23 ans, elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de SINTHIANG COUDARA depuis 2005. Mariama est une femme très dynamique, en ce qui concerne son activité elle achète des arachides non décortiqués dans le village et dans les autres villages environnants, elle les transforme en pâte d’arachide pour vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Et son nouveau prêt lui servira à augmenter son approvisionnement en arachide pour accroitre la rentabilité de son activité. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille et tout augmentant son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
Mariama Kesso D. is a 23-year old woman who is married and mother to one child. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in SINTHIANG COUDARA since 2005. Mariama is a very dynamic lady, and her activity involves buying unshelled peanuts in the village and other surrounding villages. She transforms these into peanut paste in order to sell it in the weekly markets in her area. Her new loan will be used to boost her stock of peanuts and increase the profitability of her business. Her aim is to contribute to providing for the needs of her family and to increase her savings.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the profitability of her commercial activity

loans.name: Asmao

texts.fr: Asmao D. est une femme de 43 ans, elle est veuve remariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KOUNAKE3 dont elle fait partie du Comité de Gestion, elle a une ancienneté de 06 ans dans ledit Banc Villageois. Elle s’est spécialisée dans la fabrique de glace et de crème glacée. Elle est détentrice de deux réfrigérateurs, elle achète la matière première et les condiments pour produire de la crème et de la glace qu’elle vend dans le grand marché de DIAOBE situé à une demi-dizaine de chez elle. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son capital et d’augmenter sa production. Elle vise à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et de participer au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Asmao D. is a 43-year old woman. She is a widow who has remarried, and she has three children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in KOUNAKE 3 for six years and she sits on its management committee. She specialises in making ice and ice-cream. She has two refrigerators and she buys her basic products and condiments to make the ice-cream and ice, which she sells at the large market in DIAOBE, close to her home. Her new loan will allow her to reinforce her capital and increase her production. Her aim is to improve her family's living conditions and to contribute to paying for her children's schooling.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reinforce her investment capital and promote her business

loans.name: Fatou Manda

texts.fr: Fatou Manda COULIBAKY est âgée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG COUNDARA depuis le 22 janvier 2003 et a 14 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pate d’arachide et l’objet de son crédit actuel est de renforcer son niveau d’investissement et d’augmenter sa production. Son principal objectif est de participer à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille par exemple la nourriture, la santé, l’éducation et l’habillement.
texts.en:
Fatou Manda COULIBAKY, 37, is married and raising five children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of SINTHIANG COUNDARA since January 22, 2003 and has received 14 consecutive loans. She makes and sells peanut butter, and the goal of this loan is to increase her working capital and raise production. Her main intent is to help support her family in terms of food, healthcare, education, and clothing.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: develop and expand her business

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata K. est une femme de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KOUNKANE3 depuis 2006, et suite au décès de la présidente dudit Banc Villageoise elle a été élue à ce poste il y a de cela un an. Elle est vendeuse de crème glacée et de bananes. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité et d’augmenter sa production afin de prétendre à plus de bénéfices pour pouvoir participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie et charges familiales.
texts.en:
Fatoumata K., 44, is married and raising three children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of KOUNKANE3 since 2006, and following the death of the president of this Banc Villageoise, she was elected to that post a year ago. She sells ice cream and bananas. Her new loan will allow her to expand her business so she can make more profit and better participate in improving living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Diaraye

texts.fr: Diaraye S. est âgée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KOUNKANE3 depuis le 13 janvier 2006 et y a bénéficier de 08 crédits qu’elle a toujours bien géré et remboursés sans difficulté. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pate d’arachide et son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité et d’augmenter sa production. Son objectif est de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
Diaraye S., 37, is married and the mother of 5 children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of KOUNKANE3 since January 13, 2006 and has received 8 loans that she used well and reimbursed without difficulty. She makes and sells peanut butter and her loan will allow her to expand her business and raise production. Her goal is to participate in improving living conditions for her family while adding to her savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Cipriano Javier

texts.es: Cipriano Javier tiene 35 años es padre de familia, tiene 3 hijas, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en un poblado, la actividad económica del señor es la elaboración de artesanías en su domicilio, realiza la actividad de manera manual. Hace 12 años tiene este negocio porque tenía que proporcionarle a su familia una estabilidad económica y a sus hijos una educación. El señor Cipriano empezó trabajando como ayudante y luego aprendió a fabricar piezas de barro, que se venden en el municipio y a nivel nacional e internacional. El financiamiento es para compra de materia prima y elaboración de artículos de barro para llevarlos a la  feria que se realizara en Miami en Noviembre. Para cumplir  sus deseos de tener dinero suficiente para trabajar con capital propio y dar una estabilidad emocional y económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Cipriano Javier is 35 years old, a father of 3 daughters. His home is located in a village. For a living he makes handmade crafts at home. He has had this business for 12 years as he needed to provide his family with economic stability and his children with schooling. Mr. Cipriano began to work as an assistant and then learned to make clay objects which are sold in the municipality as well as nationally and internationally. The loan will be invested in buying raw material and making objects to be taken to the market in Miami in the month of November. It is his dream to obtain enough money to be able to work with his own capital and give emotional and economic stability to his family

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama C. est née le 04 janvier 1980, elle a 30 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 19 juin 2003 elle a une ancienneté de 6 ans et demi  et a 13 fois de suit bénéficié de crédit. Elle fait la transformation et vente de pâte d’arachide. L’objet de son crédit est de renforcer son capital d’investissement  pour augmenter sa production et réaliser plus de bénéfices. Son objectif est de participer à l’auto-prise en charge de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
Mariama C. was born on January 4, 1980; she is 30 years old, married and the mother of five dependent children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois since June 19, 2003 and has obtained loans 13 times during the six and a half years of her membership. She prepares and sells peanut sauce. The rationale for her loan is to boost her business capital in order to increase her production level and obtain higher income. Her goal is to contribute to the family’s financial self-sufficiency and to bolster her savings.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boosting her business capital

loans.name: Bouya

texts.fr: Bouya S. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG COUNDARA depuis 2008 et a 05 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle est transformatrice et vendeuse de pate d’arachide. Après avoir produit la marchandise elle va dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité pour la commercialiser. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va augmenter sa production et se procurer plus de bénéfices qui lui permettront de contribuer à la prise en charge de la famille, la nourriture et la santé par exemple.
texts.en:
Bouya S. is a 40-year-old woman who is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of SINTHIANG COUNDARA since 2008 and has benefited from five consecutive loans without ever a problem repaying. Bouya is a maker and seller of peanut butter. After making this product, she goes to the weekly markets in her town to market it. With her new loan, she is going to increase her production and acquire more profit. This will enable her to help support the family in terms of food and health care, as examples.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her investment capital

loans.name: Kadiatou Sarata

texts.fr: Kadiatou Sarata BÂ est une femme de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants et tutrice de 3 garçons et 3 filles. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG COUNDARA depuis le 07 et a 14 fois de suite reçu de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle vend sur une table de fortune du thé, du sucre, des cigarettes, de l’huile végétale etc. son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité et d’augmenter  son niveau d’approvisionnement. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille tout augmentant ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Kadiatou Sarata Bâ is a 43-year old woman, married and the mother of six children with other three boys and three girls in her charge. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Sinthinagn Coundara since 2007 and obtained loans 14 times in the past; all loans were always repaid without any issues. She uses a makeshift table to sell tea, sugar, cigarettes, vegetable oil etc. This new loan will allow her to strengthen her business and to increase her level of stock. Her goal is to help support her family while growing her savings.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Developing and promoting her business

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr: Kadiatou S. est âgée de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de SINTHIANG COUNDARA depuis le 16 février 2005 et a 10 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle est transformatrice et vendeuse de pate d’arachide et son prêt lui servira à renforcer son activité, d’en faire sa promotion et d’augmenter sa production. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille tout en renforçant son épargne.
texts.en:
Kadiatou S. is 47 years old, married and the mother of seven children, all under her care. She has been a member of the SINTHIANG COUNDARA « Banc Villageois » loan group since 16 February 2005 and has been granted ten successive loans without any problems reimbursing them. She manufactures and sells peanut paste. Her loan will serve to reinforce her activity, promote it and increase her production. Her objective is to participate in taking charge of her family’s needs, while bolstering her savings.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her revenue-generating activity

loans.name: Bring Ambercourt To Unite Group 3, Jinja

texts.en:
His business started off four years ago in Amber Court market in Jinja. With earnings from his lucrative bar business, 34-year-old O. Timothy has, in many respects, managed to shoulder all his family responsibilities, principally the provision of finances towards his five children’s education. His family’s welfare has also, to a broader extent, improved and so has his marriage.

Timothy’s clientele has been increasing since, a broad hint of his good rapport-building skills. Starting off as a revenue collector was a big springboard to establishing himself in business, in that he used his savings to take root. With all contingencies laid out in case of adversity, and with experience, determination and hard work in tow, Timothy is destined for tides of success in the future.

Though Timothy’s 50,000 shillings a week may seem to be modest, he has nurtured a savings culture that has been vital in seeing his disposable income grow. He wants to buy more crates of beer, sodas and local brew for his business with this loan.He also harbors dreams of significantly expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of beer, sodas and other local brews

loans.name: Fatouama Manda

texts.fr: Fatoumata Manda D. est une femme de 30 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SITHIANG COUNDARA depuis 2007 et 06 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d’arachide depuis plus de 03 ans, son nouveau prêt lui sera d’une grande utilité pour le renforcement de son activité et l’augmentation de son production. Elle participe à la prise en charge des besoins familiaux, par exemple le payement de la scolarité des enfants, la santé et la nourriture.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Manda D. is 30 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the SINTHIANG COUNDARA « Banc Villageois » loan group since 2007 and has been granted six successive loans. She has been manufacturing and selling peanut paste for over three years. Her new loan will prove very useful to strengthen her activity and increase her production. She participates in managing family needs, for example paying for the children’s tuition fees, healthcare and food.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Adama Thiéwal

texts.fr: Adama Thiéwal DIALLO est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG COUDARA depuis 2006 elle a 7 fois de suite reçu de crédit et n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d’arachide. Elle achète des gousses d’arachide, les décortique, les grille au feu de bois avant de les amener au moulin pour la transformation en pate. Les différents marchés de sa zone lui servent de point d’écoulement de sa marchandise. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge les besoins de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
Adama Thiéwal DIALLO is 43 years old, married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the SINTHIANG COUNDARA « Banc Villageois » loan group since 2006, has been granted six successive loans, and has had no problems reimbursing them. She manufactures and sells peanut paste. She buys raw peanuts, shells them, grills them over a wood fire, and takes them to the mill to be ground into paste. The various markets in her area serve as outlets for her merchandise. Her objective is to participate in managing her family’s needs, while bolstering her savings level.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain her revenue-generating activity

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl tiene 43 años, convive con Delia de 34 años y su hijo político José de 12 años, a quien quiere como si fuera su propio hijo, esta familia vive en su domicilio propio, ubicado en una zona céntrica del centro poblado “Sanchirio Palomar “ - La Merced. Anteriormente comercializaba productos naturales, pero al ver que sus ganancias eran regulares, decidió tener sus propias plantaciones de plátano en terrenos arrendados, las que ahora cuida con esmero y dedicación, generándole ingresos económicos que le permiten obtener mayores oportunidades y bienes, que mejorarían su calidad de vida. Por otro lado trabaja de operario en chacras ajenas, recibiendo S/. 20.00 por día. Lleva dos años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es retirar la maleza de su chacra, de esa manera facilitaría el crecimiento de sus plantas, es por ello que espera comprarse sus terrenos propios con los ahorros que tiene guardado y así obtener mayores ganancias. Por el momento plantará frutos que crecen en esta zona de la selva del Perú, además tiene casi listo todo para instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y esta satisfecho de trabajar con su grupo comunal, ya que las personas son muy colaboradoras en cada actividad que desarrollan. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará un terreno de varias hectáreas y para el cual estuvo ahorrando todo este tiempo, por ello está feliz porque verá su sueño cristalizado.
texts.en:
Raúl, age 43, lives with Delia, age 34, and her polite son José, age 12, whom he treats as his own child. This family lives in its own home located in a the central “Sanchirio Palomar “ zone of La Merced.

Previously, he sold natural products, but, upon seeing the possibility for fairly good profits, he decided to have his own banana plantation on leased land. He now looks after this with extreme care and dedication producing income that allows him to obtain greater opportunities and benefits that are improving his quality of life. In addition, he works as a laborer on someone else’s small farm receiving 20 soles per day.

He has been engaged in this business for 2 years, and what he likes most is clearing the undergrowth from his own plantation and in this way facilitating the growth of his crops. This is why he hopes to purchase his own fields with the savings he has set aside and, thus, obtain better earnings. At present, he plans to plant fruits that grow in this area of the Peruvian jungle. In addition, he is almost ready to open a food shop in his house.

This is the second time he has had a loan with MFP, and he is pleased to be working with his communal bank since the members work collaboratively in each business that they develop. With the loan that he is applying for he will buy a field of several hectares for which he has been saving for a long time. He is happy to see his dream coming true.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will buy a plot of agricultural land.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se denomina “RICCHARY RUNA”; se reúnen cada mes por la tarde en el distrito de Huanchac, de la provincia de Cusco y departamento Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Carmen Rosa C. J.; Ella es natural del departamento de Ica;  La socia alterna sus diferentes actividades con el trabajo de sastrería ella tiene 3 hijos, es conviviente y ella es empleada en una sastrería en el distrito de Santiago. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para pagar los estudios de sus hijos que están en el colegio. 

La socia agradece el préstamo y valorando el mismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The name of this communal bank is Ricchary Runa. They meet ever month in the afternoon in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Our member is Carmen Rosa C. J.. She is from the Ica department. She alternates her activities between her tailoring work and her three children. She is in a common law marriage. She is employed in a tailor shop in the Santiago district. Our member is requesting a loan to pay for her children’s education; the children are in school. Our member is grateful for and values the loan. She pledges to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her children’s education; the children are in school

loans.name: Kadidiatou

texts.fr: Kadiatou BÂ est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG COUNDARA depuis le 25 avril 2008, elle a été 4 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit et n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle est vendeuse de fruits, elle s’approvisionne hebdomadairement dans les marchés et fait du porte à porte dans le village pour revendre. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de prétendre à des bénéfices qui contribueront à la prise en charge des besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Kadiatou BÂ is 42 years old, married and the mother of five children, all under her care. She has been a member of the SINTHIANG COUNDARA « Banc Villageois » loan group since 25 April 2008, has been granted four successive loans, and has had no problems reimbursing them. She is a fruit vendor, gets her supplies from weekly markets, then resells door-to-door in the village. Her new loan will enable her to strengthen her activity and envision earnings she will use to help manage family needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital and her level of activity

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se denomina “RICCHARY RUNA”; se reúnen cada mes por la tarde en el distrito de Huanchac, de la provincia de Cusco y departamento Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Carlota; Ella es madre soltera y tiene un hijo, la socia tiene 38 años de edad y es natural del departamento de Cusco;  La socia alterna sus diferentes actividades con el servicio de vidriería, ella trabaja cortando vidrios y en la caja; Nuestra socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y sola saca adelante a su pequeño hijo; Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para el negocio ella desea implementar y como capital de trabajo. 

La socia agradece el préstamo y valorando el mismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The name of this communal bank is “RICCHARY RUNA”. They meet every month in the afternoon in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Our member is Carlota. She is a single mother, and she has one child. She is 38 years old, and she is from the Cusco department. She alternates her different activities; she provides glass works services. She works cutting glass and at the register. Our member is a very hard-working woman. She gets her young son ahead by herself. She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise for the business she wants to set up and for working capital. Our member is grateful for and values the loan. She pledges to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bring Ambercourt To Unite Group 4, Jinja

texts.en:
Thirteen years is the time 44-year-old Samuel A. has been plying his general store retail business in Jinja market. It is for him, now, a safe-bet situation, given the beaten-track experience he has gotten and the 30,000 shillings he makes per week. Not to be glossed over, too, has been the hard work he has put in to see to it that his business prospers.

Samuel began as an odd-job laborer before he conjured up the idea of setting up his own general store retail enterprise. With his business, this widower has been able to take care of his five children. They all go to school and do well.

Samuel’s blueprint for the future is all set on the rejuvenation of his business by purchasing more domestic consumer goods for his shop. He is banking on this loan to bring his plans to fruition. He is principally looking at buying more retail items like sugar and more bars of soap.

loans.use: To purchase more quantities of items like sugar, soap and salt

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr: Ramatoulaye BÂ est une femme de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG COUNDARA depuis 2008 et a trois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle fait la transformation et vente de pâte d’arachide. Elle achète le produit à l’état brut, c’est-à-dire des gousses d’arachide et le transforme elle-même en pâte d’arachide avant d’aller le vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires environnant son village. Son nouveau prêt lui sera d’une grande utilité pour le renforcement de son activité et l’augmentation de sa production. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Ramatoulaye BÂ is 33 years old, married and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the SINTHIANG COUNDARA «Banc Villageois» loan group since 2008, and has been granted three successive loans. She manufactures and sells peanut paste. She buys the raw product, that is unshelled peanuts. She then manufactures herself the peanut paste, before selling it in weekly markets in the vicinity of her village. This new loan will be very useful to strengthen her activity and increase her production level. Her objective is to assist her husband in managing family needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her working capital and develop her business activity

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 31 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’habillements, de produits cosmétiques, d’ustensiles de cuisine etc.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman sont à leur septième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des habillements, des ustensiles de cuisine et des produits cosmétiques.                                                                          
ATOU D. s’approvisionne en produits au Burkina Faso et effectue sa vente sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  22 500F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Sabougnouman group are all married. They are on average 31 years old with four children, and all live in traditional extended families in the town of Fana, in the Dioïla Prefecture, part of the Koulikoro Region ( 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They were acquainted through family ties and are vendors of clothing, beauty products, kitchen utensils, etc. The women in the Sabougnouman group are now requesting their seventh group loan which will serve to buy clothing, kitchen utensils and beauty products. Atou D. resupplies her products in Burkina Faso and sells locally or in area market fairs, for cash or credit, to both men and women customers. She hopes to reach average monthly earnings of 22,500 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan, take care of health-related expenses, pay for food and schooling costs, and the remainder will be reinvested in the business activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se denomina “RICCHARY RUNA”; se reúnen cada mes por la tarde en el distrito de Huanchac, de la provincia de Cusco y departamento Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; Es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, la socia tiene 35 años de edad y es natural del departamento de Cusco;  La socia alterna sus diferentes actividades con el oficio de masajista, ella trabaja en un hotel dando el servicio de masajes, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para mejorar su casa, ella desea comprar algunos muebles para su hogar.

La socia agradece el préstamo y valorando el mismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
This community bank is called "Ricchary Runa"; the group meets every week in the afternoon in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco. Luz Marina lives with her partner and has three children. She is 35 and is a native of Cusco. She does housework and is also a masseuse. She works in a hotel giving massages. She is requesting this loan to improve her house; she wants to buy some furniture for her home. She is grateful for this loan and values it. She promises to repay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Henry  vive en la zona Villa Esperanza, de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija, en la casa de sus padres.

Henry trabaja como empleado transitorio de una pequeña empresa como encargado de cargo y descargo de mercadería.


El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de materiales de construcción para continuar con la refacción de sus habitaciones que su padre le concedió para su mejor calidad de vida ya que estas son mas amplias. 
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro y segundo vía Kiva;  la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Henry lives in Villa Esperanza, in the city of El Alto.

He lives with his wife and their young daughter, in the house of their parents.

Henry works as a temporary employee in a small business loading cargo and unloading merchandise.

The loan will be used to acquire construction materials to continue the refurbishment of the rooms that his father gave him to improve their quality of life by enlarging them.

This is the second loan with Impro and second time with Kiva; the evaluation completed qualified him to request the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchse construction materials

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se denomina “RICCHARY RUNA”; se reúnen cada mes por la tarD. en el distrito D. Huanchac, D. la provincia D. Cusco y departamento Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. JUANA; Es casada y tiene 5 hijos, la socia tiene 57 años D. edad y es natural del departamento D. Cusco; del tradicional barrio D. nueva alta,  La socia alterna sus diferentes actividades con la venta D. tamales dulces y salados en el mercado central , ella hace unos riquísimos tamales a base D. maíz y harina, a los que le agrega un poco D. aceitunas, encebollado con carnecita y sal; y a los tamales con dulce les agrega pasas. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para mejorar su casa, comprar insumos para su negocio D. tamales

La socia agradece el préstamo y valorando el mismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Ricchary Runa”; they meet every month in the afternoon in the Huanchac district, in the Cusco province and department.

Our member is Juana; She is married and has 5 children. She is 57 years old and is a native of Cusco, from a traditional neighborhood. She works in different businesses, such as the sale of tamales, sweets and snacks in the central market. She makes a delicious tortilla from corn and flour, which she fills with olives, onions, meat and salt. In the sweet tamales, she puts raisins. She is requesting this loan to improve her home and purchase materials for her tamale business.

She is grateful for the loan and for this reason, she promises to complete the payments of her debts on time.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase consumables and improve her home

loans.name: María Lorena

texts.es:
La señora María Lorena P. C. es casada de 37 años, habita con sus 2 hijos adolecentes en el barrio Laureles Norte, ellos tienen un comedor desde hace 5 años, y fue su madre quien la apoyo económicamente a  iniciarse en esta actividad y tras eso ha sido el sustento diario a sus hijos. 

Es para el negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de utensilios de cocina que le permitan aumentar la productividad del personal, a futuro espera tener las posibilidades de comprar un local y poner un restaurante. Este apoyo le brindara la posibilidad de mejorar económicamente sus racursos y ofrecerle a sus hijos los estudios academicos y que ellos tengan las herramientas para sobresalir profesionalmente en el medio.
texts.en:
María Lorena P. C. is married, 37 years old and has 2 teenage children in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte. The have run a diner for 5 years. Her mother gave her the economic support to start this business, which has been the daily sustenance for her children.

For this business, she requests a loan to purchase kitchen utensils that will allow her to increase the productivity of her employees. In the future, she hopes have the possibility to buy a local shop and open a restaurant. This support brings her the opportunity to improve her resources and offer academic studies to her children, so that they have the tools to succeed professionally.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase kitchen equipment

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se denomina “RICCHARY RUNA”; se reúnen cada mes por la tarde en el distrito de Huanchac, de la provincia de Cusco y departamento Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él  Sr. ARTURO; Es casado y tiene5 hijos, Él socio tiene 73 años de edad y es natural del departamento de Cusco; su esposa es la socia Juana. Nuestro socio se dedica a prestar servicio de mudanza el tiene una pequeña camioneta abierta, esta le sirve para llevar cosas y dedicarse a alquilar su carro para el servicio de mudanzas Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su carro. 

El socio agradece el préstamo y valorando el mismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The name of this communal bank is “RICCHARY RUNA”. They meet every month in the afternoon in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Our member is Arturo. He is married and has five children. He is 73 years old, and he is from the Cusco department. His wife, Juana, is a member. He provides moving services. He has a small open truck. He uses it to take transport things, and he rents his car for moving services. Our member is requesting the loan to buy replacement parts for his car. Our member is grateful for and values the loan. He pledges to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for his car

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche  comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). 
 

Vive en la  comunidad  de Ninachiri , sector Kallutaca de la Provincia  Los Andes  del departamento de La Paz, ubicado  a  tres   horas de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Vive junto a su esposa y dos de sus hijas las cuales colaboran  en el cuidado del ganado.


El crédito lo destinará a la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Francisco raises cattle. He sells his milk production to PIL Andina (Industrializad Milk Plant). He lives in the Ninachiri community, Kallutaca sector, Los Andes province, La Paz department. It is three hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and two of their daughters. They help take care of the cattle. The loan is to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production as well as his income. This is his first loan with Impro. The competed evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo tiene 24 años, convive con Mailen de 20 años, ellos tienen dos pequeños hijos, todos viven en su acogedora casa propia, que construyeron luego de constantes sacrificios. Su dedicación y esmero hacen que Ricardo, sea uno de los mejores productores de plátano y café de su localidad “Sanchirio Palomar”, pese a ser joven, es un padre responsable y eso lo motiva aseguir trabajando y poder brindarle lo mejor a su familia. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposa y más en temporada de cosecha, normalmente él se dedica al campo y su esposa a las labores domésticas y cuidar de sus hijos. Lleva más de un año dedicado a la agricultura y lo que más le gusta es cultivar  y limpiar sus plantaciones de café, por otro lado le molesta que en el mercado de su ciudad  le quieran regatear en el precio, los mayoristas alegando que es su precio real en el mercado. Pese a todo considera que su oficio es bastante rentable porque puede cubrir los gastos de su familia, educar a sus hijos y sobre todo le permite ahorrar. Actualmente tiene dos hectáreas de plátano y quiere comprar un terreno de dos hectáreas más para renovar sus plantaciones y tener mayor productividad. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y se muestra muy entusiasmado con la idea de trabajar en su grupo comunal donde hay reglas y normas que cumplir. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mil 600 plantas de plátano para plantarlas en sus terrenos nuevos.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 24 years old and lives with Mailen, who is 20. They have 2 small children, and all live together in their own cozy home that they built through much sacrifice. Ricardo's dedication and industriousness have made him one of the best producers of bananas and coffee in the Sanchirio Palomar area. In spite of being young, he is a responsible father and this motivates him to continue working so that he can provide the best for his family. At times he is helped out by his wife, especially during the harvest season. Normally, he works in the fields and his wife carries out the domestic tasks and cares for their children. For more than a year he has worked in agriculture, and what he likes most is to cultivate and clear his coffee lands. On the other hand, he does not enjoy the market in his city where they want to haggle on price, where the wholesalers claim that their price is the real market price. In spite of all of this, he considers this line of work to be sufficiently profitable, since he can cover the household expenses, educate his children and, above all, save. Currently he has 2 hectares of bananas, and he wants to buy 2 more hectares of land so that he can add to his cultivations and have increased production. This is the first time that he has taken a loan from MFP, and he is enthusiastic about the idea of working with a communal group where there are rules and regulations to comply with. With the loan he requests, he will buy 1,600 banana plants to plant on his new land.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: he will buy 1,600 banana plants to plant on his new land

loans.name: Liduvina Elvira

texts.es: Liduvina tiene 59 años tiene un hijo vive en casa propia, ella inicio este negocio hace ya 4 años aproximadamente, ella trabaja en un local alquilado, se inicio con un capital propio, como tiene experiencia en este negocio trabaja desD. las 6 D. la mañana hasta las 9 D. la noche, teniendo gran margen D. ganancia, ya que ofrece gran vaviedad D. platos a sus clientes los cuales siempre regresan por su buena sazon y bajos precios, el dinero D. este credito sera destinado para colocar piso pulido a la sala D. su inmueble, ya que piensa alquilarlo para poder tener un mayor ingreso, el sueño D. Liduvina es seguir mejorando su vivienda a fin D. alquilar habitaciones y logar generar otros ingresos que le permitan darle un mejor calidad D. vida a su menor hijo.
texts.en:
Liduvina, 59, has a son and lives in her own house. She started her business about four years ago in a rented space using her own money to start. Because she is experienced in this line of work, she is open from 6am until 9pm earning good profits because she offers a wiD. variety of dishes to her customers who always return thanks to the tastiness and low prices of her offerings. These funds will be used to install polished flooring in her building’s room because she plans to lease it out to obtain more income. Liduvina’s dream is to continue making improvements to her home in order to rent out rooms to earn more income that will allow her to proviD. a better quality of life for her young son.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install flooring in her home.

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.es:
Hipolita se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche  comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). 
 

Vive en la  comunidad  de Umalso de la Provincia  Omasuyos  del departamento de La Paz, ubicado  a  cuatro   horas de la ciudad de La Paz, en su casita propia junto a sus dos hijos menores y su esposo, el cual se dedica también al mismo trabajo.


El crédito lo destinará en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Hipolita raises cattle, whose milk she sells at the "PIL Andina" (Andean Industrial Milk Plant). She lives in the community of Umalso, in Omasuyos Province, in the department of La Paz. Her community is located four hours from the city of La Paz. She lives in her own house with her two young children and her husband, who does the same work as her. This loan is intended to buy a dairy cow, in order to increase their milk production and therefore their income. This is Hipolita's first loan with IMPRO. An evaluation was done to qualify her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow, in order to increase milk production

loans.name: Ndeff Leng Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe NDEFF LENG est créé depuis 3 ans, il est composé de 10 femmes toutes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par affinité, elles sont âgées de 30 à 50 ans et sont au moins mères de 2 enfants. La proximité du marché hebdomadaire, marché situé dans le village, contribue beaucoup au bon déroulement des activités commerciales du groupe et des femmes en général. Une aspect qui contribue également au développement économique de la localité et ses environs. Le nouveau crédit du groupe de solidarité lui permettra de renforcer ses activités économiques et de les diversifier. Leurs activités consistent  la vente de céréales locales, de produits halieutiques, d’arachide et de crème glacée pour les détentrices de réfrigérateur. 

Madame Saye D., la présidente du groupe de solidarité, à droite de la photo en écharpe jaune  est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle s’est spécialisée dans la vente de mil décortiqué elle mène cette activité depuis 04 ans. L’objet de son nouveau  prêt est de renforcer sa production. Et son objectif est de réaliser plus de bénéfices et participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille par la nourriture et la bonne couverture sanitaire et scolaire des enfants.
Le groupe de solidarité, en sus de ses remboursements réguliers, mobilise mensuellement des épargnes.
texts.en:
The NDEFF LENG group was created three years ago. It consists of ten women, all from the same village. They came together through personal affinities, are from 30 to 50 years of age, and have at least two children. The proximity of the weekly market located inside the village, contributes greatly to the well-functioning of the group’s commercial activities and that of women in general. It also contributes to the economic development of the village and its surrounding area. The new solidarity loan will enable the group to strengthen its economic activities and diversify them. Their activities currently include the sale of local grain cereals, sea-food products, ground nuts, and ice cream for those in possession of a freezer. Mrs Saye D., the president of the solidarity group (on the left of the photo wearing a yellow scarf), is 43 years old, married and the mother of five children. She specialised four years ago in the sales activity of hulled millet grain. She will use her new loan to increase her production. Her objective is to increase her profits and participate in improving her family’s living conditions, providing food and health and educational coverage for her children. Despite its regular loan repayments, the solidarity group insists on monthly savings.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen the group's economic initiatives

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se denomina “RICCHARY RUNA”; se reúnen cada mes por la tarde en el distrito de Huanchac, de la provincia de Cusco y departamento Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él  Sr. Efrain; Es conviviente y tiene 32 años de edad, tiene  un hijo menor de edad, el socio es natural de Cusco y trabaja vendiendo ganados, el socio viaja a las comunidades alto andinas y trae ganados él  los compra para llevar a las diferentes ferias y comprar ganados de toda edad y venderlos. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar ganados para la venta. 

El socio agradece el préstamo y valorando el mismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “RICCHARY RUNA” and meets monthly in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Our featured member is Efrain, 32. He lives with his life partner and son. He is from Cusco and works selling cattle. He travels to Andean communities to acquire cattle of varying ages and then takes them to the various livestock fairs to sell. He is asking for funds to buy cattle to sell. He is grateful for and values the funds and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Daysi Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Daysi Dominga L. G., tiene la edad de 49 años es madre soltera de 3 hijos y sobrevive gracias a sus trabajos de costura quien inicio sus trabajos en esta actividad gracias a su propio esfuerzo debido a que aprendió estos oficios reparando en primera instancia prendas y posteriormente ahorro para la compra de  una máquina de coser overlook que realiza costuras industriales.

Es para su propio negocio que ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas con la intensión de realizar las ofertas de trabajo y aumentar su producción que favorezca a la economía personal en beneficio de su pequeña familia. Ella ha sido una mujer sola que ha salido adelante y mejorado sus condiciones económicas en pro de su familia, espera se le brinde un apoyo para continuar con las mejoras en su vida.
texts.en:
Señora Daysi Dominga L. G. is 49 years old and is the single mother of 3 children. She survives thanks to her sewing work. She began this work through her own efforts. First she learned how to sew by repairing garments, and later she saved to buy an overlock sewing machine which is used for sewing in factories. She is applying for a loan for her own business so that she can purchase fabrics with the intention of making items to offer for sale and increasing her production, which will improve her personal economic situation and benefit her little family. She has been a single woman who has advanced herself and improved her economic conditions for the benefit of her family. She hopes that support will be offered to her to continue with the improvements in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabrics to make items for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria  vive en la Urbanización Mercurio, zona peri urbana de la ciudad de El Alto

Vive con su esposo y sus hijos menores, los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar; su esposo trabaja como transportista de carga a nivel inter departamental con su propio camión.

La señora tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde expende artículos de primera necesidad  a los vecinos de su zona.


El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de productos (arroz, harina, azucar, etc.)  al por mayor y así minimizar costos.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Maria lives in the Mercurio neighborhood on the outskirts of the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband and their minor children, who are school-aged. Her husband works transporting cargo long-distance in his own truck. Maria has a small grocery store where she sells staple goods to her neighbors. This loan will be used to acquire more products (rice, flour, sugar, etc.) at wholesale so as to minimize costs. This is her second loan with IMPRO, and IMPRO's evaluation qualified her to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar and other products at wholesale (to minimize costs) to sell in her store

loans.name: Debora Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
In addition to being a vibrant entrepreneur, Janet is also the mother of five children from age 4-17 years old, who are pursuing education at various levels. She is hard-working and resourceful on behalf of her family. She is divorced and as single parent, she wants to make sure she is financially able to support all their children through university education.

Janet operates a 'cold store', selling chilled fish, chicken and meat to customers. She procures assorted fish, chicken and meat in cartons from big-time 'cold store' operators and retails it to her customers. She has operated this trade for the past year. She plans to use the loan to purchase more fish, chicken and meat to stock her deep freezers. 

Janet is currently the leader of a trust bank group called 'Debora', comprised of four members. The other members are also engaged in trades such as food-selling, soap-making and the sale of used clothes. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and to be able to support their children through university education.

loans.use: To purchase assorted frozen fish, chicken and meat for resale

loans.name: Marbellí Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Marbellí del Socorro S., es casada de 34 años, su esposo es mecánico y con sus 3 hijos menores de edad, habitan en el barrio Waspan Norte, ella se dedica a la venta de  cosméticos desde hace 8 años y fue gracias al apoyo de su marido que comenzaron sus días en esta actividad.

A futuro espera tener los recursos necesarios para abrir una tienda de cosméticos en algún centro comercial de la capital, y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos personales que favorezcan la economía de su hogar, por ahora solicita un apoyo para la construcción del porche de su hogar e instalar verjas para tener una mejor seguridad, debido a que el lugar donde habitan presenta sudun la policía nacional un alto índice de delincuencia que amenaza a sus pobladores quienes optan por reforzar la segurida de sus hogares en pro de su familia.
texts.en:
Marbellí del Socorro S., 34, is married; her husband is a mechanic and, together with their three minor children, they live in the Waspan Norte neighborhood. She has sold cosmetics for the past 8 years thanks to help from her husband who started her out in this business. She hopes in the future to have sufficient resources to open a cosmetics store in one of the capital’s shopping centers so that her personal income may improve thereby improving family economy. For now, she is asking for funds to build a porch on her house and to install iron grilles for heightened security because the area where she lives, according to the national police, is an area where the high crime rate is a threat to its residents and she wants to increase home security for her family’s wellbeing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a porch and install iron grilles.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se denomina “RICCHARY RUNA”; se reúnen cada mes por la tarde en el distrito de Huanchac, de la provincia de Cusco y departamento Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él  Sr. Daniel; Es viudo y tiene 60 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos ya todos independientes,  el socio es natural de Cusco y estudios solo secundaria completa, el por motivos económicos no pudo estudiar la superior, Nuestro socio es conductor y tiene su propio carro y presta servicio de turismo y taxi. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para mejorar su casa.

El socio agradece el préstamo y valorando el mismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “RICCHARY RUNA”; they meet every month in the afternoon in the Huanchac district, which is in the Cusco province and department. This member is Daniel. He is a widower who is 60 years old. He has 5 children who are now all independent. He is a native of Cusco and completed only his secondary education; for economic reasons he could not study at a higher level. He is a driver, and he has his own car with which he provides taxi and tourism services. He is requesting a loan to improve his house. Daniel is grateful for this loan and values it highly. He is committed to making his payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to make improvements to his house

loans.name: Sope Serigne Moustapha Bassirou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE MOUSTAPHA BASSIROU est créé depuis 03 ans et composé de 09 femmes âgées en moyenne de 45 ans, elles sont toutes mariées et mères d’au moins de 3 enfants. La proximité des membres favorise une bonne entente et cohésion dans le groupe, car elles se réunissent régulièrement pour discuter de la vie de leur Banc Villageois et du groupe en particulier, c’est qui fait leur force. Il existe un grand marché hebdomadaire dans le village et ça qui contribue à la réussite des activités du groupe et des femmes du village en général. L’activité principale du groupe est le petit commerce de céréales locales, de produits halieutiques et jus de fruits naturel locaux et de glace.

La présidente du groupe de solidarité Madame Sokhna D. est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est dotée d’un bon esprit de solidarité et joue un rôle très important de modératrice dans le groupe. Elle fait la fabrique de jus de fruits naturel et de glace qu’elle vend au jour de marché hebdomadaire ou faisant du porte à porte les autres jours. Elle mène cette activité depuis 4 ans et son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants.
texts.en:
The SOPE SERIGNE MOUSTAPHA BASSIROU solidarity group was created three years ago. It consists of nine married women, on average 45 years old with at least three children. The proximity of its members encourages cohesion and goodwill within the group. They derive their strength from regular meetings where they discuss the operational health of their “Banc Villageois” branch and of their group in particular. The village holds a large weekly market which contributes to the success of the group’s activities and of the village’s women in general. The group’s main activity is the retail sales of local grain cereals, seafood products, locally produced natural fruit juice and ice. Mrs. Sokhna D. is the group’s president. She is 43 years old, married and the mother of six children. She is endowed with a good sense of what solidarity entails and has a very important role as moderator for the group. For the past four years she has made natural fruit juice and ice that she sells at the weekly market and door-to-door the other days. Her ambition is to assist her husband in taking care of their children.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reinforce, develop and promote the group's revenue-generating activities

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se denomina “RICCHARY RUNA”; se reúnen cada mes por la tarde en el distrito de Huanchac, de la provincia de Cusco y departamento Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Yenny; Es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo, Ella tiene 31 años de edad y es natural del departamento de Cusco; se dedica a la construcción, ella vende materiales de construcción en su pequeña tienda de materiales en su casa, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con este oficio y le va muy bien, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo apara comprar un poco mas de materiales para el negocio.

La socia agradece el préstamo y valorando el mismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “RICCHARY RUNA” and meets monthly during the afternoons in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Our featured member is Yenny, 31. She lives with her life partner and her son. She is from Cusco department and she sells building materials and supplies in a small store in her home. She alternates her household chores with this business and does quite well. She is asking for funds to buy more stock items for her store. He is grateful for and values the loan obtained and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store.

loans.name: Nyame Nhyira Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Abena describes herself as active and very dedicated, a woman who sees no challenge too great. She is 50 years old and she is the leader of the “Nyame Nhyira” (translated as "Blessings of God") borrower group. Abena lives in Dormaa and sells earthenware pots. Earthenware is pottery made of fairly coarse-textured baked clay that is fired at a very low temperature. It is made into pots, plates, and bowls. She has been selling earthenware pots for the past 15 years. Abena is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase more earthenware pots from manufacturers.

She wants to use the extra profits she anticipates as a result of this loan to support her children's education. She is married to a farmer and together they have three children from age 14-29 who are pursuing education at primary school level.

loans.use: To purchase earthenware dishes in bulk

loans.name: Sope Serigne Saliou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SERIGNE SALIOU  est créé depuis 03 ans, il est composé de 08 femmes toutes issues du même Banc Villageois et du même village. Elles se sont organisées par affinité, elles sont âgées en moyenne de 45 ans et sont au moins mères de 4 enfants. Il existe un grand marché hebdomadaire qui draine des milliers de personnes par semaine. Ce facteur  contribue beaucoup au développement économique de la localité et ses environs. Le nouveau crédit du groupe de solidarité lui permettra de renforcer ses activités économiques. L’activité principale du groupe de solidarité est le petit commerce de céréales locales, de produits halieutiques, de légumes et de glaces. 

Madame Ndella M., la présidente du groupe de solidarité, à droite de la photo en grand boubou bleu clair parsemé de fleurettes jaunes et bleu foncé,  est âgée de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle s’est spécialisée dans la vente des légumes les jours de marché hebdomadaires, et les jours elle prépare ses cacahouètes pour les vendre devant chez elle ou en faisant du porte à porte. Elle c’est une activité qu’elle maitrise bien pour l’avoir exercée depuis 06 ans. L’objet de son financement est de renforcer son activité de petit commerce et son objectif est de réaliser plus de bénéfices afin de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille par la nourriture et la bonne couverture sanitaire.
texts.en:
The Serigne Salou group has been created three years ago. It is composed of eight women, all of whom belong to the same Banc Villageois and live in the same village. They are friends who have decided to organize a borrowing group together; on the average, they are 45 years old of age and have at least four children. Their village has a big weekly market that attracts thousands of visitors. This factor plays a big role in the economic development of the village and its surrounding areas. The new solidarity (group} loan will allow its members to boost their enterprise. Their main line of business is selling local cereals, seafood products, vegetables and ice cream. Mrs. Ndella M., the group leader, is depicted on the photo on the right wearing a light blue outfit with yellow and dark blue flowers. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of two children. She is specializing in selling vegetables on big market days; the rest of the time she prepares peanuts in order to sell them in front of her home or as a door-to-door vendor. She excels at this business as she has been doing it for six years already. The goal of her loan is to strengthen her business allowing her to increase her income in order to help improve the life conditions of her family as concerns nutrition and healthcare.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening the group's business activities

loans.name: Celia Teresa

texts.es:
Celia  vive en la zona D. Rio Seco, ubicada en la ciudad D. El Alto.

Vive en su casa propia, junto a su hija menor, quien se encuentra en edad escolar y le colabora a su madre en su negocio.

Trabaja  en la elaboración D. pan a pequeña escala, cuya producción la venD. en su puesto D. venta ubicado en una D. las zonas céntricas D. la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición D. harina y otros insumos para la mejor producción D. su mercadería. 
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Celia lives in Rio Seco located in the city of El Alto. She lives in her own home with her school-age daughter who helps her mother with her work. She is a small scale bread manufacturer; she sells her products in a centrally located sales stall in the city. She will use the funds to buy flour and other ingredients to improve her merchandise production. This is her first loan with IMPRO; the evaluation conducted indicates that she qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and other ingredients.

loans.name: Yakelin

texts.es:
Yakelin vive en alquiler en un edificio de la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo e hija; la actividad que realiza es la venta de ferretería como ser urinarios, tinas, lava manos, etc. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más mercadería y de esta manera mantener su fuente de ingreso.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO, y por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Yakelin lives in a rented unit in a building in central La Paz. She lives with her husband and daughter. She sells hardware items like urinals, tubs, sinks, etc. The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital, buy more merchandise, and thus maintain her source of income. This is the first time that she is requesting a loan from IMPRO. Because of her character, she is able to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hardware like tubs, sinks, and urinals

loans.name: Tereso

texts.es: Tereso tiene 52 años, está casado con Maritza de 55 años, con quien tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos y con uno de sus nietos en su  vivienda propia. Hace más de 5 años planta café y plátano, trabajo que le ha ayudado a vivir cómodamente junto a su familia. En ocasiones su esposa lo ayuda en el trabajo y más en épocas de cosecha, ya que deben recolectar en el menor tiempo posible los granos de café. Pese que es tedioso ser agricultor, continua firme en su actividad agrícola ya que lo considera muy rentable por que le permite cubrir sus necesidades. Refiere además que le gusta mucho limpiar sus terrenos, de esa manera facilitaría el crecimiento de sus plantaciones, por otro lado le disgusta que los acopiadores traten de regatearle en los precios de sus cosechas, por la ley de la oferta y la demanda, por eso trata de trabajar con asociaciones o consorcios, quienes le pagan un precio justo que lo incentiva a continuar trabajando. Con el tiempo piensa adquirir terrenos propios ya que en la actualidad están cultivando en chacras arrendados, además planea incrementar su producción sobre todo de plátano que le genera ingresos quincenales. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está orgulloso de pertenecer a un grupo muy bien organizado, por eso le agrada laborar con los integrantes de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 7 sacos de fertilizantes, además insumos que impidan el crecimiento de la maleza en sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Tereso, 52, is married to Maritza, 55, with whom he has 5 children. They live with 2 of their children and one of their grandchildren in their own home. For more than 5 years he has cultivated coffee and bananas, work that has helped him to live comfortably with his family. At times his wife helps him with the work, especially during the harvest seasons, since he has to harvest the coffee beans in the least amount of time possible. In spite of the fact that it is tedious to be a farmer, he is committed to his farming activities because he considers them to be very profitable, and this allows him to meet his basic needs. He says also that he very much enjoys clearing his lands, which makes it easier to grow his plants. On the other hand, he dislikes it when the wholesalers haggle over the prices of his harvests referring to the law of supply and demand. For this reason he tries to work with associations or consortia, who pay a fair price that encourages him to keep working. Over time he is thinking about acquiring his own land, since he is currently cultivating on rented fields. In addition, he plans to increase his production, particularly of bananas, which generate bi-weekly income. This is the second time that he has taken a loan with MFP, and he is proud to belong to a well-organized group and is pleased to work with its members. With the loan he requests he will buy 7 bags of fertilizer and supplies to prevent weed growth on his land.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 7 bags of fertilizer and supplies to prevent weed growth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy paint and other work supplies.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El Señor David  vive en casa propia en la zona de Las Lomas, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y sus dos hijas.
El Señor David es empleado en una empresa comercial y su esposa realiza labores de casa, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para el terminado de una habitación que se encuentra en media construcción.
Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
David lives in his own house in the Las Lomas neighborhood located in the western part of La Paz with his wife and two daughters. He is an employee of a commercial firm and his wife works as a domestic employee; their combined income supports the family. He will use the requested funds to finish building a room which is only half done so far. This is his second loan request and the socioeconomic evaluation conducted yielded a positive score so he may have access to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Roxana vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo y sus dos hijos.
La señora Roxana es costurera de  una empresa textil y su esposo es chofer de transporte público, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una cocina e instalación de gas domiciliario, esto mejorará las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Esta es la décima ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Roxana lives in her own house in the Pasankeri area in the western part of the city of La Paz with her husband and two children. Roxana is employed as a seamstress in a textile firm and her husband is a public transportation driver; their combined income supports the family. She will use the requested funds to build a kitchen and have domestic usage gas installed which will improve her family’s living conditions. This is the 10th loan request and the socioeconomic evaluation conducted yielded a positive rating thereby qualifying her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kitchen and pay for gas installation.

loans.name: Jacqueline Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Jacqueline Argentina M. G., tiene 32 años de edad vive en el barrio Waspan Norte habita acompañado de su pareja de vida y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, su esposo vende verduras en los departamentos, ellos tienen una venta de  fritanga desde hace 5 años, y fue con su marido que le apoyo económicamente para la apertura e instalación de su negocio.

Ahora ella solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, que le favorezca  la edificación de un muro con la intención de mejorar la formas de habita que actualmente tienen, sobre todo por la temporada de lluvia que en este mes les ocasiona diversidad de problemas. Esta construción les brindara mejores condiciones socio-economicas para toda su familia y la tranquilidad maternal de favorecer a su crecimiento en optimas condiciones de habitad.
texts.en:
Jacqueline Argentina M. G., 32, lives in the Waspan Norte neighborhood with her life partner and their two small children. Her husband is a vegetable merchant in various departments and they have had a fast-food business for the past 5 years. Her husband gave her the economic help to set up her business. She is asking for funds to buy building materials and supplies so that she can build a wall that will improve the living conditions under which they currently live especially during the rainy season that this month is already causing a variety of problems. This construction will improve the socio-economic conditions of the entire family and provide her with maternal peace of mind knowing that living conditions for her family are optimal.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Porfiria

texts.es:
La señora Porfiria es viuda y vive con el hijo menor en casa propia  en la zona Kenanipata-Pasankeri en la ciudad D. La Paz.
La señora Porfiria  es rentista del magisterio y a la vez venD. comida en la feria D. su zona es así como obtiene sus ingresos .
El crédito solicitado es para comprar una computadora para el hijo y así mejorar su educación.
Esta es la segunda  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y pueD. acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Porfiria is a widow and lives with her youngest son in her own home in the Kenanipata-Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. Porfiria is a retired teacher and sells food in her area’s farmers market; these are her sources of income. She will use the requested funds to buy a computer for her son so that his education may improve. This is her second loan request and the socioeconomic analysis conducted rates her favorably thus qualifying her for access to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La señora Maxima es casada, vive en casa propia con su esposo, que esta ubicada  en la zona alto Chijini D. la ciudad D. La Paz.
La señora Maxima tiene un puesto D. venta en un mercado por el centro y el esposo ayuda trabajando como chofer con movilidad propia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción D. un muro en un terreno ubicado en el alto y D. la cual ella es propietaria.
Esta es la primera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y pueD. acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Maxima is married and lives with her husband in her own house located in the Alto Chijini area of La Paz. Maxima has a sales stand in a downtown market and her husband provides public transportation in his own vehicle. She will use the requested funds to build a wall on a piece of property she owns in El Alto. This is her first loan request and the socioeconomic evaluation conducted rates her favorably qualifying her for access to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Yrene

texts.es: Yrene tiene 31 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo Orlando D. 32 años y sus 3 hijos, en su acogedora casa que es propia D. material rustico a base D. madera y calaminas. Sabe que los esfuerzos que realiza sobre sus cultivos son fundamentales para obtener una cosecha productiva, por eso cada mañana sin interrupciones trabaja en sus cafetales y platanales. Lleva 4 años labrando L. tierra junto a su esposo, paralelamente tienen una tienda D. comestibles que abren en las tardes y los fines D. semana, ya que son los días D. mayor demanda. Lo que más le gusta D. L. agricultura es L. cosecha a pesar D. que le resulta pesado trasladar sus productos hacía el mercado D. su ciudad, pero lo considera rentable por los beneficios que le deja. Por eso planea comprar más terrenos donD. pueda incrementar su productividad D. café, asimismo quiere ampliar y modernizar su bodega. Esta es L. primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y se compromete ser puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas. Además considera a sus compañeras D. su grupo comunal, como personas muy responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, contratará operarios para instalar un vivero D. café.
texts.en:
Yrene, 31, lives in her own house with her husband, Orlando, 32, and their three children. Her cozy house is maD. of rustic materials like boards and metal sheeting. She realizes that the efforts put into her plantings are fundamental to obtaining a productive harvest. Therefore, every morning without exception, she works on her coffee and banana plantings. She has been in this line of work with her husband for the past 4 years. They also have a grocery store that they open during afternoons and weekends because that’s when demand is highest. What she enjoys most about farming is harvesting even though it is hard work to transport the crops to the city’s market; however, the work is profitable and yields good benefits. She is planning to buy more farmland to increase coffee production and she also wants to modernize and enlarge her grocery store. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She also considers her fellow communal bank members to be very responsible people. She will use the requested funds to hire workers to install a coffee nursery.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To hire workers to install a coffee nursery.

loans.name: Regina Virginia

texts.es:
Regina se separó de su esposo hace 7 años; trabaja como contadora en una empresa procesadora de maderas; a la vez teje chompas las cuales son comercializadas en su puesto de la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Tiene un hijo que está a su cargo. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona 16 de Julio de la ciudad del Alto. 

El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de  una maquina de tejer, así podrá terminar más rápido las chompas y por ende tendrá la posibilidad de vender más mercadería.

Es primer crédito con IMPRO y el análisis socio-económico le permite solicitar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Regina separated from her husband 7 years ago; she’s employed as an accountant for a lumber processing firm. In addition, she knits sweaters that she sells in her stall located in the 16 de Julio market in El Alto. She has a son under her care and her home is located in the 16 de Julio neighborhood of El Alto. She will use the funds to buy a knitting machine so that she can finish her sweaters more quickly thereby being able to sell more merchandise. This is her first loan with IMPRO and the socioeconomic analysis conducted qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a knitting machine.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 46 años, comparte su vida con su esposo Guillermo (51), y su joven hijo; juntos viven en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 16 años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que realiza desde la comodidad de su hogar, pues gracias a su esfuerzo logró comprar una vitrina la cual instalo en su sala para ofrecer su mercadería  a  sus amigas y familiares. Gracias al prestigio que tiene Rosa por la provincia en la que vive, es muy visitada por sus clientes las que compran todos los productos que adquiere de una reconocida marca de cosméticos, que ofrece por catálogo. En la actualidad  se encuentra muy contenta porque este trabajo le permite al mismo tiempo trabajar y realizar las labores de su hogar, salvo cuando debe salir a cobrar por los productos ofrecidos, le gusta mucho estar en constante comunicación son sus clientes.Es su tercer crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual con los pagos.Además tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en comprar cantidad de cosméticos para tenerlos en stock y abarrotarse para las próximas celebraciones, por el día del padre, ya que calcula tendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa, 46, shares her life with her husband, Guillermo, 52, and their young son; they all live together in their own home. For the past 16 years she has sold beauty products from home. Thanks to her efforts she was able to acquire a display case that she set up in her living room to display her merchandise to friends and relatives. Thanks to Rosa’s prestige in her neighborhood she is very popular with her customers who buy all the products she gets from a well-known catalogue cosmetics brand. Currently, she is very happy because this business allows her to work while also tending to her home, except when she has to go out to collect payments for her goods.
