She enjoys the constant communication with her customers. This is her 3rd loan request with MFP and she expects to be very punctual with her repayments. In addition, she plans to invest the requested funds in the purchase of large quantities of cosmetics so that she can have them in stock for the upcoming Father’s Day festivities since she expects to have higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to add to her stock.

loans.name: Sope Serigne Assane Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de BAMBAEY SERERE qui abrite le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE ASSANE est crée depuis 03 ans, mais le groupe SOPE SERIGNE ASSANE en tant que tel  a moins d’une année d’existence (6mois). C’est du fait que les membres du groupe ont adhéré au Banc Villageois au cycle dernier et au jour de leur adhésion elles se sont constituées en groupe de solidarité du fait de leur proximité et de leur affinité. Elles sont en moyenne âgées de 35 ans, toutes mariées et mères d’au moins de 2 enfants. Leur principal activité, comme la plus part des femmes du village, est le petit commerce de céréales locales, de glace, d’huile d’arachide et de produits halieutiques. L’existence d’un marché hebdomadaire dans le village contribue beaucoup à la réussite de leur activité commerciale. 

La présidente du Groupe de Solidarité, Madame Oumy Kalsoum D. est née le 29 novembre 1974, elle est âgée de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants en charge. Elle est à l’extrême droite de la photo habillée de tenue marron parsemée de petites rondelles en jaune. Depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois elle fait la transformation et vente d’huile d’arachide. L’objet de son crédit est de développer et de faire la promotion de son activité et son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale tout en prenant en charge ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The BAMBAEY SERERE « Banc Villageois » loan group – which includes the SOPE SERIGNE ASSANE solidarity group – was created three years ago, but the SOPE SERIGNE ASSANE group itself has only existed for less than a year (six months). This is due to the fact that the group members joined the Banc Villageois at the time of last loan cycle, and on the day they joined they set up a solidarity group based on their mutual affinity and proximity to each other. The group members are all married, and on average are 35 years old with at least two children. Their main activity, as for most of the village’s women, is the retail commerce of local grain cereals, ice, peanut oil and seafood products. The existence of a weekly market in the village contributes greatly to the success of their commercial activities. Mrs. Oumy Kalsoum D. is the president of the solidarity group. She is 36 years old (born 29 November 1974), is married and the mother of six children. She is at the far right of the picture, wearing a maroon ensemble dotted with small yellow circles. Since joining the Banc Villageois she manufactures and sells peanut oil. Her loan will serve to develop and promote her activity. Her objective is to assist her husband in managing the family while taking care of her own personal needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote the solidarity group's various commercial activities

loans.name: Nyarko And Co Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is fifty years old, married and the mother of nine children. Her children are from age 5-30 years old. She is friendly and optimistic about the future. Elizabeth has operated a food stall for the past eighteen years to help sustain their family. She serves various local dishes like 'fufu' (a traditional starchy dish), 'banku' (a cornmeal-based staple), rice balls, etc. to people in her community. She anticipates expanding her food business and eventually handing it over to one of her daughters when she retires. Elizabeth says she believes in education and she hopes that her children will attain higher education.

Elizabeth is currently the leader of a trust bank group called 'N. and Co' made up of five members. The other members are engaged in businesses such 'banku' selling, sewing, and maize selling.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SERIGNE FALLOU est créé depuis 03 ans, il est composé de 07 femmes issues toutes de la même localité et âgées en moyenne de 50 ans. Elles ont toutes mariées et mères d’au moins de 3 enfants. Elles ont toutes été 5 fois de crédit, excepté Khady D. et Mayane G. qui viennent d’intégrer le groupe car elles ont adhéré au Banc Villageois au début de ce cycle et viennent de recevoir leur premier crédit. L’activité principale du groupe de solidarité, à l’image des autres femmes du Banc Villageois  est le petit commerce de céréales locales, d’huile d’arachide, de glace et de produits halieutique. Et la présence du marché hebdomadaire dans le village contribue beaucoup à la réussite des initiatives économiques des femmes et de la localité en général.

Madame Laba G., la présidente du Groupe de Solidarité, à droite de la photo en tenue blanche avec des fleurettes vertes est âgée de 55 ans enfants en charge. Elle est détentrice d’une boutique à domicile, une boutique qui est fonctionnelle depuis 10 ans. Elle y vend divers produits comme du riz, du sucre, de l’huile, des biscuits, de l’aliment de bétail etc. l’objet de son crédit est de renforcer son activité afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices qui lui permettront de mieux participer à la prise en charge de sa famille et de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The Serigne Fallou loan group was created three years ago and is comprised of 7 women who all come from the same area and are on average 50 years of age. They are married and each has at least three children. Most have made 5 loans, with the exception of Khady D. and Mayane G. who have recently joined the group and were formally with the Village Bank. They will be making their first loan. As with many of the women in the Village Bank, the main business of the group is the local sale of cereal grains, peanut oil, ice and fish products. The presence of a weekly market in the village has greatly aided the small businesses these local women and the area in general. Mrs Laba G., the president of the loan group is 55 years old and is raising children. She is on the right of the photo, wearing a white robe with green flowers. She has maintained a shop out of her house for the past 10 years and sells various products such as rice,sugar, oil, biscuits, and feed for animals. She would like to use the loan to strengthen her business and earn greater profits which will enable her to meet her family and personal needs.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote the businesses of this loan group

loans.name: William

texts.es: William de 22 años, vive en la casa de su familia, pues aún es soltero.Desde hace 5 años, se dedica a la venta de CDs, actividad que lo mantiene ocupado durante todo el día, pues la actividad la realiza de forma ambulatoria. Usualmente sale desde tempranas horas de la mañana, si quiere obtener las ventas deseadas, y ofrece variedad de CDs de películas, juegos, programas de computadora, entre otros. Gracias a su empeño y carisma  tiene buenas ventas, y se ha hecho muy conocido por la variedad de mercadería que ofrece. En el futuro quisiera instalar un negocio más estable, en su casa pero aún no tiene claro lo que realizara, es por esta razón que se viene dedicando a su trabajo por completo.Es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y es  muy puntual con todos los pagos de sus cuotas.William tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería pues desea aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
William, 22, lives in his family’s house because he’s still single. For the past 5 years he has sold CDs, an activity that keeps him busy all day because he is an itinerant salesman. If he is to have the desired sales, he must start out very early in the morning offering a variety of movie CDs, games, computer programs, etc. Thanks to his efforts and charisma his sales are good and he has become very well-known thanks to the variety of goods he stocks. In the future, he’d like to set up a more stable business in his home but he’s not sure what this will be so he has been completely dedicated to his work to date. This is his 4th loan with MFP and has been very punctual with all his installment payments. William plans to use the requested funds to buy a larger amount of merchandise because he wants to increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his business.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es: Dionisio tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva tropical peruana, ubicada en la comunidad de Manitea Alta, donde tienen su casa propia a base de madera. Reconoce que en su valle se dedican a la actividad agrícola, por las tierras fértiles que abundan en su geografía, es por ello que aprovechó cultivando café en grandes cantidades, eso le daría mucha ventaja en la comercialización. Pero quiso aumentar su producción plantando cacao, de esa manera asegura sus ingresos económicos y pueda cumplir sus compromisos de manera eficiente y eficaz. Es por ello que sus clientes se sienten contentos por la responsabilidad y puntualidad que da Dionisio. Parte de su éxito, es el estar bien involucrado en su trabajo, donde trabaja en conjunto con su familia, pero en temporadas de cosecha necesita la ayuda de sus peones para que le facilite la extracción de sus productos de cacao y café. No contento con lo logrado, anhela en un futuro diversificar sus productos, sembrando frutas cítricas, con el propósito de mejorar su mercado. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera oportuna, además, se siente satisfecho con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita le servirá para mejorar sus plantaciones de cacao, introduciendo insumos y abonos, con la finalidad de que no afecten la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Dionisio is 41 years old, married, and has three children. He and his family live in their own wooden house in the community of Manitea Alta, which is located in the beautiful tropical jungle of Peru. This area is known for its farming activity due to the abundance of fertile land. Coffee is grown here in large quantities, which gives this area a great advantage in the marketplace. Dionisio wants to increase his production by planting cacao so that he can generate more income to meet his commitments in an efficient and effective manner. His customers are happy because he is responsible and punctual. Part of his success is attributed to being deeply committed to his work and having the assistance of his family. During the harvest season, he needs workers to help facilitate the gathering of his cacao and coffee crops. Not yet satisfied with his progress, Dionisio has future plans to diversify his products. He hopes to grow citrus fruits in order to improve his position in the market.

This is his sixth loan with MFP. Dionisio promises to submit his payments in a timely manner. He is also satisfied with his Communal Bank. With the loan he requested, Dionisio plans to improve his cacao production by purchasing supplies and compost without affecting the quality of his product.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies & compost

loans.name: Masedonia

texts.es: Masedonia, de 47 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su hijo, que es mayor.Desde hace 6 años, se dedica a la venta de enseres, golosinas y regalos en general, en un puesto que tiene en un mercado muy concurrido, que esta ubicado por la zona donde  vive. Ella  se siente muy contenta con su trabajo, pues con sus vecinas de puesto ha hecho buena amistad y además realiza su trabajo tranquilamente, ofreciendo la variedad de sus productos a sus clientes. Las ventas son buenas, porque su puesto esta muy bien ubicado, además su carisma y buen trato a la clientela han hecho que su negocio sea visitado frecuentemente, es por eso que le pone todo el empeño a su trabajo y en el futuro espera verlo mas amplio y mejor implementado.Es el primer préstamo con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual en los pagos de todas sus cuotas.Masedonia tiene planeado invertir el dinero del crédito en comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Masedonia is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her adult son. For the past six years, she has been selling personal accessories, candy, and gifts from a vending post at a well-known market in the district where she lives. She is very happy with her work because it has allowed her to develop good friendships with other vendors in the market. Masedonia is able to work peacefully and offers a variety of products to her customers. Her sales are good because her post is in a good location. Due to her charisma and the good service she provides her customers, her business is visited frequently. She invests all of her efforts into her work and in the future she hopes expand and improve her business.

This is her first loan with MFP. Masedonia promises to be prompt with all of her payments. She plans to invest the funds from her loan in a large quantity of merchandise to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise for her business

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna BÂ est âgée de 60 ans, elle est mariée coépouse et mère de 09 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de CENTRE2 depuis le 08 avril 2004 et a 06 fois de suite reçu de crédit et a toujours remboursé régulièrement. Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus teintés. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va augmenter son renforcer son activité en augmentant sa quantité d’approvisionnement. Son objectif principal est de participer à la nourriture de la famille et au payement de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Maïmouna BÂ, 60, is married (as a co-spouse) and the mother of 9 children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of CENTRE2 since April 8, 2004 and has received 6 consecutive loans, all of which she reimbursed correctly. She has a small business selling dyed cloth. With her new loan, she is going to expand her business by increasing her inventory. Her principle goal is to help feed her family and pay school fees for her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: develop and expand her cloth business

loans.name: Adama Oumar

texts.fr: Adama Oumar D. est une femme de 41 ans, elle mariée sans enfants mais tutrice de 7 enfants qui lui sont confiés par des parents et des proches. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTIHIANG AÏDARA depuis 2006 et a 7 fois de suite reçu de crédit qu’elle a toujours bien géré et remboursé à temps. Elle est vendeuse de tissus et son nouveau crédit lui permettra à mieux développer son activité. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de sa vente lui permettent de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adama Oumar D., 41, is married without biological children, but is the guardian of seven children who have been confided to her by their parents or by other kinfolks. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of SINTIHIANG AÏDARA since 2006 and has received seven consecutive loans which she put to good use and reimbursed in a timely manner. She sells cloth, and her new loan will allow her to expand her business. The profit from her sales will permit her to help improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her cloth business

loans.name: Minsito

texts.fr: Minsito T. est une femme de 59 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge elle est également tutrice de 02 autres enfants confiés par des proches. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAMBA 15 ANS2 depuis le 17 juillet 2006. Elle a 2 activités qui consistent la vente de tissus teinté et la vente de glace et de jus de fruits naturel. L’objet de son crédit est de renforcer son activité et son objectif est d’assurer le payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et de participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Minsito T., 59, is married and raising five children; she is also the guardian of two other children, confided to her by their kinfolks. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of SAMBA 15 ANS2 since July 17, 2006. She has two businesses, selling dyed cloth and also selling ice and natural fruit juice. The goal of her loan is to bolster her business and her intent is to make sure she can pay school fees for her children and participate in covering family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: develop and promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata S. est âgée de 31 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants ; un garçon et une fille. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINYHIANG HOULATA depuis le 03 mars 2006 et a 08 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle est vendeuse de tissus et fait aussi la transformation et vente de pâte d’arachide depuis plus de 4 ans. Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices et augmenter son niveau d’épargne. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Aminata S. is 31 years old, married and the mother of two: a boy and a girl. She has been a member of the Sinyhiang Houlata Banc Villageois lending group since March 3, 2006 and has received 8 successive loans. She is a vendor of fabrics and has also performed the conversion and sale of peanut butter for 4 years. Her loan will allow her to strengthen her business in order to achieve greater profits and expand her savings. She supports her husband in providing for their family.

Translated from French by Jessalyn Pinneo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her revenue-generating activities

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar es productor lechero y a la vez trabaja como albañil, siendo estas actividades sus principales fuentes de ingreso con las que cubre la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Arasaya Chico de Achacachi, a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera para incrementar su producción de leche.
 
Es segundo crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo
texts.en:
Edgar is a milk producer and occasionally works as a bricklayer. These activities are the main sources of income by which he supports his family. His home is located in the community of Arasaya Chico de Achacachi, which is two hours away from the city of El Alto.

This loan will be used to buy a dairy cow so that he can increase his milk production. He is requesting his second loan with IMPRO. His good payment history allows him to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Bintou B. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge dont 03 de sa coépouse. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAMBA 15ANS1 dont elle est la présidente depuis la date d’inauguration dudit Banc Villageois le 19 juillet 2002. Elle a 15 fois de suite reçu de crédit et n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement.  Elle a construit à domicile un petit poulailler où elle élève des poulets de chaire. A côté de cette activité elle fait un petit commerce de tissus teinté et vend devant sa maison sur u e étale de fortune le petit déjeuné. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari pour la nourriture de la famille d’une part, et d’autre part augmenter son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
Bintou B. is a 48-year old woman, married and taking care of five children, three of whom are her husband’s by another wife. She has been the Chair of the Banc Villageois of SAMBA 15ANS1 since its launching on July 19, 2002. She had obtained loans 15 times and never had any problems repaying them. She has built a small chicken coop by her home and raises broiler chickens. In addition, she also earns a bit of money selling dyed fabrics in the mornings in front of her house using a makeshift stand. Her goal is, on the one hand, to help her husband support the family, and on the other hand, increase her savings.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her business capital

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es:
Alejo trabaja como carpintero y tiene su propio taller; su esposa le colabora en el trabajo. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Franz Tamayo  de la ciudad de el Alto. 

El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una maquina.
 
Es tercer crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Alejo is a carpenter and has his own workshop. His wife helps him with his work. Their home is located in the Franz Tamayo District of the city of El Alto.

This loan will be used to purchase a machine. He is requesting his third loan with IMPRO. His good payment history allows him the opportunity to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase equipment for work

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
Florencio es chofer propietario y trabaja  como transportista inter-provincial La Paz – Sahapaqui; esta es su  principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona Villa Bolivar “D”  de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la Transformación de su movilidad de gasolina a gas liquado, que cuesta mucho menos que la gasolina.
 
Es primer crédito con IMPRO, y el análisis de su flojo de fondos le permite solicitar este crédito.
texts.en:
Florencio is an independent driver and works along the inter-provincial route between La Paz and Sahapaqui. His business is the main source of income by which he supports his family. Florencio’s home is located in the District of Villa Bolivar “D” in the city of El Alto.

This loan will be used to convert his vehicle from gasoline to natural gas, since the cost of natural gas is less than gasoline. He is requesting his first loan from IMPRO. The analysis of his cash flow indicates he is able to request this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Convert his vehicle from gasoline to natural gas

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D. est âgée de 54 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KOUNKANE VW depuis le 28 aout 2006 et a  7 fois de suite reçu de crédit. C’est un membre fidèle et très dans les différentes rencontres du groupe. Elle est ambitieuse et pour preuve, avec les bénéfices qu’elle réalise à partir de son petit commerce de légumes et de produits halieutiques elle a construit une modeste maison composée de deux chambres  pour ses enfants. Son  prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité et de réaliser des bénéfices qui serviront à contribuer au bien-être familial.
texts.en:
Mariama D. is 54 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Kounkane VW since August 28, 2006, and obtained loans seven times in the past. She is very dedicated and active in group meetings. She is ambitious, which is demonstrated by the fact that she was able to earn enough money from her business selling vegetables and seafood to have a modest two-room house built for her children. This loan will allow her to bolster her business and earn an income which will serve to improve the family’s life conditions.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her  business capital and expand her enterprise

loans.name: Candor Paulina

texts.es:
La señora Candor vive en casa propia en la zona de Alto San Pedro de La Paz.
La señora Candor es profesora de lenguaje por lo cual percibe 
ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para el pago de impuestos de su casa.
Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Candor lives in her own home in the District of Alto San Pedro in La Paz. She works as a language teacher in order to earn the income needed to support herself.

The loan she is requesting will be used to pay the property taxes on her house. This is the fourth time she has requested a loan. The socioeconomic analysis indicates she has a favorable rating and is qualified to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay the property taxes on her house

loans.name: Damiana Ana

texts.es:
La señora Damiana vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera y no tiene  hijos.
La señora es comerciante; se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa viajando por el interior del país.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de dos habitaciones, para  mejorar la calidad de vida.
Esta es la novena ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Damiana lives in her own home in the District of Pasankeri, which is on the west side of the city of La Paz. She is single and does not have children.

Damiana is a businesswoman who buys and sells clothing as a traveling merchant throughout the interior of the country. The loan she is requesting will be used to renovate two rooms to improve her quality of life.

This is the ninth time she has requested a loan. The socioeconomic analysis indicates she has a favorable rating and is qualified to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovation of two rooms

loans.name: Jesús Reynaldo

texts.es:
El señor Jesús Reynaldo vive en casa en anticretico la zona de Alto Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Jesús es comerciante atiende un servicio de Internet y vende tarjetas para  teléfonos celulares, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para anticretico de una tienda más amplia ya que Jesús vive en la misma habitación y el espacio no es el suficiente.
Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Jesús Reynaldo lives in the District of Alto Lojeta, which is on the west side of the city of La Paz. His house was acquired through an “anticrético” lease agreement. (In an “anticrético” arrangement, the owner leases property for a lump sum deposit in lieu of monthly rent. At the end of the lease period, the money is returned to the renter. If the owner fails to repay the money, the renter gets to keep the property.)

Sr. Jesús is a businessman who manages an Internet café and sells calling cards for mobile phones, which generate the income he needs to support himself.

The loan he is requesting will be used to enter into an “anticrético” lease for a larger space for his business. Since Jesús also lives in the same location where he works, the space he currently has is not sufficient.

This is the first time he has requested a loan. The socioeconomic analysis indicates he has a favorable rating and is qualified to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Enter into an “anticrético” lease agreement for his business

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Daysi vive en anticrético (es una forma legal de alquilar una habitación, departamento o casa, por un tiempo pre determinado y por un monto de dinero que se estipula en el contrato y que se paga por adelantado y es devuelto al final del contrato) en la zona alto San Pedro, es soltera y vive sola.
Daysi trabaja de cajera en una casa de cambios durante 5 años, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para aumentar el anticretico de su vivienda.  
Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Daysi lives in an “anticrético” rental unit (a legal method in Bolivia for renting a room, apartment, or house in which an amount of money stipulated in the contract is paid in advance and returned at the end of the contract period). Her home is in the District of Alto San Pedro. Daysi is single and lives alone.

She has worked as a cashier at a currency exchange house for the past five years in order to support herself. The loan she is requesting will be used to extend the “anticrético” rental agreement on her home. This is the first time she has requested a loan. The socioeconomic analysis indicates she has a favorable rating and is qualified to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Extend the “anticrético” rental agreement on her home

loans.name: Alba Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Exaltación, se reúne la Asociación Comunal ALBA.
Las integrantes D. esta Asociación tienen variados negocios que se dedican a la comercialización, producción y servicio.
Una D. las integrante es Ofelia Ana A. D. 25 años, ella ocupa el cargo D. Presidenta y trabaja con la familia D. Pro Mujer hace 6 meses. Ofelia se dedica a la venta D. conservas y licores hace 5 años, aprendió el negocio D. su madre. En esta oportunidad necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para luego vender en el mercado  satélite todos los días D. 8 D. la mañana a 6 D. la tarD..
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Alba” (Daybreak) meets at the Exaltación Community Center. The members of the Association engage in different businesses in the retail, manufacturing, and service sectors.

One of the members is Ofelia Ana A., who is 25 years old. She currently serves as President of the group and has worked with the Pro Mujer family for six months. Ofelia has been selling canned goods and liquor for five years. She learned this business from her mother. For this opportunity, she needs a loan to buy merchandise to sell at a satellite market. She works every day from 8am to 6pm.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Facundo

texts.es:
El señor Facundo vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera norte de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y tres hijos.
El señor Facundo es albañil y su esposa vende comida en un puesto de venta en su barrio, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un muro de ladrillo y  refacción de su cocina que mejorará las condiciones de vida de su familia, ya que podrá instalar gas en su vivienda
Esta es la quinta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Facundo lives in his own house in the Pasankeri area on the north side of La Paz. He lives with his wife and three children. Mr. Facundo is a mason and his wife sells food from a stand in their neighborhood. They support their family with this income. He is requesting this loan for the construction of a brick wall and to remodel their kitchen. It will improve his family's quality of life, since he will be able to install a gas line in their home. This is the fifth time that he is requesting a loan. The socioeconomic analysis performed rated him favorably and he qualifies for this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kitchen remodeling

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 45 años, vive con su madre en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la fabricación y venta de zapatos, que  vende en la ciudad donde vive, además también envía estos calzados a la capital del país donde son muy demandados. Gracias al empeño  y entusiasmo que le ha puesto a su negocio, este ha ido creciendo de a pocos  y ahora recibe gran cantidad de pedidos. Es por esta razón que esta muy satisfecha porque quiere expandir su negocio de venta de calzado, hasta convertirlo en uno de los más prósperos de la ciudad. Las ventas son buenas y trabaja incansablemente escuchando música, lo cual le da los ánimos para terminar los pedidos que tiene pendientes, al lado de sus ayudantes.Es su primer préstamo con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con los pagos de todas sus  cuotas.Rosa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  mayor cantidad de material que necesita para elaborar sus calzados.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 45, lives with her mother in her own house. She has been making and selling shoes for ten years. She sells in the city where she lives. She also sends this footwear to the capital of the country where they are much in demand. Thanks to the effort and enthusiasm that she has put into her work, her business has been slowly growing. Now she gets a lot of orders. That is why she is very happy; she wants to expand her business of selling footwear. She wants it to become one of the most prosperous in the city. Sales are good, and she works tirelessly listening to music. The music encourages her to finish, along side of her helpers, the pending orders that she has. This is her first loan with MFP. She pledges to be very punctual with her payments. Rosa plans to invest the requested money buy purchasing a great amount of material that she needs to make shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials she needs for her business

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es:
El señor Franklin vive en casa propia en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Franklin es chofer de radio taxi, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
Su vivienda no fue terminada por lo que le falta el acabado en interiores, el crédito solicitado es para la construcción y refacción de pisos y cielo falso para mejorar la calidad de su vivienda.
Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Franklin lives in his own house in the Alto Irpavi area of the city of La Paz. Franklin is a radio taxi driver. He supports himself with this income. His house was not finished; it lacks the finishings on the inside. The requested loan is for the construction and refurbishment of the floors and dropped ceiling. This will improve the quality of his house. This is the first time that he has asked for a loan. The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbishment

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou D. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 06 en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG AÏDARA dont elle est la trésorière depuis  le 28 janvier 2003. Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus depuis plus de 05 ans et l’objet de son crédit est de renforcer son activité et de servir le plus largement de clients. Deux de ces enfants sont à l’université et son objectif principal est de les soutenir financièrement dans leurs études.
texts.en:
Aissatou D. is a 47 years old woman, married and mother of six children, all of them over six years old. She is a member of the Village Bank of Sinthiang AIDAR; she has been the Treasurer since January 28, 2003. She has run a small textile business for over five years and with this loan she wants to improve her business and better respond to her customers demand. Two of her children are in college and she wants to be able to support them financially in their studies.

Translated from French by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve a textile business

loans.name: 24 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, Villa Tejada, recientemente se conformo la Asociación Comunal 24 de Mayo. Su presidenta es Ricarda C. de 39 años, comenta que se dedica a vender ropa de lunes a domingo, en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, ofreciendo a diferentes personas, su horario de ventas es de3 de la tarde a 8 de la noche, necesita el préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo, comprando mercadería y ofertar  variadas prendas de vestir a sus clientes.

Las demás  integrantes de esta Asociación tienen variados negocios que se dedican a la comercialización, producción y servicio.
texts.en:
The community association '24 de Mayo' was recently formed in one of Pro Mujer´s community centres in Villa Tejada. Their president is Ricarda C., 39 years of age, who sells clothes 7 days a week in different markets in the city of El Alto. She works from 3 in the afternoon until 8 at night, and needs this loan to increase her working capital to buy merchandise and other items of clothing for her customers. The other members of this association have various businesses in the commercial, production and service industries.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata S. est une femme de 30 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge et tutrice de 2 autres. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de SAMBA 15 ANS2 depuis 3 ans et demi et a 7 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus, de chaussures pour dames  et de bijoux. Avec son nouveau elle va renforcer son activité et réaliser des bénéfices qui lui permettront d’augmenter son épargne et de prendre en charge ses enfants par rapport à la scolarité et l’habillement.
texts.en:
Fatoumata S. is a 30-year old woman. She is married and the mother of six children and the guardian of two other. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” Samba 15ANS2 for three and half years, and has received seven consecutive loans. She has a small retail business selling fabric, women’ s shoes and jewelry. With her new loan she will strengthen her activity and make profits that will allow her to increase her savings and to take care of her children’ s school fees and clothing needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her working capital

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra tiene 54 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Juntos residen en la comunidad de Manitea Alta, localizada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen  su propia casa a base de madera. Alejandra siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona original y creativa, por lo que sabe como llevar a cabo las relaciones con los compradores potenciales. En la actualidad comparte el liderazgo en su comunidad con otro productor, siendo el cacao, café y la hoja de coca, productos que trabaja con mucho esmero. Sin embargo una de las dificultades que se presentan son los continuos derrumbes que hay en el camino y eso le impide a vender toda su mercadería. Su mayor anhelo es ser la primera productora dentro de su comunidad, para ello piensa comprar terrenos de otros productores que no le estén dando buen uso, para que pueda producir allí en mayor escala. Por lo general su producto los vende en su misma chacra, con la finalidad de minimizar costo y tiempo, en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposo, pero generalmente tiene peones que se encargan de la cosecha. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus compromisos de pago, además esta conforme por la responsabilidad y puntualidad que ejercen cada de uno de sus socios dentro de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comrpará fertilizantes que le servirá para mejorar sus plantaciones de cacao y de esa manera prevenir cualquier inconveniente que pueda repercutir en sus plantaciones agrícolas.
texts.en:
Alejandra, 54, is married and has three children. They live together in Manitea Alta located on the Amazonian side of the eastern Andes where they have their own wood house. Alejandra has always been noted for being very original and creative; she knows how to relate to potential buyers. She is currently co-leader in her community with another producer. The main crops are: cocoa beans, coffee and coca leaves, all products that she grows diligently. However, a recurrent problem is the constant landslides on the road which prevents her from selling all her product. Her greatest wish is to become the main producer in her community and to accomplish this she plans to buy more land from other producers that aren’t maximizing their use so that she can produce there on a greater scale. Generally, she sells from her own fields in order to minimize costs and time. Occasionally her husband helps her but she usually has field hands to bring in the harvest. This is her 6th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She is also quite satisfied with the responsibility and punctuality of her fellow group members. She will use the requested funds to buy fertilizers to improve her cocoa bean crops so that she can prevent any inconvenience that might adversely affect her plants.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es:
Jonathan es un emprendedor joven de 25 años de edad, el vive en la casa de sus padres con sus hermanos. Hace más de 3 años se dedica a vender soporte de motores para carros, pues tiene un pequeño taller en el cual labora durante todo el día. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le permite brindarle bienestar a su familia, por otro lado esta labor requiere de esfuerzo físico y por ello debe ponerle mucho empeño y ganas. En un futuro desea instalar un negocio propio, pero aún tiene tiempo para saber cual le será rentable. Jonathan sabe que con la ayuda de su familia podrá salir adelante. 

Este es su quinto crédito con MFP siendo muy puntual y responsable con los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará algunas herramientas que le son necesarias para la refacción de los motores.
texts.en:
Jonathan is an enterprising young 25-year-old who lives in his parents' house along with his siblings. For more than three years, he has sold car motors, and has his own shop where he works full time. He really enjoys his work, since it allows him to provide for his family's wellbeing. It's also a job that requires a lot of physical exertion, so he has to work hard with lots of enthusiasm. In the future he would like to open his own business, but he still has time to figure out what would be most profitable. Jonathan knows that with his family's help, he will get ahead in life. This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he has always been very punctual and responsible in making his payments. With the requested loan, he will buy some tools for motor repair.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Comprar herramientas para arreglar motores.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 42 años, vive con su esposo José Carlos, y la familia (esposa e hija) de su hijo mayor David (23). Todos juntos  habitan  su casa que es propia.Desde hace 5 años, se dedica  a brindar el servicio de transporte en el vehículo que adquirieron gracias a su arduo esfuerzo, pues tuvieron que dejarlo todo en el norte (donde vivían) y trasladarse a la capital del Perú, por el bienestar y educación de su hijo. Actualmente como ya no tienen que mantener a su hijo, trabajan con mayor tranquilidad, pues María administra el taxi, el cual maneja su esposo; así ambos son un equipo y se apoyan para salir adelante. El trabajo no es nada fácil pues el auto al estar constantemente trabajando, sufre algunas averías, por lo que cada cierto tiempo necesita de mantenimiento. Es por esta razón que María se encarga de velar por el buen funcionamiento del negocio. Así administra  las ganancias y las inversiones, además ya tiene planeado para el futuro adquirir otro auto para brindarlo en alquiler.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a ser muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Para el futuro tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en refaccionar su auto, para que brinde un mejor servicio, y así espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old. She and her husband José Carlos live in their own house with their daughter and the family of their oldest son David (age 23). For the past five years, she has been providing transportation services using the vehicle she acquired through her hard work. María and her family had to leave everything behind in the north (where the previously lived) and move to the capital of Peru for the welfare and education of their children. They no longer have to support their children, so she and her husband can work with greater ease. María manages the taxi while her husband actually drives the vehicle. They both work as a team in order to get ahead. The work is never easy because the taxi is constantly in use and often requires maintenance due to the damage it has suffered. Since she is responsible for making the business run smoothly, she plans to use her profits and savings to acquire another vehicle in the future to offer for rent.

This is her second loan with MFP. María promises to be prompt with her payments. She plans to invest the money she requested in repairs to her vehicle so that she can provide better service. Maria hopes to continue making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs & maintenance

loans.name: Ndioro

texts.fr: Ndioro D. est âgée de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAMBA 15 ANS2 depuis le 05 aout 2003 et a 13 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle fait un petit commerce d’huile de palme et fait aussi la transformation et vente de pâte d’arachide. Elle a une bonne expérience en la matière pour l’avoir pratiquée depuis plus de 5 ans et l’objet de son crédit est de renforcer son activité. Son objectif est de contribuer à la prise en charge familiale tout en augmentant ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Ndioro D. is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” Samba 15ANS2 since August 5, 2003 and has received 13 consecutive loans. She has a small retail business where she sells palm oil but also processes and sells peanut butter. She masters this trade having practiced it for over five years. The reason for her loan is to strengthen her activity. Her goal is to participate in providing for the family’s expenses while increasing her savings.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her commercial activities

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es: Leoncio, de 33 años, es casado y tiene 4 hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la comunidad de Manitea Alta, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Para Leoncio “la primera empresa es su familia”, a pesar que tiene primaria incompleta, no se amilana ante nada, tuvo la osadía de repotenciar el rubro agrícola que su padre no lo supo aprovechar en su momento. Después de un tiempo rindieron frutos, tanto de cacao y café, por lo que fueron vendidos a los mayoristas, sin embargo lo estafaron, pero rápidamente se levantó. Hoy esta inmerso en su trabajo, ya que tiene grandes pedidos de sus compradores potenciales, desde luego que trata de sacarlo el jugo a su terreno de cultivo, con el propósito de que pueda cumplir durante las fechas pactadas. Por lo general recibe la ayuda de su esposa, pero en tiempo de cosecha necesita de sus peones para que le faciliten la extracción y traslado de sus productos a los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad. Sus planes a futuro es instalar una tienda de abarrotes para que su esposa este a cargo de ella, por consiguiente tengan un ingreso extra para que aporte a  los gastos de la familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera oportuna durante las fechas establecidas, además se siente respaldado por su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita le servirá para comprar insumos y abono, con la finalidad de mejorar sus plantaciones de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Leoncio is 33 years old, married, and has four school age children. They live in their own wooden house in the community of Manitea Alta, located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle. Leoncio says his family is “his first priority”. Despite not finishing elementary school, he remained undaunted and was able to achieve a level of success in agriculture that his father was not able to attain. After his first crops of cacao and coffee were ready to be harvested, he sold his products to wholesalers who swindled him, but he quickly recovered from this incident. Today he is totally immersed in his work. Since he already has large orders from potential buyers, he wants to get most the bounty from his farmland so that he can meet his contractual obligations. His wife helps him with the work, but during the harvest season, he needs laborers to facilitate the gathering and transporting of his products to the local collection centers. His plans for the future include opening a grocery store that his wife will manage so that they can continue generating extra income to help with the family expenses.

This is his first loan with MFP. Leoncio promises to submit his payments by the established deadlines. He feels supported by his Communal Bank. The loan he requested will be used to buy farming supplies and compost so that he can improve his cacao and coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies & compost

loans.name: Quiere Al Niño Group

texts.es:
La unidad e integración son las características de esta Alcancía Comunal que viene cursando el ciclo 13. Las socias se dedican a diferentes tipos de trabajos que le permiten atender sus necesidades básicas, es el caso de Elias quien trabaja diariamente prestando servicio de mototaxi hace 8 años, el tiene 7 hijos quienes son la razón para buscar su prosperidad, el préstamo recibido lo invertirá en los arreglos y mejoras de algunas autopartes de su mototaxi. Asimismo Tania se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido hace 1 año, ella es casada y todo su esfuezo es por sus 3 hijos. 

Los socios de la Alcancia Comunal manifiestan que existe gran competencia en los negocios, pero eso no las desanima ya que tienen clientes fieles que compran dia a dia. El crédito recibido lo utilizaran para la compra de productos e insumos que les permitan mejorar sus ingresos. 

** Se ha colocado la Foto de la Srta. Judith Margot O. B., en la parte superior derecha de la foto principal, pues no se encontraba al momento de tomar la foto de todo el grupo **
texts.en:
Unity and teamwork characterize the Community Bank Quiere al Niño, which is in its 13th loan cycle. Members of Quiere al Niño pursue different kinds of work in order to meet their basic needs. For example, Elias has worked daily, for 8 years, as a motorcycle taxi driver. He has seven children. They are his reason for seeking greater financial security. He plans to put the loan towards auto part repairs and improvements for his motorcycle taxi. Also, Tania has worked for a year selling made-to-order clothing. She is married and has three children, who she works very hard to support. The members of Quiere al Niño indicate that there is a great deal of competition in their respective businesses. However, this does not discourage them given that they have loyal customers who use their services on a daily basis. The loan will be used to buy materials that will help them achieve a higher income. ** Miss Judith Margot O. B.'s foto is in the upper righthand corner, since she was not present when the group photo was taken.**

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products and supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth Deyce

texts.es: La solicitante es separada, tiene un negocio de venta de regalos y pasamaneria, vive junto con sus dos hijas en la casa de sus padres en la Tinguiña, su puesto de negocio se en encuentra en centro comercial Miguel Grau en la calle Cajamarca. El destino del credito es para capital de trabajo compra de mercaderia por campaña del dia del padre
texts.en:
Elizabeth is separated from her husband and operates a party supply and gift shop. She lives at her parents’ house in La Tinguiña with her two daughters. Her business is located in the Miguel Grau shopping center on Cajamarca Street.

This loan will be used as operating capital to buy merchandise for Father’s Day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for Father's Day

loans.name: Bolivia Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Exaltación, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal BOLIVIA. Se agruparon por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les permita mejorar sus negocios.

Las integrantes de esta Asociación tienen variados negocios del área de producción, servicio y comercio. 
Un ejemplo claro es Teodora Celia S. Q. de 43 años, que trabaja con la familia de Pro Mujer hace 5 años se dedica a vender  productos de belleza como cremas, pefumes y otros  a diferentes oficinas, mercados y ofreciendo puerta a puerta. Ella tiene 4 hijos es casada y los ingresos del negocio le permite cubrir necesidades básicas de su familia.
Por otro lado a Teodora Celia le gusta asistir al consultorio para hacerse una revisión general.

En esta oportunidad esta solicitando $us.- 500 el mismo tiene planificado invertir en su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de productos.

Las demás integrantes de este asociación tienen diferentes negocios que se dedican a la producción, servicio y comercio y necesitan el prestamo para invertir en los mismos.
texts.en:
The Bolivia Communal Association meets every two weeks at the Exaltación Community Center. They decided to form a group in order to access the capital needed to improve their businesses. The members of this association have different businesses in the manufacturing, service, and retail sectors. One example is Teodora Celia S. Q.. She is 43 years old and has been working with the Pro Mujer family for five years. Celia sells beauty products such as crèmes, perfumes, and other products at different office buildings, markets, and door to door. She is married and has four children, so the income from her business enables her to cover the basic needs of her family. Teodora Celia also enjoys the benefit of going to the medical clinic in order to receive a general check-up. At the moment, she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a large quantity of products for her business. As mentioned earlier, the other members of this association work in manufacturing, services, and retail, so they need a loan to invest in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Senelia

texts.es:
Maria Senelia de 36 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Calixto Suarez, tienen 4 hijos: Ma. Elena de 23 años quien trabaja y ayuda a sus padres con los gastos, Jader de 20 años, Selena de 15 y Gabrielita de 12 años, los menores estudian. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien asume los gastos del hogar. Doña Maria Senelia trabaja como empleada domestica para el cyber Villanueva desde hace mas de 15 años, ganandose la confianza, cariño y el respeto de esta familia que en todo momento la apoyan.  

Maria esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de seguir mejorando su vivienda, pero esta vez solicitandole apoyo a kiva, pues desea levantar una tapia para asegurar su vivienda y si el dinero lo permite reparar las ventanas y puertas que se encuentran en mal estado.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder tener una vivienda bonita y con las condiciones necesarias para que su familia se sienta comoda.
texts.en:
Maria Senelia is 36 years old and married to Sr. Calixto Suarez. They have four children. Ma. Elena is 23 years old, has a job, and helps her parents with the expenses. Jader is 20 years old. Selena is 15 and Gabrielita is 12; both are in school. Maria has the support of her husband who takes care of the household expenses. She has been working as a housekeeper for the Villanueva family for more than 15 years and has earned their trust, affection, respect, and support throughout this entire time.

Maria is requesting her third loan so that she can continue making improvements to her home, but this time she is seeking assistance through Kiva. She wants to put up a fence to secure her home and, if there is money left over, repair the windows and doors that are in poor condition.

Her greatest wish is to have a beautiful home with all the necessities to make her family comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a fence and repair windows and doors

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: Françoise D. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est veuve et vit avec ses 7 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 6 ans et demi et a 13 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus teinté depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois en 2003. Une activité qu’elle maitrise bien et qui lui procure des bénéfices qui l’ont aidé à construire une maison pour sa progéniture. L’objet de son crédit est de renforcer son activité et son objectif est de prendre en charge ses enfants et de répondre à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Françoise D. is a 47 year-old woman. She is a widow and lives with her seven children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” for six and a half years and has received 13 consecutive loans, and never had a problem paying back. Since she became a member of the “Banc Villageois” in 2003 she has had a small retail business where she sells dyed fabric. She masters this trade very well and she derives her profit. That has helped her to a house for her offspring. The reason for her loan is to strengthen her activity. Her goal is to provide for her children and to meet her personal needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her fabric retail business

loans.name: Glenda Monserrate

texts.es:
La señora Glenda forma  parte del Banco Comunal Mujeres Del Futuro desde hace un ciclo, este banco pertenece a la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúne en las ciudadela Las Orquídeas, nuestra socia está dedicada al comercio de ropa como:pantalones, blusas, ropa de niños, interiores; inició este negocio motivada por su sobrina quien  le ofreció viajar hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil para comprarle la mercadería en los grandes mayorista de la bahía, en ocasiones ha tenido que realizar las compras en Portoviejo.

La señora Glenda esta felizmente casada desde hace 22 años, tiene 2 hijos.

 Esta muy contenta trabajando con los créditos que ha obtenido de la Fundación, su negocio lo tiene en el cantón Santa Ana a media hora de distancia de la capital manabita, todos los días se traslada junto a su esposo a vender la mercadería, tiene un local en el mercado del cantón, lo abre desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde que termina la feria. Con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir  en el negocio, sus ventas las realiza al contado, tiene bastantes clientes le va muy bien, tanto así que esta pagando un local en un centro comercial de la ciudad de Portoviejo para poder ayudarse en el hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Glenda has been a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres del Futuro” (Women of the Future) for one loan cycle. This Communal Bank meets in the community of Las Orquídeas, which is part of the city of Portoviejo. Glenda sells clothing such as trousers, blouses, undergarments, and children’s outfits. She started this business after she was encouraged by her niece, who offered to travel to the city of Guayaquil to buy merchandise from the large wholesalers. At times she has to make her purchases in Portoviejo.

Sra. Glenda has been happily married for 22 years and has two children.

She is very happy to be working with the loans obtained through Fundación ESPOIR. Her business is located in the canton of Santa Ana, which is 30 minutes away from the capital of Manabita. Every day she travels with her husband to sell her merchandise. She has a stand at the market in the canton, which is open from 7am until the fair closes at 3pm. With this new loan, she plans to invest in her business. Her sales are made for cash and she has enough customers to help her do well. She is even paying for a stand at a shopping center in the city of Portoviejo to help with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blouses, trousers, undergarments, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Douglas Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Douglas Antonio R. R., tiene 36 años con su esposa y familia de 2 hijos habitan en el Barrio José Dolores Estrada, sus hijos actualmente estudian la escuela primaria, su esposa se dedica a los trabajos de casa, y él labora en una carpintería desde hace 7 años.

Inicio como aprendiz de carpintería y con el apoyo de su familia compro los utensilios básicos de un pequeño taller, a futuro espera tener los recursos necesarios para comprar un mayor inventario de herramientas que favorezcan en  los trabajos de ebanistería, él solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera y almacenarla  para la temporada de invierno debido a que por la humedad cuesta que seque y es por esta razón que prefiere tenerla disponible en inventario. Este préstamo le brindara los recursos necesarios para mejorar su capital de trabajo y recursos necesarios para mejorar sus niveles de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Douglas Antonio R. R. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the neighborhood of José Dolores Estrada. His children currently attend elementary school while his wife takes care of the housework. Douglas has worked as a carpenter for seven years.

When he started his carpentry apprenticeship, Douglas had the support of his family and bought basic tools to establish a small workshop. In the future, he hopes to have the necessary resources to purchase a large inventory of tools used for making cabinets. He is requesting a loan in order to buy wood to store for the winter season. Since the humidity makes it difficult to find dry wood, he would prefer to keep it in stock. This loan provides him the necessary resources to increase his working capital and improve his living standards.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Yuri Magaly

texts.es: La solicitante es conviviente, vive en la casa de su suegra la cual es de material noble. Se dedica a la venta de ropa hace 2 años, la mayoria de clientes son obreros y vecinos. Sue esposo es obrero, actualmente esta trabajando en Huancano. El destino del credito es para incremento de su capital y necesidad personal
texts.en:
Yuri is in a common law marriage and lives at her mother-in-law’s house which is made of solid materials. She has been selling clothes for two years. Most of her customers are workers and neighbors. Her husband is a laborer and currently works in Huancano. This loan will be used to increase her operating capital and for personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital & personal use

loans.name: Kory Tawaco Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Exaltación, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal Kory Tawaco. Su presidenta es Julia R.  que tiene el negocio de tejido de chompas de lana, cuenta que inicio su negocio desde jovencita ya que disfrutaba de tejer, con el pasar del tiempo puedo convertirlo en un negocio que ahora es su principal ingreso para sustentar a su familia, ella compra su materia prima  de la Ceja y sus productos terminados los vende ofreciendo de puerta en puerta en diferentes zonas, cuando se le acumula trabajo tiene el apoyo de su hija, Julia está solicitando $us.- 400 y tiene planifido comprar lana para  estocarse.
Las demás integrantes de este grupo tienen diferentes actividades que se dedican al comercio, producción y servicio.
texts.en:
The community association 'Kory Tawaco' meet every two weeks in the community center 'Exaltación'. Their president is Julia R. who runs a business knitting woollen jumpers. She began this business when she was young because she really enjoyed knitting. As time went by she converted it into the main source of income for her family. She buys the raw material in la Ceja and sells the finished products from door to door in different areas. When the work builds up her daughter helps her. Julia is applying for $400 USD and plans to buy wool to stock up on supplies. The other members of the group are involved in different activities in the commercial, production and service industries.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Jose Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Arturo es el único caballero que integra el Banco Comunal Mujeres Del Futuro que se reúnen en la ciudadela Las Orquídea perteneciente al cantón Portoviejo, nuestro socio Se dedica al comercio de productos de plásticos y papel como: tarrinas, platos, fundas  y todo lo relacionado con productos de estos materiales, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año y empezó en el puerto de Manta ya que el vive ahí,  justamente ahora ha extendido su negocio al cantón Portoviejo y le va muy bien, el objetivo de el es poder extender sus ventas a otros cantones.

Arturo esta casado, tiene dos hijos adolecentes que le ayudan en el  negocio,  ellos se encargan de hacer la entrega de los productos a tiendas, restaurantes y panaderías; se inicio en  este  trabajo porque su suegro lo tenia, pero cuando murió le dejo a la hija el negocio y ellos lo continuaron, reunió algo de dinero y lo surtió, ha tenido éxito en sus ventas. Con este nuevo crédito el señor Arturo podrá invertir en comprar mas productos para su negocio, a la vez quiere emprender algo nuevo que seria la venta de cortinas, sabanas y manteles, este tema lo ha tratado con su esposa y esta de acuerdo, para  así poder seguir manteniendo a su familia.  Viajara a comprar la mercadería a Quito y Guayaquil.

 La entrega de pedidos lo hace en su vehículo personal; esta muy satisfecho con la ayuda que recibe de la Fundación.
texts.en:
Mr. Arturo is the only man who is a member the "Mujeres del Futuro" ("Women of the Future") Communal Bank, which meets in the Las Orquídea neighborhood, in the canton of Portoviejo. Arturo sells paper and plastic products like: tubs, plates, bags, and everything related to products of those materials. He has been doing this for a year now. He started in the Puerto de Manta neighborhood since he lives there, and just recently he has expanded his service to the canton of Portoviejo. It's going very well and his goal is to extend his service to other cantons. Arturo is married and has two adolescent children who help him with the business. They are responsible for delivering products to stores, restaurants, and bakeries. He got started in this work because it was his father-in-law's business, and when he died, he left the business to his daughter. Arturo and his wife have continued the business. He got together some money, stocked up, and has had success with their sales. With this new loan, Mr. Arturo will be able to invest in the purchase of more products for his business. At the same time, he'd like to try something new, which will be the sale of curtains, sheets, and tablecloths. He has discussed this with his wife and she agrees with him, because this way, they will be able to continue supporting their family. He will travel to Quito and Guayaquil to purchase the merchandise. He delivers orders with his personal vehicle. He is very satisfied by the support he receives from the Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags, jars, cups, plates, tablecloths, curtains, etc.

loans.name: Amelio

texts.es: Amelio, de 37 años de edad, es casado  y tiene cuatro hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos viven en la comunidad de Manitea Alta, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Amelio es un hombre trabajador, reconoce que lo logrado hasta el momento fue gracias a su ímpetu y sus ganas de sobresalir. El cultivo de cacao es lo único que sabía hacer, pero con la ayuda de sus padres, fueron quienes lo aconsejaron como obtener una excelente producción y de mejor calidad. Es por ello que ya tiene segmentado una buena cartera de clientes, desde luego que a veces no se da abasto ya que no puede cumplir con los compromisos establecidos, para ello, siempre busca alternativas para poder satisfacer a sus clientes, comprando producto de cacao a otros productores, pero que tengan la misma calidad. Normalmente su producto los vende en los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad, para ello necesita de sus peones para que le ayudan a trasladar su producto a los puntos de venta. Sus planes a futuro es comprar mas terrenos de cultivo con la necesidad de poder ampliar sus plantaciones de cacao. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pagos, además agradece a su grupo comunal por la solidaridad que tienen cada uno de los socios. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la de compra de mayor cantidad de cacao de otros productores con la necesidad de poder incrementar sus ingresos y a la vez satisfacer a sus clientes potenciales.
texts.en:
Amelio is 37 years old. He is married and has four schoolaged children. Together they live in the community of Manitea Alta, located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle where they have their own house made of wood. Amelio is a hard working man. He recognizes that what he has accomplished so far has been thanks to his drive and wish to get ahead. Growing cacao is the only thing that he knew how to do, but his parents helped him by counseling him on how to obtain excellent production and better quality. That is why he already has a good customer base. Of course, at times he can't keep up with the work and and he can't keep all of his committments. Because of this, he is always looking for alternatives to be able to satisfy his customers, buying cacao product from other producers, but of the same quality. Normallly his product is sold in warehousing senters in his same community and for that he needs workers to hep transport his product to the points of sale. His plans for the future are to buy more land to cultivate because he needs to be able to expand his cacao plantings. This is his sixth loan with MFP. He is committted to keep making his payments. He also thanks his community group for the support that each member has. With the loan he has asked for, he will invest in buying a greater quantity of cacao from other producers with the need of incerasing his income and satisfying his potential customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cacao from other producers to increase his income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Glue, leather.

loans.name: Santa

texts.es: Santa, de 24 años, es una joven madre que  vive con su esposo Juan,  y sus 2 pequeños hijos en su casa, que es propia.La labor cotidiana de Santa, es el cuidado de su hogar  y de sus hijos. Durante  todos los días lleva el almuerzo a su esposo, que trabaja como  albañil. En sus inicios no tenían casi nada, pero luego de un tiempo  se propusieron construir  su casa, de acuerdo a sus posibilidades.  Cuando su esposo; no tenia trabajo, Santa y él construían las vigas y  paredes de su casa. En la actualidad se sienten feliz, ya que los 5 años de dedicación y  sacrificio le da cierta comodidad, aunque lo más difícil para ella; es no contar con un espacio apropiado, para su cocina. Su mayor anhelo es mandar a terminar de construir su casa.Este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y sabe que le será muy beneficioso para continuar con la construcción de su casa, es por esta razón que  se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas oportunamente.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de tablas machambradas (especiales para construcción)  para cercar el perímetro de su casa, además quiere realizar el muro de contención, con piedras   para evitar que ceda la arena que colinda con su casa.
texts.en:
Santa, 24, is a young mother who lives with her husband Juan and her two small children in her own home. Santa’s daily labor is the care of her home and children. Every day she carries lunch to her husband who works as a bricklayer. When they were first starting out they had almost nothing, but after some time they decided to build themselves a house as best they could. Whenever her husband didn’t have work he and Santa would put up the beams and walls of their house. Right now they are happy because the five years of dedication and sacrifice have given them a certain level of comfort, although the most difficult thing for her is not having an adequate space for her kitchen. Her greatest wish is to have the construction of her home finished. This is her first loan with MFP and she knows it will be highly beneficial for her to continue building her house. Therefore she commits to making all the payments promptly. She plans to invest the requested money in the purchase of tongue-and-groove boards (special boards used in construction) to enclose the perimeter of her house. In addition she would like to build a retaining wall with stones to prevent the erosion of the sand that borders her house.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building her house

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Exaltación, se reúne la Asociación Comunal LIBERTAD.
Las integrantes de esta Asociación tienen variados negocios que se dedican a la comercialización, producción y servicio.
Un ejemplo claro es Rose Mary P. de 35 años, vecina de la ciudad de El Alto y es la primera vez que se ha animado a solicitar un préstamo, ya que ella tiene el negocio de venta de repuestos, trabaja juntamente con su esposo y por el nivel de venta que tiene se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo de Bs.- 2000, con el que piensa comprar diferentes artículos de movilidad.
texts.en:
The Communal Association LIBERTAD meets at the Exaltación Regional Office. The members of this Association have a variety of businesses which are dedicated to sales, production and service. One clear example is Rose Mary, 35, resident of the city of El Alto. This is her first time seeking a loan. She has a business selling spare parts and works alongside her husband. Given her sales volume she has seen the need to seek a loan of 2000 Bs. with which she plans to purchase various mobility-related items.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase mobility-related spare parts.

loans.name: Henry Vicente

texts.es:
Henry es soltero y pertenece al Banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bello en quechua
Henry tiene una moto taxi con la cual realiza transporte publico en la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días, Henry solicita un crédito de 1000 soles que será destinado para la reparación de su moto.
Henry sueña con ampliar su negocio y tener una casa propio.
texts.en:
Henry is single and belongs to the Imasumacc Communal Bank which means How Beautiful in Quechua. Henry has a moto-taxi [motorcycle with attached cab for passengers] with which he provides public transportation in the city of Ayacucho seven days a week. Henry is seeking a loan of 1,000 soles which will be used for repairs to his vehicle. Henry dreams of expanding his business and having his own home.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For repairs to his moto-taxi

loans.name: Alicia Raquel

texts.es:
Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bello en quechua y los que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones.
Alicia es casada y tiene 3 hijos, tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, bebidas, golosinas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de sus hijos. Su préstamo será destinado para la compra de azúcar, arroz y leche.
Alicia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Imasumacc Communal Bank which means How Beautiful in Quechua and what she likes most are trainings. Alicia is married and has three children. She runs a store out of her home where she sells groceries including drinks and sweets. She works seven days a week with occasional help from her children. Her loan will be used to purchase sugar, rice and milk. Alicia dreams that some day her children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice and milk.

loans.name: Chris

texts.es: Chris, de 30 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive con su esposo y su hijo Juan de (8) en su casa que es propia.Después de trabajar como vendedora de prendas de vestir, en la actualidad trabaja por las noches en la elaboración de aretes, pulseras, collares y anillos, entre otros accesorios  con  materiales como perlas, piedras (de fantasía) y alambres. En su barrio la conocen por  la elaboración de estos objetos, y además su esposo es quien se inició en este negocio, pues  las vendía en la puerta de los centros de estudio. En la actualidad  sus clientes, son algunos de los comerciantes artesanos del mercado central, a quienes abastece durante 4  veces al mes. Cuando tiene varios pedidos por cumplir, trabajan  hasta altas horas de la noche, y luego cumplen con puntualidad con los pedidos. Se siente muy contenta tejiendo aretes y demás objetos, pues ya cumplió 6 años en esta labor. Su mayor deseo, es contar con un stock de materiales variado, pues tiene el anhelo de  revestir las paredes de su casa.Este es su décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy útil para aumentar sus materias, es por esta razón que  se compromete en pagar sus cotas oportunamente.Con el dinero solicitado comprará  piedras al por mayor, de diversas calidades, para continuar  trabajando y cumpliendo con los pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Chris, 30, is a very cheerful and hard-working mother to her family. She lives with her husband and son Juan, 8, in her own home. After working as a clothing saleswoman, currently she works at night making earrings, bracelets, necklaces and rings, among other accessories, using materials such as pearls, costume jewels and wire. She is known in her neighborhood for making these objects, and her husband also was the one who started this business as he sold them at the doors of the educational centers. Currently her customers are some of the craft merchants of the central market, whom she supplies four times a month. When she has a number of orders to fill, they work until late at night so that they may supply the orders on time. She is very happy to be weaving earrings and other items, since she now has worked six years in this field. Her greatest wish is to have a variety of materials in stock, since she would like to put up wallcoverings in her home. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she knows that the loan will be very helpful for increasing her quantity of materials, so she commits to making her payments promptly.
