With the requested money she will buy stones wholesale and of various qualities, in order to continue working and fulfilling the orders she has pending.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase jewelry-making supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bello en Quechua.
Elizabeth es soltera y tiene 1 hijo, Elizabeth vende ropa variada a pedido, sus productos los ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas son al crédito, actividad que realiza en sus ratos libres. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de chompas y casacas.
Elizabeth sueña con brindar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the Imasumacc Communal Bank which means How Beautiful in Quechua. Elizabeth is single and has one child. She sells a variety of special-order clothing to friends and family members on credit, which she does part-time. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of sweaters and jackets. Elizabeth dreams of providing a good education for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sweaters and jackets.

loans.name: Sheryl Denys

texts.es:
La señora Sheryl forma parte del banco comunal Mujeres del Futuro desde hace 6 ciclos, los créditos que ha podido recibir los ha invertido muy bien y sus negocios se han incrementado de una manera exitosa.

Nuestra socia esta casada tiene dos hijos, a sus 29 años es maestra artesanal en una pequeña  parroquia de la ciudad de Portoviejo, labor que desempeña  por  las noche,  viaja todos los días para cumplir con su labor, este trabajo lo viene realizando hace algunos años; tiene tiempo para estudiar esta realizando una maestría en gerencia comercial, pero sin descuidar su hogar  y sus niños que están pequeños.

La señora Sheryl es una mujer que le gusta el comercio, desde que se caso hace 6 años mantienen con el esposo la venta de camarones, se iniciaron con este negocio por que el  trabajaba en una camaronera en un puerto pesquero en la provincia de Manabi,luego que decidió salir ahorró dinero y empezó con su propio negocio, el trabajo lo realizan de la siguiente manera,el tiene que viajara a compra por cajas el camarón y lo distribuye por libra a sus amigos y familiares quienes son sus mas fieles compradores, aparte de este negocio la señora Sheryl tiene la venta de ropa, negocio que lo empezó hace 2 años aproximadamente, se le hace fácil porque ya tiene sus clientes fijos, con este negocio puede aportar económicamente es su hogar, a pesar que es madre, esposa y profesora se da tiempo para todo.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Sheryl podrá invertir en comprarse un congelador para guarda los camarones, el sueño de ella es poder extenderse con su negocio a los demás cantones, pero requiere de mayor inversión, el congelador lo piensan comprar de contado. Entre los proyectos esta lograr obtener su taller de costura junto a su mama quien siempre la ha motivado, la señora Sheryl esta muy segura de poder hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en:
Sheryl has been part of the “Women of the Future” cooperative bank for six cycles. She has invested her loans very well, and her businesses have been growing successfully. Our member is married, has two children and, at 29 years of age, is a crafts teacher in a small village within the city of Portoviejo. She does her work at night, traveling each day to undertake her labor, which she has been carrying for several years. She has time to study, and is completing a degree in business management while still tending to her home and small children. Sheryl very much likes commerce and, since getting married 6 years ago, runs a business with her husband selling prawns. They started in the business because he worked at a prawn enterprise at a fishing port in the Manabi province. They started to save money when he decided to leave this job to start their own business. He now travels to purchase prawns by the case, which they sell by the pound to family and friends who are loyal buyers. Separate from this business, Sheryl also sells clothing, an enterprise she started approximately 2 years ago. This work is easy, because she already has a steady customer base. With this business, she also helps to support the family financially. Despite the fact that she is a mother, wife and teacher, she somehow manages to find time to handle everything. With this new loan, Sheryl would be able to invest in buying herself a freezer to store her prawns. Her dream is to extend the business into other towns, but this requires a greater investment. They are thinking about paying for the freezer in cash. Another project planned is to have a sewing workshop alongside her mother, who has always motivated her. Sheryl is very sure that she will be able to make her dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia venD. quesos D. manera ambulatoria D. casa en casa, la gran parte D. sus prestamos son al crédito, los quesos los adquiere D. los productores, en algunas oportunidades viaja a los pueblos.
Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bello en Quechua. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. quesos.
Julia es casada y su sueño es tener mayor capital y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Julia works as a street vendor, selling cheeses from house to house. A great majority of her loans are on credit, and she acquires her cheeses from the producers. In some instances, she travels to the towns. Julia belongs to the cooperative bank Imasumacc, which means “How Beautiful” in Quechua. Her loan would be used to invest in the purchase of cheeses. Julia is married and dreams of having more working capital and making improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cheeses.

loans.name: Jasinta

texts.es:
Jasinta es casada y es socia del Banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bello en Quechua.
Jasinta se dedica a la venta de golosinas de manera ambulatoria en una calle céntrica de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días, también vende leña en su casa, producto que adquiere de los productores. En algunas ocasiones se dedica al hilado de landa de animales que luego vende por kilos en el mercado. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de galletas, chocolates.
El sueño de Jasinta es mejorar su negocio, tener mas ganancias para ahorrar para el futuro.
texts.en:
Jasinta is married and a member of the cooperative bank Imasumacc, which means “How Beautiful” in Quechua. Jasinta dedicates herself as a street vendor, selling sweets/snacks from a major road of the city. She carries out this activity every day and also sells wood, which she buys from suppliers, from her house. In some occasions she works spinning yarn to sell by the kilo at the market. Her loan would be invested into the purchase of cookies, chocolates. Jasinta’s dream is to improve her business to generate more income, so she can save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cookies, chocolates.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 39 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene tres hijos, Javier de 13 años, zosimo de 12 años y Guisela de 6 años de edad. Juntos viven en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, específicamente en la comunidad de Manitea Alta, donde tienen su casa  propia. Apenas tiene secundaria incompleta, pero eso no lo impidió trabajar en la agricultura, recuerda que tuvo que esforzarse mucho para establecerse en el rubro. Refiere además que le puso todo el empeño y dedicación para obtener una buena producción, es más lo productos que posee son orgánicos, no daña al medio ambiente; para ello utiliza técnicas de manera artesanal que cuida sus cosechas. Ana es consciente de que en el futuro, lo van asumir sus hijos, desde luego que los esta enseñando el buen manejo y cuidado de sus plantaciones y a la vez a conservar el medio ambiente. Su producto es reconocido en su comunidad, por la buena calidad que tiene consigo, es por ello que los grandes mayoristas llegan a su chacra para comprarle y ofrecerlo a  un precio competitivo. Usualmente trabaja con su pareja, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero en temporada de cosecha necesita de sus peones para que ayude en la extracción de sus productos. En un futuro cercano anhela cultivar café, con la necesidad de ganar clientes potenciales. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y por tal se compromete a pagar durante las fechas establecidas, además se siente conforme por las buenas decisiones que toma su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más terrenos fértiles, con la necesidad de incrementar su productividad e ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children; Javier 13, Zosimo 12, and Guisela 6. They live together in the beautiful Cuzco rainforest, in the community of Manitea Alta, where they have their own home. She barely completed secondary school, but that hasn’t prevented her from working in agriculture. She recalls that she had to work hard to establish herself in farming and tells how she put a lot of determination and dedication into getting a good yield of crops. What’s more, her produce is organic and doesn’t harm the environment as she uses artisanal techniques to take care of her crops. Ana knows that her children will take over the business in the future. So, of course she is teaching them how to properly manage and care for their plantations while preserving the environment at the same time. Her produce is recognized in her community for its good quality. That is why the big wholesalers come to her farm to buy it and offer her a competitive price. Usually she works with her partner, but sometimes she gets help from her children. However at harvest time, she needs laborers to assist in the gathering of her crops. In the near future, she hopes to grow coffee, as she needs to attract new customers. This is her sixth loan with MFP and as such she agrees to pay on time. She is also happy with the good decisions that are being made by her communal group. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more fertile land, as she needs to increase her productivity and income.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase land for cultivation and to increase her productivity

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La señora Rosa forma parte del Banco Comunal Mujeres del Futuro, en la ciudadela las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Portoviejo. las reuniones se realizan cada quince días en casa de una de las socias.
 
La señora Rosa es madre de 4 hijos, casada desde hace 40 años, sus hijos son mayores y tienen sus propias familias. La actividad que viene realizando nuestra socia es la venta de productos de belleza como Avon y Esika, se encarga de  visitar a sus clientes en sus casas, con este negocio lleva 3 años y le va muy bien, esta muy contenta pese a que es un poco difícil tener que salir a vender, trasladándose de un lugar a otro en buses, ella no desmaya sus fuerzas  para salir adelante.

El esposo de la señora  Rosa se dedica por entero a su taller mecánico, es poco lo que se gana en el negocio pero han podido ahorrar y tienen su propia casa.  Con este nuevo crédito podrá hacerle unos arreglos que le hacen falta a su casa.

 El mayor sueño de la señora Rosa es poder comprarse un vehículo para poder trasladarse de un lugar a otro con sus ventas, ha pensado pedirle ayuda a una de sus hijas que vive en Estados Unidos para que le envié mercadería como brasieres para surtir su negocio, nuestra socia esta segura que le ira muy bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa belongs to the Mujeres del Futuro (Women of the Future) Communal Bank in the Las Orquideas (The Orchids) zone of Portoviejo City. They meet every 15 days in the home of one of the members. Rosa, mother to 4 children, has been married more than 40 years. Her children are grown now and have their own families. The activity she pursues is selling beauty products such as Avon and Esika, which she does by visiting clients in their homes. Rosa has been doing this for 3 years and it's going well. She is very content, though it is a little difficult having to go out to sell, traveling from one location to another in buses. But she hasn't diminished her efforts to get ahead. Rosa's husband is a full-time auto mechanic who earns little but has managed to save and they have their own home. With this new loan they will be able to make some improvements that are still lacking to their house. Rosa's biggest dream is to be able to buy a vehicle and drive from one place to another for her sales. She is considering asking one of her children who lives in the United States to send merchandise such as brassieres in order to expand her business. She is certain that this would do well.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: FOR NEEDED HOME IMPROVEMENTS

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive con ellos en el sector Pacherrez, una zona rural del distrito de Pucalá, un distrito predominantemente agrícola situado a mas de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de un año a la venta de cebiche (plato típico del país cuyo ingrediente principal es el pescado macerado en limón), golosinas y gaseosas en el colegio del sector donde vive. Ella se dirige todos los dias al centro de estudios para ofrecer sus productos durante la hora del recreo, consciente de la responsabilidad que conlleva el trabajar vendiendo alimentos a escolares, ella trata de preparar los alimentos con la mejor higiene posible y adquirir  golosinas de buena calidad.

Los ingresos que ella percibe los utiliza  para solventar los gastos familiares y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Maritza desea adquirir mas insumos para preparar mas platos de comida y así ampliar su negocio. Para alcanzar su meta ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Maritza desea seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder percibir mayores ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos, por ello trata siempre de esforzarse al máximo en su trabajo. En la zona donde vive ella es muy estimada y respetada por sus vecinos y conocidos.
texts.en:
Maritza is 36 years old and is a mother of two. She lives with her children in Pacherrez, a rural area in the district of Pucalá, a predominantly agricultural region located a little over a half hour from the city of Chiclayo. For over a year, Maritza has been working selling candy, soft drinks and ceviche (a typical dish from this region made with chopped fish and lemon) in the high school in Pacherrez. Every day she goes there to work, offering her products during school breaks. Because she is conscious of the responsibility that is necessary when selling food to schoolchildren, she tries to prepare the food as hygienically as possible and to purchase candy of a high quality. Maritza uses the income she earns to cover the household expenses and help her children get ahead. She would like to buy more ingredients in order to prepare more foods and expand her business. In order to reach her goal, she is asking for her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa [the Kiva field partner] in the amount of 1000 Peruvian soles. Maritza would like to keep growing as an entrepreneur so that she can increase her income and help her children. For this reason she works hard at her job. She is respected and admired by her neighbors and acquaintances in the area where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for the preparation and sale of food.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca, de 23 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijo alguno. Vive en la majestuosa selva cuzqueña, ubicada en la comunidad de Manitea Alta, donde tiene su propia casa a base de madera. Para Blanca lo único que primaba era salir adelante, por ello se abocó de lleno a la actividad agrícola, específicamente a la producción y comercializaron de café. Poco a poco fue avanzando de manera sostenible, a tal punto que le faltaba cumplir con los pedidos de otros compradores, debido a que su terreno no lo permitía producir en grandes cantidades, y se vio obligado a comprar de otros productores, con la necesidad de atender la demanda de sus clientes. Ella siente que le falta mucho por recorrer, es por ello que piensa ampliar su productividad y mejorar la calidad de sus cafetales, para que así pueda obtener mayores ingresos. Normalmente su producto los vende en los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad a un precio base. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago, además agradece a su grupo comunal, por las buenas decisiones que toman entre los socios. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos y abono para mejorar la calidad de sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Blanca, 23, is single and has no children. She lives in the majestic Cusco jungle, in the community of Manitea Alta, where she has her own wooden home. Blanca's only priority is getting ahead, and for this reason she has fully devoted herself to agriculture, specifically the production and sale of coffee. Bit by bit her sales have been progressing in a sustainable manner, to the point that, since her land wouldn't let her farm in large quantities, she had to buy from other producers to meet her customers' demand. She feels that she has a long way to go, and so she plans to increase her productivity and improve the quality of her coffee in order to earn a better income. She usually sells her produce in the stock centres in her community at a base price. This is her first loan with MFP, so we know she will faithfully repay it on time. Also, she is grateful to her community group for the sound decisions they make. With the requested loan she will invest in the purchase of supplies and fertilizer to improve the quality of her coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and supplies for improvement of coffee crop

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther, de  40 años, es una madre de familia muy emprendedora, vive con su esposo en su casa que es propia. Actualmente se dedica a la  distribución de  aretes, pulseras, collares y demás accesorios para damas. Sus clientes  son los comerciantes de la selva peruana, quienes le hacen pedidos por teléfono y  ella se los envía por  encomiendas de 4  a 6 veces al mes. Está muy satisfecha con éste negocio, ya que le sobra tiempo para dedicarse a sus hijos y a los arreglos de su casa. Además lleva algunos años en este rubro, lo que le ha permitido obtener clientes fijos, y las ganancias superan a las de  su anterior negocio. Por el momento quiere terminar de construir su casa, y después planea  dedicarse íntegramente a ampliar su negocio.Este es su décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que este dinero le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital, por ello se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente.Para el futuro tiene planeado  invertir el dinero solicitado en el incremento de su mercadería, al por mayor, para de ese modo cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Ester, 40, is a very enterprising mother who lives with her husband in their own home. She currently sells earrings, bracelets, necklaces and other accessories for women. Her customers are the retailers of the Peruvian jungle. They make orders by phone and she sends them parcels 4 to 6 times per month. She is very satisfied with this business, because she has time left to dedicate to her children and home repairs. She has also been in this area for several years, which has allowed her to obtain loyal clients, and her earnings exceed those of her previous business. Right now, she wants to finish the construction of her home, and after that she plans to work hard on expanding her business. This is her tenth loan with MFP; she knows that it will be very beneficial in increasing her capital, and she promises to repay it on time. She plans to invest the requested loan in increasing her merchandise, buying it wholesale, to fill her pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Mary Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Mary Cristina forma parte del  banco comunal Mujeres del Futuro en la ciudad de Portoviejo, el grupo que se reúnen en la ciudadela Las Orquídea a las afuera de la ciudad.

Nuestra socia se dedica al comercio informal de ropa, compra al por mayor en la ciudad de Portoviejo en los grandes mayoristas prendas como pantalones, blusas y prendas íntimas  negocio que lo mantiene por más de dos años.

Nuestra socia tiene una hija, durante el día se dedica a la venta de la mercadería y por las noches junto al esposo tiene otra actividad, trabajan para una empresa de purificadores de aire para el hogar, visitan a los clientes en sus casas para hacer la demostración del producto, este negocio lo tiene recientemente les va bien, pero en realidad la señora Mary Cristina esta mas dedicada a la venta de ropa.

 Con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en surtir el negocio, tiene por entregar varios pedidos como perfumes y maquillaje, una vez que entrega la mercadería el cliente le cancela el 50 % y el saldo a una semana.
texts.en:
Mary Cristina is part of the community bank Mujeres del Futuro ("Women of the Future") in the city of Portoviejo, which meets in the Las Orquidea community on the outskirts of the city. She sells clothing informally, buying it wholesale in the city of Portoviejo. She buys items from the major wholesalers such as pants, shirts and underwear and has been doing this for more than two years. Mary Christina has one daughter. During the day she sells merchandise and at night she and her husband work for a home air purifier company. They visit customers in their homes to give product demonstrations. They started this business recently and it is going well, but in reality Mary Christina is more dedicated to clothing sales. With this loan she will be able to invest in her business. She has various orders to fill, for items such as perfumes and makeup. After delivering the merchandise to the customer, the customer will pay 50%, and the balance in one week.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Bara De Oro Group

texts.es:
Facundina es socia del Banco Comunal Bara de Oro, su Banco Comunal esta integrada por 12 socias que realizan diferentes actividades.
Facundina es soltera, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ella y ella sola mantiene su hogar, tiene una casa de material rustico, Facundina brinda servicios de bordados en carteras, correas para una empresa, trabaja para una panadería repartiendo panes a las tiendas, actividad que inicia desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la mañana, también trabaja cuidando una huerta donde hay animales menores y F., por lo que recibe un pago. Además Facundina en sus momentos libres se dedica a lavar ropa ajena.
Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar para la comida de sus hijos.
Los sueños de Facundina es que su ultimo hijo sea profesional y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Facundina is a member of the Bara de Oro Communal Bank. Her communal bank is comprised of 12 members who do different activities. Facundina is 50, single, and has three children. Two of the children live with her. She supports the household by herself. She has a rustic house. Facundina embroiders purses and sashes for a company. She works for a bakery delivering bread to stores. She does this from four in the morning until seven in the morning. She also works taking care of a garden where there are small animals and flowers, and she receives payment for this. Also, in her free time Facundina washes other people’s clothes. Her loan will be used to buy rice and sugar to feed her children. Facundina dreams that her last child will become a professional. She also dreams of improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar to feed her children

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de  43 años, es una señora muy trabajadora,  vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa que es propia.La costura es parte de su vida cotidiana, y ella es experta en entallar y enmendar todas las prendas, que realiza con mucha  destreza. Cuando trabaja, primero hilvana, y después pasa la  máquina con mayor facilidad,  para  que sus resultados sean  impecables. Hace unos años atrás, no era muy conocida en su oficio, pero, por su buen trabajo en la actualidad presta servicios a algunos confeccionistas de un gran emporio comercial de la ciudad. Luz trabaja sola y está muy contenta  por los resultados, ya que no descuida su hogar y eso también le permite preparar 100 platos típicos al mes, que los vende a sus clientes. Ya lleva 14 años realizando estas actividades, y su mayor deseo, es ampliar su negocio y construir su casa.Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, y sabe que el dinero solicitado  es muy importante para aumentar el capital de su  negocio, es por eso que promete pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente.Luz tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de  materiales  de costura y, además   mercaderías comestibles (fideos, aceite y papas) en cantidad para aumentar  la elaboración de sus usuales platos.
texts.en:
Luz is 43 years old, and she is a hard-working woman. She lives with her husband and their four children in her own house. Sewing is part of her everyday life. She is an expert at fitting and mending all garments, and she does it with a lot of skill. When she works she bastes first, and then she uses the machine with greater ease so that her results will be impeccable. Years ago she was not very well known in her occupation. But now, due to her good work, she provides services for some seamstresses in a large commercial business in the city. Luz works alone, and she is very happy with the results. She does not neglect her home, and this work also allows her to make 100 typical dishes a month. She sells the food to her customers. She has been doing these activities for 14 years. Her greatest wish is to expand her business and to build a house. This is her tenth loan with MFP. She knows that the requested money is very important in order to increase the capital in her business. That is why she pledges to make all of her payments in a timely manner. Luz plans to invest the requested money in the purchase of sewing materials. She will also buy food in bulk (noodles, oil, and potatoes) in order to increase the number of dishes that she usually makes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing materials for her business

loans.name: Nelly  Maricela

texts.es:
La señora Nelly pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Del Futuro desde hace 6 ciclos, este banco se reúnen en la ciudad de Portoviejo cada 15 días, nuestra socia Nelly esta casada mantiene una maravillosa relación de 10 años con el padre de sus hijos, tiene una niña de 8 años y a la espera de su segundo niño.

La señora Nelly tiene un Kiosco  de comida rápida en la ciudad de Portoviejo, ofrece a sus clientes empanadas, hamburguesas y  batidos, hace un año que instaló su negocio  lo ubicó en la parte frontal de su casa, compró sillas y mesas y empezó a trabajar hasta los actuales momentos y le va muy bien, tiene que abrir todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.

Nuestra socia con este nuevo crédito  podrá invertir en un techo  para el negocio al igual que en mesas y licuadoras y en los productos necesarios para preparar los alimentos, quien le ayuda en el negocio es  su esposo y su hermana, esta muy feliz porque sus ventas están bien.
texts.en:
Nelly has belonged to the Mujeres Del Futuro Communal bank for six cycles. This bank meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo. Our member, Nelly, is married. She maintains a marvelous ten year relationship with the father of her children. She has an eight year old daughter, and she is expecting her second child. Nelly has a fast food kiosk in the city of Portoviejo. She sells empanadas, hamburgers, and milk shakes to her customers. She set up her business a year ago, and it is located in the front part of her house. She bought chairs and tables, and she started to work. She continues to work, and it is going very well for her. She has to open everyday from six in the morning until ten at night. With this new loan our member will be able to invest in a roof for her business, tables, blenders, and the necessary products to prepare the food. Her husband and her sister help her in the business. She is very happy because her sales are good.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A roof for her kiosk, tables, blenders, meat, bread, fruit, flour, and eggs

loans.name: Aquiles Lanao Flores Group

texts.es:
Marisol es socia hace 1 año del Banco Comunal Aquiles Lanao que tiene 15 socias, durante este tiempo Marisol aprendió a ahorrar con la esperanza D. cumplir sus metas o para alguna emergencia.
Marisol vive en una casa alquilada hace mucho tiempo y su mayor deseo es comprar una casa propia, Marisol es casada, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos D. 15, 8, 4 años. Marisol junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta D. moliente (bebida caliente preparada con hierbas curativas y semillas D. Lino), sus ventas los realizan D. manera ambulatoria en 2 distintos lugares en donD. hay mucha afluencia D. personas, para lo cual tienen baldes en la cual llevan sus productos. Su préstamo será destinado para la compra D. baldes y una carpa para protegerse del sol y D. la lluvia.
texts.en:
Marisol has been a member of the Aquiles Lanao Communal Bank for one year. The group has 15 members. During this time Marisol learned to save in the hope of meeting her goals or for some emergency. Marisol has lived in a rented house for a long time. Her greatest wish is to buy her own house. Marisol is 32, married, and has three children; 15, 8, and 4 years old. Marisol and her husband sell “moliente” (a hot drink prepared with curative herbs and flax seeds). They sell as traveling merchants in two distinct places where there is an influx of a lot of people. They have buckets to carry there products. The loan is to buy buckets and a tent to protect them from the sun and the rain.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy buckets and a tent to protect them from the sun and the rain

loans.name: Fernandina

texts.es: Fernandina tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos viven en la comunidad de Manitea Alta, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Hace mas de 28 años emprendió un negocio propio y desde luego que lo realizo con el apoyo de sus padres, desde entonces se esfuerza todos los días, dándole duro y parejo en sus productos de cacao y café, no sin antes agradece a su esposo por la ayuda incondicional que lo brindó en los momentos mas difíciles que paso. Hoy vende su producto a diferentes localidades, por lo que su mercado se está extendiendo, pero ella no se conforma con lo alcanzado, es más trata de asistir a charlas educativas, sobre el buen manejo de los productos agrícolas, con la finalidad de mejorar y transmitir esos conocimientos a su familia. Usualmente recibe la ayuda de sus padres, pero en temporadas de cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones que le puedan facilitar la extracción de producto final. Generalmente su producto los vende en los centro de acopio de su comunidad a un precio base. En el futuro anhela ampliar su producto en otras localidades estratégicas con el propósito de minimizar tiempo y costo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus compromisos de pagos, además se siente a gusto por la confianza y transparencia en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono para mejorar la producción de sus plantaciones de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Fernandina is 51 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Together, the family lives in the community of Manitea Alta, located in the beautiful forest near Cuzco, where they have their own home constructed of wood. Twenty-eight years ago, Fernandina began running her own business, which she learned with the help of his parents. Since then, she has advanced the business day by day, making sure her business selling cocoa and coffee is both up-to-par with her competitors and built to last. Fernandina is very thankful to her husband, whose unconditional support has helped her overcome difficult times her business has undergone. Now, she sells her products in various localities, through which she has extended her market base, but she has not caught her business up yet to serve these areas well. Also, she has not been able to attend many of the education talks on improving agriculture-based businesses, which she would love to attend so that she could share the tips with her family. Usually she enjoys the help of her parents, but during harvest season she also needs farm workers to help her facilitate the extraction of the final product. Generally, she sells her products in centers where these products are stockpiled to be sold at a low price for commercial use. In the future, Fernandina yearns to grow her products to be sold in more strategically-located communities for the purpose of minimizing time and expenses. This is her fifth loan from MFP, and she has proven her ability to faithfully pay each payment on time. Fernandina enjoys the traits of confidence and transparancy inherent in her communal bank. With this loan, Fernandina will invest in the purchase of manure to improve her production of her plantations of coffee and cocoa.

Translated from Spanish by Suzy Marinkovich, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase manure to increase her crops.

loans.name: Francisco Del Carmen

texts.es:
Francisco es un padre de familia de 35 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Zaña, un lugar conocido por sus tradiciones y danzas afro – peruanas, se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la elaboración de adobes (bloques de barro utilizados en construcción) este material es adquirido por los pobladores de la zona que utilizan este producto para construir sus casas y corralones para sus animales. El negocio tiene mucha acogida ya que este producto es relativamente barato por lo que la mayoría de construcciones de la zona están hechas de este material.

Francisco ha construído gracias al fruto de su trabajo su casa y ahora el necesita instalar los servicios básicos (luz y agua) para completar su  obra, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para mejorar progresivamente la calidad de vida de su familia. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 35 year old father with one child. He lives in the Zaña district with his family. This place is known for its traditions and Afro-Peruvian dancing. It is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over five years he has been making adobes (blocks of clay used in construction). This material is acquired by the inhabitants of the area, who use this product to build houses and corrals for their animals. The business is very well received because this product is relatively cheap. Most of the buildings in the area are made of this material. Francisco, thanks to the fruit of his work, has built his house. Now he needs to install the basic services (light and water) to complete his work. He has requested, for the first time, a loan for 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. His greatest wish is to keep working in order to progressively improve his family’s quality of life. The neighbors and acquaintances where he lives consider him to be a tranquil and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses to install the supply system for basic services in his house

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, D. 46 años, es una madre D. familia muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos menores en su casa que es  propia.Todos los días, después D. realizar las labores del hogar, empieza con su negocio. Se dedica a  la fabricación D. chompas y casacas femeninas, D. diversas calidades. Tiene como clientes a algunas profesoras D. su barrio, a quienes les venD. a crédito, y al resto D. sus vecinos les venD. al contado. La actividad la  realiza durante las tardes y por las mañanas cobra. Lo que más le gusta D. su negocio, es que no le absorbe todo su tiempo, y ya lleva 3 años en este trabajo,  y considera que lo más difícil es realizar las compras, pues le cuesta seleccionar las prendas, ya que piensa en los gustos D. sus clientes. Para más adelante tiene planeado ampliar su negocio y comprarse más vitrinas D. exhibición.Este es su décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y ratifica su compromiso D. seguir pagando puntualmente. En una socia muy  responsable y preocupada por el bienestar y el desarrollo D. su grupo, ya que quiere que todos los integrantes  salgan adelante.María tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado, en incrementar con variedad D.  prendas su negocio, y D. ese modo planea seguir desarrollándose para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maria, 46, is a hardworking mother who lives with her husband and their 2 minor children in their own home. Each day, after carrying out the household chores, she starts working in her business. She makes women's jackets and sweaters, of a variety of types. Some of her customers are teachers in the neighborhood, to whom she gives credit. She sells to the rest of her neighbors on a cash basis. She carries out this activity during the afternoons, and in the mornings she does collections. What she likes most about her business is that it doesn't take up all of her time. She has already spent 3 years doing this work, and what she considers most difficult is to make the purchases, because it's hard for her to select the right garments, since she must take into account the tastes of her customers. For the future she has plans to expand her business and buy more glass display cases. This is her 10th loan with MFP, and she confirms her commitment to continue making her payments on time. She is a very responsible woman who is concerned for the well-being and development of her group, since she wants all of the members to get ahead. Maria is planning to invest the money requested in a variety of garments for her business; in this way she plans to continue developing her business in order to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will buy a variety of merchandise (clothing) for her business

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 32 años D. edad, convive con su pareja y sus tres hijos. Juntos residen en L. comunidad D. Manitea Alta, localizada en L. hermosa selva cusqueña, donD. tienen su propia casa a base D. adobe. Cuando tuvo su primer hijo, aun era joven y vivía en casa D. sus padres, pero le incomodaba esa situación, así que emprendió su propio negocio. Con el apoyo D. su pareja decidieron empezar a cultivar cacao, con el paso del tiempo, ambos lo llevan a vender a los mayoristas a un precio razonable. Hoy produce y comercializa cacao y café, sabe que estos dos productos son D. exportación y tienen en mente seguir ampliando su producción para un futuro cercano, siempre y cuando le tomen mucho empeño y dedicación. Por lo general sus productos los venD. en los centros D. acopio D. su comunidad, en donD. sus ventas van creciendo D. forma ascendente. Normalmente trabaja con su pareja desD. las 6:00 D. L. mañana hasta las 6:00 D. L. tarD., pero todos los domingos se da un descanso para que estén pendientes D. sus hijos. Sus planes a futuro es abrir una tienda D. abarrotes con L. necesidad D. que obtenga ingresos extras. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar D. manera puntual, además respalda a su grupo comunal por L. buena organización que tienen. Con el crédito que solicita le servirá para comprar abono y D. esa manera asegurar L. producción D. cacao y café.
texts.en:
Luz is 32 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. They live together in the community of Manitea Alta, located in the beautiful jungle of Cusco, where they have their own house maD. of adobe. When she had her first son, she was still young and was living in with her parents, but that living situation was uncomfortable so she started her own business. With the support of her partner, they decided to start cultivating cocoa. Over time, they have both come to sell to wholesalers at a reasonable price. Now she produces and sells cocoa and coffee, and knowing that these are exportable products, they have in mind that they would like to continue to expand their production in the near future. When they do, it will take a lot of effort and dedication. In general, they sell their products in their community's gathering center, where sales have been growing steadily. Normally Luz works with her partner from 6:00 in the morning to 6:00 at night, but they rest on Sundays in order to spend time with their children. Their future plan is to open a grocery store because they need extra income. This is Luz's sixth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. She promises to make repayments in a punctual manner and furthermore, she is supported by her well-organized community group. With the loan she's requesting, she will buy fertilizer and in this way will ensure better production of cocoa and coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer in order to improve cocoa and coffee production

loans.name: Las Dueñas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama LAS DUEÑAS. Está ubicado en el Estado D.  México.  El grupo está conformado por  12 integrantes. 
Eloísa Valdez  es L. presidenta  del grupo. Tiene 38 años, estudió una carrera Técnica, es comerciante   y madre soltera  D. 3 hijos (1 mujer y 2 varones).  ElL. se dedica a atender su tienda miscelánea que inició hace 8 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar refresco, mas abarrotes y lo que vaya necesitando.
Rubi R. es otro integrante D. este grupo. Tiene  21 (años), estudió hasta el 3er año D.  secundaria, es casada y tiene en total 2 hijas.  ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. zapatos por catalogo y bisutería  que inició hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en zapatos, ropa y bisutería. Sus clientes son las mismas vecinas D. L. localidad les gusta comprar en tanda con elL. los zapatos por que les entrega rápido.  Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta  Quiere este crédito para invertir en todo lo que venD.. También espera que con el tiempo pueda poner un local donD. realice manualidades.
Esta foto fue tomada en L. casa D. L. mama D. Rubí, se ven los catálogos D. Rubí además D. L. Bisutería que venD. D. L. cual cuenta con un amplio surtido

Los otros negocios D. las integrantes del grupo son:
IGNACIA C. (MERCERIA Y MANUALIDADES)
LETICIA R. (VENTA D. TORTILLAS)
LOURDES R. (VENTA D. CORCETERIA)
GLORIA R. (VENTA D. ZAPATOS)
ROSA V. (VENTA D. ROPA)
JUANA M. (VENTA D. TORTILLAS)
ELVIA M. (VENTA D. PAPAS)
MARIANA R. (VENTA D. ART. D. TEMPORADA)
LETICIA V. (VENTA D. HERBALIFE)
VIRIDIANA F. (VENTA D. ZAPATOS)
texts.en:
This group is called LAS DUEÑAS (The Owners) and is located in the State of México, it has 12 members. Eloísa Valdez, 38, is group president. She studied a technical career is a merchant and a single mother of three children (one girl and two boys). She has tended to her general store for the last 8 years. She is asking for funds to buy soft-drinks, more groceries and whatever else she might need. Rubí R., 21, is another member of the group. She finished 9th graD., is married and has two daughters. She sells catalogue shoes and costume jewelry, a business she started two years ago. She is asking for funds to buy shoes, clothes and costume jewelry. Her customers are neighbors from her area who like to make group purchases from her because she delivers the shoes quickly. At the time of requesting the loan she is happy. She wants funds to invest in her stock items. She also hopes to be able to establish a crafts workshop eventually. This photo was taken in Rubí’s mother’s house. One can see Rubí’s catalogues and the large variety of costume jewelry she sells. The other group members are: IGNACIA C. (Merchandise and Handicrafts) LETICIA R. (TortilL. Sales) LOURDES R. (Ladies Underwear Sales) GLORIA R. (Shoe Sales) ROSA V. (Clothing Sales) JUANA M. (TortilL. Sales) ELVIA M. (Potato Sales) MARIANA R. (Seasonal Items Sales) LETICIA V. (Herbalife Sales) VIRIDIANA F. (Shoe Sales)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks, groceries, shoes, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Rio De Cantares Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Rio de Cantares, esta ubicado en el Estado de México. El grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes.

La Sra. Gloria Guardián es integrante del grupo. Tiene la edad de 47años, estudió hasta quinto de primaria, tiene  en total cuatro hijos, 2 mujeres y 2 varones. Ella se dedica al comercio desde hace aproximadamente 18 años, ella comenzó con una mesita que sacaba  a fuera de su casa en el cual vendía chicharrones, refrescos jugos, y dulces a sus vecinos, los cuales la reconocen en toda la comunidad.

La señora invertía del dinero que su esposo le daba de su gasto semanal posteriormente empezó a reinvertir del negocio.

La señora colocó un pequeño negocio que la coca cola le proporcionó, poco a poco construyó un local en el que esta instalada ahora desde hace dos años.

La señora con el crédito de este préstamo lo pide exclusivamente para invertirlo en productos para su tienda y se pueda ver mas surtida, ya que comenta que debido a la competencia y a pesar de que la gente la reconoce desde hace mucho tiempo en ocasiones se ve poquito producto, por eso ahora todo el crédito será para invertirlo en mercancía. 

La foto fue tomada con todas las integrantes del grupo en su comunidad a unos 20 minutos del centro del municipio.

El resto de los integrantes son: 
Emilia A. se dedica ala venta de calzado
María del Socorro B. perfumería 
María Irene B.  tienda
Gloria G. tienda calzado 
María del Carmen V. calzado 
Nayeli Guadalupe V. calzado 
Martha Patricia R. artículos para el hogar 
Julia R. comida 
Ana María D. ropa telas 
Yared R. ropa telas
texts.en:
This group is called “Rio de Cantares” (River of Songs) and is located in the State of México; it has 10 members. Gloria Guardián, 47, is a group member. She finished 5th grade and has four children, two girls and two boys. She has been a merchant for about 18 years. She started out setting up a small table in her front yard where she sold chicharrones (fried pork rinds), juices, soft-drinks and candy to her neighbors among whom she is well known throughout the community. She used to use part of the weekly money her husband would give her but subsequently started to reinvest her earnings into the business. She set up a small stand that Coca-Cola provided for her and gradually built the locale that she’s been in for the last two years. She will use the requested funds exclusively for stock items for her store so that it will be better stocked because she states that even though she is well known in the area she has competition and sometimes she has too few items available to sell. Therefore, she will use the entire loan to purchase merchandise to sell. The photo includes all the members of the group in their community located 20 minutes from downtown. The rest of the members are: Emilia A. (Shoes) María del Socorro B. (Perfume) María Irene B. (Store) Gloria G. (Shoe store) María del Carmen V. (Shoes) Nayeli Guadalupe V. (Shoes) Martha Patricia R. (Items for the home) Julia R. (Prepared food) Ana María D. (Clothing and fabric) Yared R. (Clothing and fabric)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For stock items for her store.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su hijo y a su padre en la ciudad de Zaña, un distrito caracterizado por sus tradiciones y danzas afro – peruanas, sus principales actividades son la agricultura y el comercio, se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a brindar servicio de alquiler de habitaciones en la ciudad de Zaña, ella alquila diversos ambientes situados en la vivienda donde reside a estudiantes y trabajadores que llegan temporalmente a la ciudad. Los ingresos que le provee este negocio los utiliza en el sostenimiento de su hogar, el cuidado de su padre y la educación de su hijo.

Karina desea habilitar una habitación mas para alquilarla, ya que en los últimos meses la demanda por su negocio ha crecido y actualmente no cuenta con espacio suficiente para mas inquilinos, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan realizar las refacciones necesarias que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Su objetivo es sacar adelante a su familia mediante su negocio. Al tener mas habitaciones habilitadas y disponibles ella percibirá mas ingresos y logrará su meta poco a poco. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y sus inquilinos la consideran una mujer amable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Karina, 35, lives with her son and her father in the city of Zaña, noted for its traditions and afro-Peruvian dances. Its main activities are farming and commerce. It is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over three years she has rented out a variety of rooms in her home in Zaña to students and temporary workers who come to the city. Earnings from this business allow her to support her household, care for her father and educate her son. Karina wants to equip another room to rent because demand has grown in the last few months and she currently lacks sufficient space to take in more tenants. This has led to her first loan request of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will make it possible for her to make the necessary improvements to reach her goal. Her objective is to move her family forward through her business. Having more rooms equipped and ready to rent will produce higher income and lead to her reaching her goal gradually. She is considered to be a kind and trustworthy person by her neighbors and her tenants.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To equip a room to rent.

loans.name: Hin

texts.en: Mrs. Hin P., age 35, has three children, all of whom are still young. She was married for a year, but divorced her husband. Presently, P. works as a sewing laborer in the garment industry and receives a formal salary to feed her children. P. has requested a loan to buy a small plot of farmland where she will plant rice crops for family to eat. The loan she pursues will help support P. and her family.

loans.use: To buy a small plot of farmland.

loans.name: Ka

texts.en: Mrs. N., age 34, is a married woman and the mother of four school-aged children who are dependent on her. To earn a living, she sells fish that she buys in bulk and normally earns $3.50 per day. N. and her husband always wake up early in the morning to go where there are many fishermen working. They buy fish and then bring them to sell at retail prices at the market. N. has a small size vehicle which is able to carry a little fish. She hopes to replace it by requesting a loan on Kiva. N. will use this loan to purchase a motorcycle with an attached trailer to transport more fish.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and trailer to transport her fish

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo N. has been selling various types of fish at the market for years. She typically generates an income of $2 per day. She has been married for a long time and has five kids. Two of her children are employed and contribute a small income to the family. Keo N.'s husband also earns an income, fishing in the river for profit. Recently, her husband has not been able to catch as many fish as before due to some of his tools being old and impossible to use. Keo N., therefore, decided to request a Kiva loan of US$500 to be used to renovate the broken fishing tools.

loans.use: To renovate broken fishing tools

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia C. is from the village of Piao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 48 years old, married and has 6 adult and achool-aged children. Virginia owns & operates a farming business. Virginia has been engaged in her business for 18 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.


In 2008, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.  



About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 



*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Fidel Tadeo

texts.es: El solicitante es soltero, trabaja como herrero construye lampas; el oficio lo aprendio de sus abuelos. El destino del credito es para compra de herramientas y materiales
texts.en:
The applicant is single and works as a blacksmith making lamps. This is a trade that he learned from his grandparents. The loan will be used to purchase tools and other materials.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Farming is an activity which Estrella D. (66) and her husband, Lucas, have known since the beginning of their lives. They were born poor and their parents raised them from the income they generated out of cultivating land to farm rice and vegetables. They are not landowners, but hired farm laborers, who receive a small amount of money as payment for their hard work.  

When Estrella had her own family, the lifestyle she was born into was experienced by her three children. There was no individual person or organization that would entrust them with a loan for her to start her own business.  Estrella was not able to support the education of her three children to high school level. All of them were elementary graduates and are now farmers just like their parents.

In 2008, ASHI offered the opportunity to receive loans which would allow her to run her own business. Estrella grabbed that opportunity, and the loans she receives enable her to rent land which she can cultivate for farming rice, along with her husband and children. Their harvest is sold at the market or directly to a middle-man. The proceeds have improved their lifestyle. Therefore, Estrella wants to receive more loans to ensure the sustainability and growth of her business. She wants to support her grandchildren until the cycle of poverty is stopped.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as rice seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat Y. (pictured here) lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a widow with two sons and one daughter. They are all married: two live outside of the family home and the other one stays with her. 


Mrs. Sinat Y. has been operating a business selling finished silk fabric since 1997. She buys silk products from weavers in Ta Keo province and from some from weavers in her village, and transports it  to sell in other provinces far away from her house. 


Sinat has requested Kiva loans several times already. She hopes to continue expanding her business so she is applying for a loan of $500 to purchase additional silk fabrics for resale.

loans.use: To purchase finished silk fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Keu

texts.en:
Mr. Keu S., 60, is a low-income earner who lives in a rural area of Phnom Penh in Cambodia. He was married but his wife died of senility years ago. He has four children: one is now married and lives separately, while the other three are single. All of his children are employed in different jobs. 


Keu S. buys dried fish in bulk to resell at the local market. He also orders fresh fish and turns them into dried fish to sell. In a day he is typically able to make around $10 to control the financial problems of his family. As his current business is a very profitable one for his family, Keu S. is applying for a loan to sustain its growth

loans.use: To sustain the growth of his business

loans.name: Loung

texts.en:
Mrs. P. is a 24-year-old married woman and mother. She has been working as a garment laborer for years and earns a suitable salary to help control all her family’s financial problems. She has another financial earner in her husband, who is a construction worker, working around his community, earning $2 each day. This couple helps each other in order to generate money to support their two school-aged kids. 

P. plans to earn extra income by investing in a new business line out of her home. Because she doesn't have capital, Mrs. P. decided to pursue a loan to buy piglets to raise in a stall she has already established behind her house.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Jesefer

texts.en:
To make a living, Jesefer F. owns and operates a retail store selling daily use products such as soap bar, juice pack,biscuits, noodles, milk, sachet, milo, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 45 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Dimalco, Bonifacio, Misamis. Jesefer has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2008, Jesefer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jesefer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jesefer is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena C. is from the village of Dolores Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Nena is married and has two school-aged children. To earn a living, Nena owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products like canned goods, noodles, vinegar, sugar, shampoo, soap, coffee, and more in the local community. Nena has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nena is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in the expansion of her business. This loan will be the twelfth loan taken out by Nena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Moth

texts.en: Mrs. Moth S., age 55, makes a living by selling fish. She sells the fish that her husband gives her or that she buys from other fisherman. She currently earns an average of US$3 a day, and she has been running her business for several years. Her husband is 53 years old and is a fisherman who works along a local river. Moth S. is the mother of six teenage children, who are no longer in school. All of her children are working at various occupations, and they each contribute some of their incomes to help the family meet its daily expenses. Moth S. is a hard-working woman who never wastes time while engaging in her business activities. As a result of the increasing needs of her clients, Moth S. is applying for a loan so she can purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en:
Lolito R. is from the village of Mialen Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 49 years old. Lolito is married and has five school-aged children. To earn a living, Lolito owns and operates a business venture in the transportation services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor-transport services. Lolito has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lolito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lolito is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to repair existing vehicles in order to provide better service. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Lolito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicles.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel R. is from Lam-an, Ozamiz City. He is 41 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Joel owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motor transport services. Joel has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Joel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Joel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle to provide better service. This will be the fourth loan he has taken out from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Roselito

texts.en:
Roselito L. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 25 years old and single. To make a living, Roselito owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motorcycle transport services. Roselito has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Roselito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair his motorcyle's engine. This will be the first loan he has taken out from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle's engine

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion B. is a 43-year-old hard-working mother. Her husband earns money sporadically as a hired laborer which makes maintaining a cash flow for the family a great challenge on which Salvacion has to work every day. She realized that her dream of having her children graduate from college for a better career in the future was starting to fade because of insufficient income. With that realisation, she gained more courage and determination.

Salvacion joined ASHI in 2009 and requested a loan to finance starting up her own business. At first, she bought and sold fruit and vegetables from their small village. Now, she has realized that since “muscovado” sugar production is very common in the town where she and her family live, she is considering the buying and selling of this product as a business. “Muscovado” is a red sugar produced from a sugar cane trunk. This is processed naturally without any chemical ingredients and preserves a person’s good health and life. Since Salvacion has had the opportunity to request a loan, she has tried very hard to enhance her productivity as a woman so she can support the needs of her family especially her four children whose ages range from five to 17 years old. She hopes that one day her business will expand and its profits increase so she can support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase "muscovado" sugar in bulk for a "buy and sell" business.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta S. is from the village of Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Antonieta owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products such as rice, some snack food, sugar, shampoo, soap, coffee, noodles, soft drinks, etc. in the local community. Antonieta has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Antonieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan she has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Top

texts.en: Top S. is a 60-year-old married woman. She has four children who no longer attend school and currently work in different jobs. She is a homemaker who stays at home to do the daily housework. Top S. relies on the income from her husband’s job. He owns a rental workshop where he operates a service cutting hair for a fee. He finds it hard commuting to his work location or to anywhere else because he doesn’t own a vehicle for his travelling needs. This is the reason that Top S. has requested a loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband's use.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Wilma

Wilma is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be her tenth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita H. is from the village of Senor, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Pacita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Pacita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This will be the 15th loan she has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Arlene Cenas' Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Arlene C., 51 years of age and married, is a resident of Purok Makiangayon, Ozamiz City. Arlene is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Arlene C.’ Group. 	

Arlene is married to Vidal C., a fisherman and farmer. They were blessed with five children, all married. To make a living, she decided to engage in fish vending and some farming activity together with her husband.  For 40 years, she was engaged In this kind of activity and at this time ,she is earning an average net income of not less than P2,000 a month. This amount is very helpful to their family income. She undoubtedly joined the cooperative in the year 2007. As an active member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program that reaches out to the rural poor, she is requesting P3,000 for her fifth loan. It will be used to purchase piglets because she is planning to engage in hog fattening activity. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, to meet their basic needs, for loan repayments to PMPC and for possible house repairs.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced and has one son. She owns a small business that sells clothing at the central market in Novomoskovsk and has been in this business for fifteen years. She has always offered high quality products and excellent client service. She has many repeat clients that make her business a success. Irina has an active life that encourages her business neighbors and friends. 

Irina has used micro-loans before and found them very helpful. This time, she would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and receive additional income to help her son pay for college.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her shop

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy S., 51, is a low-income person living in a rural area of Siem Reap Province. She is married with eight children. She now takes care of four school-aged kids, while another four are ready married and have started new homes.

Soy S. buys fish paste in bulk to resell in the local market. Also, she orders fresh fish and turns them into fish paste to sell. In a day she is normally able to make $3 to control the financial problems of her family.

In addition, Soy S. and her husband farm a few natural crops for extra profit. She planted her crops a few months ago but they are not growing well due to the fact that they may require fertilizer and watering. Soy S. is therefore applying for a loan to purchase a pump to irrigate her crop, as well as to buy fertilizer to sustain her crop yield.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to irrigate her crop

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Mrs. Ven S. A., aged 30, operates her own small business selling different types of vegetable at the local market. She sells the vegetables that she grows or buys them from other farmers. She has a life partner in her husband (who appears in the photo above) who is also a truck driver for a small firm. The couple helps each other in order to feed their two teenage kids, who are enrolled in school.

Ven S. A.’s husband has recently resigned from his job and he hopes to invest in a motorcycle-trailer business as a taxi driver but he has no capital yet to stA. this business. Therefore, Ven S. A. has requested a loan of US$500 to be used to buy a second-hand motorcycle with attached trailer for her husband to use to pick up passengers for a fee.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle with attached trailer for her husband's businesss

loans.name: Luy

texts.en:
Luy L. is 50 years old and the widowed mother of three children who are single. One of them earns about $90 a month as a garment factory laborer.

Luy L. has used a stall next to her house for raising some animals for income since her kids were very young. She and her daughter have another skill in sewing clothes and they want to use this knowledge to earn additional income. However, they have no capital to make that possible. Because of that, Luy L. borrowed a loan of $200 to buy a sewing machine that she will use to provide a sewing service for a profit.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Lach S., a 53-year-old married woman and mother, has been working as a local chef  for years and normally earns a suitable income to help control all of her family’s financial problems. She has another financial earner in her husband, who farms a few vegetable crops on  land next to his house, earning $1 each day. Lach has given birth to four children, two of whom are now married and livjng independently, while the remaining two are single and work. Lach is now requesting a loan from Kiva’s field partner, HKL, to purchase a new motorcycle to provide transportation for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to provide transportation for family.

loans.name: Chhoa

texts.en:
Mr. Chhoa P., 59, is a village consultant advisor who lives in a rural area of Siem Reap province in Cambodia. He was married to his wife many years ago. He has five children and all five are now married and have already started new homes. All of his children are employed in different jobs.

Chhoa P. owns a machine that he uses to provide a milling service for farmers for a fee. He has another financial earner in his wife who appears in the photo here. She raises a few pigs in a pigpen they built next to their house. In a day the family is typically able to make around $10 to control the financial problems of their family.

As the pig-raising trade is a very profitable one for his family, Chhoa P. is applying for a loan to purchase many piglets for their stall.

loans.use: To purchase many piglets for their stall
