To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for sewing women's national dresses

loans.name: Powerful Women Group

texts.en:
Gloria M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Powerful Women. She is 42 years old, married and has five  children who range from 2 to 22 years old. She was only able to attend school through 4th grade. 

For 15 years, she has been selling rice, oil and pepper at Thinkers Village Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She says customers are attracted to her business because she talks to them in a friendly manner.

She plans to use her 18,000 LRD portion of this 82,000 LRD group loan to buy more rice, oil and pepper. Her goal is to improve her business and to continue to support her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, oil and pepper

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en:
J. Umeda is a woman who, on a daily basis, seeks her children's advancement. She works with great effort for them and wants to continue to do so to build an improved and promising future. Ever since Umeda was a little girl, she has been devoted to her farming activities. She was raised this way and it has been a stable source of income until now. She must start her farming chores very early in the day. Now that it is sowing season, she works hard to sow and tend the fields. She hopes that this time the harvest will be productive.

Umeda is asking for this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers in order to obtain a very good quantity and quality of onions, tomatoes, cucumbers and wheat. Let’s show solidarity for this selfless mother who looks for what is best for her children. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Azizboy

texts.en: K. Azizboy is 39 years old. Azizboy has been raising cattle for the last five years. Over the years of his activities, two of his children became adults and now help him as well as his wife. Currently, Azizboy has three heads of the cattle in the household. This type of business is rather time-consuming and labor-consuming. At the same time, it generates stable profits. Now Azizboy is planning to purchase more cows and fodder for them. For this purpose, he requests 4,000 Somoni. This is the first loan for Azizboy and he is grateful to everyone for trusting him and supporting him and promises not to let them down. loans.use: Purchasing three cows and fodder

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.en: Abdumalik is a 37-year-old married man and the father of three children. He is an experienced farmer. He grows vegetables and fruits on a piece of land next to his home. At the same time, Abdumalik and his wife are engaged in the business of raising and selling cattle. Currently, he needs the amount of 6,000 Somoni. Abdumalik wants to expand his business further, as this will allow him to generate more revenue for his large family and improve their livelihood. This is his first loan with IMON International, a Kiva partner. Abdumalik will invest his funds into the purchase of seeds and fertilizer for his crops. loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
K. Shuhrat is 30 years old. He is married and has 5 children. Shuhrat is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 10 years. He bakes the national bread “lepeshka” at home. His wife helps him with his business. Having many customers, Shuhrat sells the majority of his products from home. However, he also runs a trading place in the central local market selling ”lepeshka”. 


Shuhrat is requesting $1000. He is planning to purchase flour wholesale. Shuhrat is grateful to everyone who is supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.
