loans.use: to buy flour wholesale for making "lepeshka"

loans.name: Natalia Fernando

texts.pt:
Natalia B. nasceu na Província de Sofala centro de Moçambique é casada mãe de 2 filhos, de 17, 8 anos, todos eles vão a escola. Vive na casa própria sustenta sua sogra e sobrinha que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Sofala com seus pais para Maputo no tempo da guerra, inicia com os estudos e faz a 9ª. Anos depois teve uma proposta para trabalhar na escola como auxiliar administrativa onde se encontra ate então, aufere mensalmente um valor de 2.188.00mt. com empréstimo adquirido no BIM no valor de 20.000,mt inicia a construção da sua casa, mas devido ao elevado preço do material ela não consegue concluir sua obra e aproxima se a Hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo para o mesma finalidade.

Este é o quarto empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, portas e cimento) para dar continuidade da sua obra. Os três empréstimos anteriores de 3.500.00mt, 5.000.00mt e de 9.00.00mt foram para a mesma finalidade. 

  Esta feliz porque dentro em breve vai se mudar para a sua própria casa e confiante que ira reembolsar cem nenhum problema para aceder a mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
Natalia B. was born in the Sofala province in the center of Mozambique. She is married and is the mother of two children, who are 17 and 8 years old. Both of them attend school. She lives in her own home and also supports her mother-in-law and niece, who live with her.

She left Sofala with her parents for Maputo during the war. She studied through 9th grade. Years later, she was offered a job in the school as an administrative assistant, where she continues to work today. She earns 2,188MT each month.

With the loan she got from BIM for 20,000MT, she began construction on her home. However, due to the elevated price of materials, she was not able to finish the construction, and she approached Hluvuku to seek additional loans for the same purpose. This is her fourth loan, and is for the amount of 10,000MT. She plans to use this loan to purchase construction materials (sheet metal, cement, etc.) to continue work on her home. The three previous loans were for 3,500MT, 5,000MT and 9,000MT and were used for the same purpose.

She is happy because soon she will be able to move into her own home and she is confident that she will be able to repay the loan without any problems.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Manuel Adalberto

texts.pt:
Manuel Adalberto M. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província do Maputo, casado e pai de uma filha de 11 anos de idade que freqüenta escola. Fez somente 6ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive numa casa alugada e sustenta seu irmão que vive com ele. 

Nunca saiu da sua cidade natal, trabalha no Hotel Xisaka no Distrito de Namaacha, como Técnico de manutenção de máquinas ha mais de 5 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e aufere um salario de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o quarto empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar matérial de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, blocos e outros) para continuar com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 3.500.00mt, 5.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt para áreas de serviços e habitação. 

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais crédito para mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Manuel Adalberto M. was born in the Namaacha district, in the Maputo province. He is married and is the father of an 11-year-old daughter who attends school. He himself went through 6th grade but did not continue because his parents lacked the funds. He lives in a rented home and he also supports his brother, who lives with him.

He has never left the city he was born in. He has worked for more than 5 years in the Hotel Xisaka, which is in the Namaacha district, as a maintenance technician. He has no employees and makes a monthly salary of 3,000MT, which he uses to pay for his expenses and even saves some to his bank account.

He has never taken out a loan with another bank. He came to know Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his fourth loan, for the amount of 20,000MT. He plans to use this amount to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stone, blocks, etc.) to continue his work. The previous loans were for 3,500MT, 5,000MT and 15,000MT and were used for housing as well. He promises to make his repayments dutifully so that he can access loans in the future, in order to furnish his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de matérial de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, blocos e outros)

loans.name: Kikubo Traders And Poultry-Keeping Association, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
This 37-year-old operates her five-year-old secondhand garment sales business along Karegyesa Road in Rukungiri town. Before she obtained a footing in her current business, she was operating a stationery shop.

All along, however, U. Doreen, a married mother of four, had been nursing a dream to start a clothes boutique. A business like this, she knew, requires good customer relationship skills and Doreen has strived to achieve success in that regard, in the course of time. Experienced decision making has also been her other success attribute.

Profits have been steadily accruing to Doreen’s business and, at present, her weekly profits stand at 200,000 shillings. Her hardworking nature is always a factor that she says is going to help her expand her business. She says she wants to expand her operating area and operations eventually. She sees this coming to pass on the back of acquiring this loan.

Given the high demand for cheap secondhand clothing in rural areas across the country, Doreen's chances of achieving prosperity are at least ten to one. It’s only time that she says is the limit.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothing to sell

loans.name: Milion Mussa

texts.pt:
Milion Mussa C. nasceu em Niassa Capital Lichinga, Norte de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos, os dois mais velhos gêmeos de 14, 12 e de 3 anos de idade destes três vão a escola. Fez a 12ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua mãe enviando dinheiro para despesas de casa.

Saiu de Lichinga para Maputo com seu irmão para continuar com os estudos. Trabalha como conselheiro e gestor de dados nos médicos do mundo ha mais de 8 anos, onde mensalmente aufere 700U$D dólar americano, correspondente a (17.500.00mt) que aplica nas despesas de casa e da sua obra. Consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria, mas não sempre porque tem que pagar as despesas escolares da sua esposa na Faculdade.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Milion na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual será usado para legalizar o terreno em anexo ao anterior. Os anteriores e ambos de 15.000.00mr foram usados na compra de material de construção para sua obra.
Esta convicto que vai pagar cem nenhum problema e pedir um novo para erguer uma casa no terreno que esta por legalizar.
texts.en:
Milion Mussa C. was born in Lichinga--the capital city of Niassa province--in northern Mozambique. He is married and is the father of 4 children. The two oldest are 14 year old twins, and the other children are 12 and 3 years of age. Three of them attend school. Milion studied through the 12th grade, but did not continue due to a lack of resources. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his mother by sending her money to use for household expenses. Milion left Lichinga for Maputo with his brother in order to continue his studies. He has worked as an advisor and a data manager for Doctors of the World [Médicos do Mundo/Médicins du Monde, a non-governmental organization] for over 8 years. He makes 17,500 MZN per month--equivalent to $700 USD--, which he uses to pay for household expenses and his own work. He saves some in his bank account, although he is not always able to because he has to pay for his wife's college expenses. This is Milion's third loan with Hluvuku and first with Kiva. It has a value of 15,000 MZN, which he will use to legalize the land attached to his other property. The previous loans, both for 15,000 MZN, were used to buy construction material for the work. He is sure that he will be able to pay back the loan without any problems and ask for another one in order to erect a house on the land to be legalized.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To legalize land

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is a 30-year-old man married to a school bursar and together they have a one-year-old. In his family, Tadeo is charged with looking after the three people he lives with. As a young man, he dreams of building a better residential house with well-educated children. 

Tadeo has a video rental store in which he offers printing, recording, and renting out of music and video Compact Disks, a business he has been in for the last three years. Just like any other business, Tadeo says he too faces competition in his business sector with an ever increasing number of entrants. However, Tadeo says he would like to grow his business into a computer training centre and a big collection of music and  video. The purpose of the loan funds is to buy a computer for his business.

loans.use: buying a computer for his music collection

loans.name: Able And Dependable God Group

texts.en:
Joshua D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Able And Dependable God. He is 45 years old, married and has two children who range from 18 to 30 years old. He is a university dropout due to financial constraints. 

For 4 years, he has been selling slippers, soap, candles, matches and mosquito spray on Carey Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia.
He says customers get attracted to his business because he talks to them in a friendly manner.

He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more stock. He describes himself as a peaceful and quiet person.
 
His goal is to expand his business and to continue to support his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more slippers, soap, candles, matches and mosquito spray.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is currently in the business of selling bedsheets at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bedsheets to sell.  Rose is 39 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop as her point of sale.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bedsheets

loans.name: Too Faitful Group

texts.en:
Felecia L., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Too Faithful.  She is 29 years old, engaged and has three children who range from seven months to 8 years old. She was only able to attend school to 12th grade due to poverty. Two of her children are in school and she also cares for two siblings.

For 10 years she has been selling items such as rice, creme, pots and onions on the Roberts Field Highway on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 38,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy rice, creme, pots, onions and other goods that she sells.
 
Her hope is to make sufficient profit to take good care of her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy rice, creme, pots, onions and other goods that she sells.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
Alberto T. nasceu em Namaacha, vizinho com o reino da Suazilândia, província de Maputo, casado e pai de 7 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 1 aos 16 anos, os mais velhos é que vão a escola. Fez a 10ª classe e de seguida engrena num curso de professorado que durou dois anos (tempo regular). Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Nunca saiu do Distrito, após o curso de professorado é afeto numa localidade que dista a 45km da vila sede do Município. É funcionário permanente ha mais de 16 anos com a categoria de Director da Escola auferindo 7.799.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
 
Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos e resolvei não continuar mais. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes da Hluvuku. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, cimento, ferro, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 15.000.00mt para a mesma actividade. 
 
Esta confiante que vai pagar cem nenhum problema e pedir novo empréstimo para fazer um murro de vedação em sua residência.
texts.en:
Alberto T. was born in Namaacha, Maputo province, near the Mozambique's border with Swaziland. He is married and is the father of 7 children who are between 1 and 16 years old. The oldest go to school. He studied through 10th grade and then entered a professoriate course, which lasted 2 years (normal time). He lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else. He has never left the District; after the professoriate course, he was hired in a town 45km away from the main village in the municipality. He has been a permanent employee there for more than 16 years, and as School Director he makes 7,799 MZN each month. He uses this to pay for household expenses and even saves some in his bank account. Alberto has had loans with other banks and decided not to continue with them. He found out about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his second loan, which has a value of 20,000 MZN. He plans to use to to buy construction material (rock, cement, iron, sand, etc.) in order to continue working on his home. The previous loan of 15,000 MZN was for the same purpose. He is confident that he can pay back the loan without any problems and ask for a new one to build a protective wall around his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material (rock, cement, iron, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Teresa Jobe

texts.pt:
Teresa Jobe N. nasceu na Província de Inhambane Sul de Moçambique solteira mãe de três filhas com idades compreendidas entre os 19 aos 26 anos todas vão a escola. Fez a 7ª classe não conseguiu concluir devido a falta de condições financeiras, vive na casa do estado e responsabiliza se pelo seu pai que vive em Zavala.

Saiu de Inhambane para o Distrito de Namaacha na Fronteira com a Suazilândia, devido a transferência do seu pai. Trabalha no Governo do Distrito ha a mais de 31 anos é também chefe da localidade, auferindo mensalmente 6.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas da casa e consegue poupar algum de vez em quanto na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros Bancos, este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro com kiva no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade da sua obra. O empréstimo anterior foi de 10.000,00mt também para a mesma actividade.

 No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para adquirir uma viatura, para ajudar no transporte pessoal.
texts.en:
Teresa Jobe N. was born in Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique. She is a single mother of 3 daughters who are between 19 and 26 years old. All of them go to school. She studied through the 7th grade but was not able to finish due to a lack of financial resources. She lives in government housing and supports her father, who lives in Zavala. Teresa left Inhambane for Namaacha District on the border with Swaziland due to her father's transfer. She has worked for the District government for more than 31 years and is also head of the town. She earns 6,000 MZN each month, which she uses to pay for household expenses. She is able to save some from time to time in her bank account. She has never had loans with other banks. This is her second loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva; it has a value of 20,000 MZN, which she plans to use to buy construction material (cement, iron, etc.) in order to continue working on her house. The previous loan of 10,000 MZN was for the same purpose. In the future Teresa would like to request more loans in order to obtain a vehicle for personal use.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material (cement, iron, etc.)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose W. currently sells charcoal at her home. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Rose is 42 years old and is widowed.   She has 7 children, 3 of whom go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline N. is currently in the business of selling bread, tomatoes and groundnut paste and is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes and onions to sell. Jackline is 27 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a hotel. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian K. is currently in the business of selling beans, maize flour and cassava tubers at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more maize flour to sell. Lilian is 41 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop from where she can sell her goods. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more maize flour to sell

loans.name: Vertimano

texts.en: Vertimano L. is currently in the business of selling rice and beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and beans to sell. Vertimano is 29 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a store for her goods. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. is currently in the business of selling dresses and pairs of trousers at the local market and is requesting a loan to stock bedsheets and sandles to sell.  Josephine is 47 years old and is widowed.   She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bedsheets and pairs of sandles to sell

loans.name: Santina

texts.en:
Santina S. is currently in the business of selling dresses and bedsheets at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bedsheets to sell. Santina is 38 years old and is married with a husband who is a head teacher. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy sewing machines.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 50-year-old lady married to a mechanic with a family of six children; they live in Masindi, Uganda. She says she pays the school fees for her children with a dream that they all will be educated up to university. She operates a bar in Masindi and has been in the business for six years, having started doing business with a retail shop. Her bar business has challenges just like any other business with bad debtors and the ever increasing cost of electricity in the country. 

That said though, Christine still feels good about the business and hopes to make it into a big guest house one day. For now, with the help of the credit  facility from HOFOKAM, Christine intends to buy beer, spirits, a  digital television set, and a generator for her pub.

loans.use: buying beer, spirits, digital television set, and a generator

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose I. is currently in the business of selling ice cream, cakes and bread at the market and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil and tomatoes to sell.  Rose is 21 years old and single.   With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house to rent.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock cooking oil and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
El señor Ernesto vive en casa propia  en la zona alto San Pedro; es viudo y vive con sus dos hijos.
 El señor Ernesto está jubilado de un periodico ( newspaper) de esta ciudad y sus ingresos los recibe a través de la seguridad social y son los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un techo para un solarium, para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr.Ernesto lives in a house of his own in the area of San Pedro. He is a widower and lives with his two children. Mr. Ernesto retired after working for a newspaper in the city. Social security provides him with an income to support his family. The loan he is asking for will be used to build a roof for a solarium, in order to improve his quality of life. This is the fourth time Mr. Ernesto has asked for a loan. The socioeconomic analysis performed deems him qualified for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building of roof

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is currently in the business of selling local brew and beer at her bar and is requesting a loan to buy supplies of crates of beer for her business.  Rose is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her bar.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal German Busch, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal Fortaleza. Su presidenta es Geoma Urquizo  que tiene el negocio de venta de calzados ella trabaja con su esposo  hace 5 años y conocen muy bien el mercado, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando Bs.- 1500 y tiene planificado comprar materia prima. 
Geoma y su esposo se organizan para atender su negocio y su  familia y no descuidar ambas tareas, así su esposo es quien produce los calzados y Geoma los días Jueves y Domingo vende sus productos.
Las demás integrantes de este grupo tienen diferentes actividades que se dedican al comercio, producción y servicio.
texts.en:
The Fortaleza (Strength) communal bank meets at the German Busch Focus Center every two weeks. The group president is Geoma Urquizo who has sold shoes with her husband for the past 5 years; they know this business very well. She is asking for 1500 bolivares to buy raw materials. Geoma and her husband organize themselves to tend to their business and to their family not neglecting either task. Her husband makes the shoes and Geoma sells them on Thursdays and Sundays. The other group members are in a variety of commercial, production and service activities.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia L. is currently in the business of selling various foodstuffs in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs like rice and beans.  Nadia is 36 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs like rice and beans

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan A. vive con sus tres hijos en una casa en alquiler que esta ubicada en la zona Tembladerani en la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Juan A. es propietario de una movilidad con la cual trabaja en una línea de transporte de pasajeros; es así como obtiene sus ingresos y la esposa ayuda con labores casa.
El crédito solicitado es para hacer un mantenimiento general a su herramienta de trabajo.
Esta es la cuarta  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Juan A. lives with his three children in a rented house located in La Paz’s Tembladerani neighborhood. He owns a vehicle with which he provides public transportation services. This is how he earns income; his wife helps out working as a domestic employee. The funds will be used for general service maintenance on his vehicle. This is his 4th loan request and the socioeconomic evaluation conducted yielded a favorable rating so he qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 44 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y alegre, que  vive en su casa propia, en compañía de  su esposo y sus 2 hijos menores.La actividad cotidiana a la que se dedica Rosa, es la venta la comida. Su especialidad es la preparación de papas rellenas (plato típico cuyo relleno es de carne), que vende en un puesto cercano a un colegio. Sus compradores potenciales son los estudiantes y las madres de familia. Hace algunos años atrás vendía en la puerta de su casa, y no le era muy rentable, pero desde que se ubicó en la puerta de este colegio, siempre termina de vender lo que ha preparado. Se siente muy feliz con lo que hace, ya que el apoyo de sus hijos alivia su cansancio y lo más difícil para ella, es pelar las papas calientes, que no le permiten avanzar muy rápido. Para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su puesto y educar a sus hijos.Este es el décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas con puntualidad, ya que sabe que este dinero le será  muy útil para el progreso de su negocio. En su grupo es una socia  comprometida en las actividades de su grupo. Rosa tiene planeado  invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de insumos y mercaderías en comestibles, para surtir  su negocio, y así quiere ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa, 44, is a hard-working, cheerful mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and two minor children. Her daily work consists in selling prepared meals. Her specialty is stuffed potatoes (a typical dish stuffed with meat) that she sells in a stand located near a high school. Her potential customers are students and mothers. A few years ago she sold at her doorstep and didn’t earn much but, since moving to the school’s entrance, she always sells out all she prepares. She is very happy with her work because her children help her thereby easing her fatigue. The most difficult chore for her is peeling the hot potatoes, which slows her down. For the future, she plans to enlarge her stand and educate her children. This is her 10th loan from MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion because she knows this money will be very useful for the progress of her business. She is a committed participant in her communal group’s activities. Rosa plans to use the requested funds to buy raw materials and food ingredients to stock her business because she wants to offer her customers the best.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and foodstuffs for her business.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijas, Yeny de 9 y Nipta de 4 años de edad respectivamente. Juntas viven en la ceja de la selva peruana, ubicada en la comunidad de Manitea Alta, donde tienen  su propia casa a base de madera. Hace 20 años trabajaba en la actividad agrícola, en donde cultiva y comercializa cacao. Recuerda que empezó con una pequeña parcela en donde solo lo alcanzaba para su canasta familiar, hoy produce de manera considerable a los grandes mayoristas y por tal obtiene buenas ganancias económicas. 

Es entonces que al percibir y ahorrar estas ganancias, pudo abrir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes con la finalidad de cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Por tanto su mayor anhelo es abastecer su tienda y ampliar sus plantaciones de cacao, con el propósito de ganar más, tanto clientes como posicionarse en el mercado. Por el momento se encuentra a cargo de su tienda de abarrotes, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus padres. por otro lado contrata peones para que se encarguen de sus campos de cacao y puedan facilitarle la extracción de su producto terminado, en donde es comercializado en los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando de manera puntual, además se siente respaldado por su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercadería, para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes, con la necesidad de poder cubrir los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hilda is 40 years old and the single mother of two daughters: Yeny, age 9, and Nipta, age 4. They live together on the edge of the Peruvian jungle, in the community of Manitea Alta, where they have their own wooden house. For the past 20 years, Hilda has worked in agriculture, growing and selling cocoa. She recalls that she began with only a small parcel of land, which only served to cover her own consumption. Today, she produces and sells on a significant scale, dealing with large wholesalers, and in this way she obtains excellent economic returns. She saved her profits and thus was also able to open a small grocery store with the aim of satisfying her customers' needs. In the future, Hilda hopes to expand both her grocery store and her cocoa fields, with the aim of attracting more customers and positioning herself better in the market. Toward this aim, she works tirelessly on her business. For the moment, she runs her store herself, though she occasionally receives help from her parentr. At harvest time, she needs assistance from hired laborers to get the work done and help transport the crops to the warehouses where they are sold. This is Hilda's fifth loan with MFP, and she is committed to continue being punctual with her payments. She feels well-supported by her communal bank group. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy merchandise to stock her store, so that she can satisfy the tastes and preferences of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products to stock her store

loans.name: El Sol Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, Panamericana, se reúnen cada dos semanas la  Asociación Comunal EL SOL. Su presidenta es María C. C., ella se dedica a producir y vender helados hace 25 años, aprendió esta actividad sola, con el primer préstamo que obtuvo en Pro Mujer compró una garrafa y poco a poco fue equipando su taller, ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima como la gelatina y el azúcar. Ella también cuenta con un lugar de venta  cerca a un complejo deportivo, le ayuda en su negocio su hija y considera que su grupo es como una familia porque todas se ayudan.

Las demás  integrantes de esta Asociación tienen variados negocios que se dedican a la comercialización, producción y servicio.
texts.en:
The community group EL SOL meets at Panamericana, one of Pro Mujer's offices. Its president, Maria C. C., has operated a business making and selling ice cream for 25 years. She picked up the skills for the work on her own. With her first Pro Mujer loan, she bought an ice cream maker and she has slowly equipped the business ever since. She now needs a loan to buy basic supplies like gelatin and sugar. Maria sells her product at a spot near a sports field. Her daughter helps her with the business but she considers the whole community group to be her family because of the help they have provided. The other group members operate various kinds of sales, production and service businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Essential supplies for various businesses

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza De Atalla Group

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Bancomunal Nueva Esperanza que esta ubicado en L. Comunidad D. AtalL. – Wari Rumi del departamento D. Huancavelica, L. actividad económica principal D. L. comunidad es L. Agricultura y Ganadería. El Bancomunal inicia su primer ciclo con 18 socias. Antonia es una D. las socias que tiene el cargo D. Tesorera, es casada y tiene 06 hijos (4 varones y 2 mujeres) 4 D. ellos asisten a L. EscueL. D. L. Comunidad los otros 2 aun están pequeños. 
Antonia se dedica a L. venta D. granos y también tiene un carro que utiliza para hacer movilidad D. pasajeros entre las comunidades D. Antacancha y Lircay. Antonia se inició en el negocio vendiendo queso y huevo desD. muy pequeña. Su dificultad siempre ha sido L. falta D. capital para invertir en sus negocios, es por ello que no pudo estudiar, ahora está contenta D. pertenecer a FINCA porque recibirá capacitación sobre el ahorro, y le gusta no tener que depender siempre D. su esposo.
Antonia, necesita un préstamo con el cual podrá comprar más granos como cebada y trigo tostado, los que llevará al molino y posteriormente traerá a Lima. 
Su sueño es comprar un camión para recolectar granos en su comunidad y ser empresaria.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Nueva Esperanza community bank in AtalL.-Wari Rumi, a town in the Peruvian "departamento" of Huancavelica. Her main sources of income are farming and raising livestock. The community bank started its first round with 18 members. Antonia is one of the group's treasurers. She is married and has 6 children (4 boys and 2 girls), 4 at the local school and 2 still at home. Antonia raises grain crops. She also operates a taxi business ferrying passengers between the towns of Antacancha and Lircay. She started her first business selling cheese and eggs when she was very young. Her problem has always been a lack of capital to invest in her businesses. She is now happy to be a FINCA member because she will learn how to save. She also likes not having to depend solely on her husband. Antonia needs a loan so that she can buy barley and wheat that she will process at a local mill and then sell in Lima. Her greatest wish is to buy a truck so that she can transport her town's grain and become a successful businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains for farming business.

loans.name: Ray

texts.en:
Ray owns a business that resells or leases GPS (Global Positioning System) units. He also provides GPS and security camera system installations for other organizations and companies. The 53-year-old computer and electronic services consultant advises clients on what equipment best suits their needs. 

Ray has been in the business for 10 years and has received 3 previous loans from ACCION USA. In order to further expand his business, Ray has requested another loan. This loan would allow him hire a temporary worker, add a store-like function to his website, and add money for working capital. Ray is expecting to close a deal soon which would require an extra worker and additional supplies to fulfill the order. 

Ray plans to continue expanding his business by partnering with larger companies and expanding his market base. With purchasing options on his website, he expects to gain more customers and boost sales. As his company grows, he will hire more workers and empower the hard-working men and women in his community.

About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA

Have you ever thought about how the new café on your corner and the delivery service that brings the fresh baked goods acquired the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated 10 million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis.” Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. 

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: Hiring a staff member and improvement to his website

loans.name: Kagera Women's Group, Jinja

texts.en:
It pays to be unwavering, patient and enterprising, as 37-year-old K. Aisha, a married mother of seven, would attest. Patience in a fledgling and harsh business environment, she says, is bitter but the upshot is invariably success if one also carries enough conviction. Often this has to be combined with other invaluable attributes like good customer care skills to complete the whole package.

Aisha has endeavored to go with the tide as she plies her six-year-old produce-sales business in Kamuli, Jinja. She has established a niche for herself selling mostly maize and beans to market vendors. There is a semblance of the progress that she envisaged at the threshold, as her clientele increases.

Long before she even thought about starting this business, Aisha was mostly into odd jobs, principally working in a modest local-area bakery. At present, she makes profits to the tune of 280,000 a month. She has also been eking out profits from her farming business.

With this loan, Aisha is upbeat about the prospect of expanding her business through substantial purchases of crops like maize, beans and potatoes.

loans.use: To purchase maize, beans and potatoes for her business

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor, de 36 años, es una mujer solidaria, vive con su esposo, que es albañil, y junto a sus 2 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 10 años, junto con su pareja, se propusieron construir de a pocos su casa. En verano, trabaja por las riberas de la playa, ofreciendo gaseosas y refrescos helados. Con estas utilidades ayuda a llevar la carga familiar, y también con los ingresos del trabajo de su esposo. Desde entonces, de a pocos, han ido preparando las vigas, paredes y el techo de su añorada casa, es por eso que Flor se encuentra muy satisfecha por el trabajo mancomunado y los logros que obtienen juntos. Su mayor anhelo inmediato es revestir las paredes de su casa, para evitar que se alojen los insectos, y mas adelante tiene planeado colocar mayólicas en su piso. De ese modo espera  brindar una calidad de vida más confortable  para sus  hijos.Este es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y sabe que el préstamo le será muy beneficioso para continuar con las construcciones de su casa, por ello se compromete a pagar con todas sus cuotas oportunamente.Flor tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de tubos para la instalación de luz, además de arena fina, cemento y otros materiales, de esta manera desea seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Flor, 36, is a woman with a strong sense of community. She lives with her husband, a construction worker and their 2 children in a house that they own. She and her husband have wanted to improve the house for 10 years. During the summer, Flor operates a business selling cold drinks along the beach. This extra income helps, with her husband's income, to move the project along. Over the years, they have been working on the framing, walls and roof of their much-desired house. Flor is happy with the progress they have made together. Her goal now is to treat the walls for insects. Next, she wants to tile the floors. Her overall goal is to provide a comfortable place for her children to live. This is Flor's first MFP loan. She knows that it will help her to continue building her house and, consequently, she is committed to repaying the loan on time. She will use the money from the loan to buy tubing for the house's lighting, along with sand, cement and other building materials.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: Fidel, de 25 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijo alguno. Reside en la selva tropical peruana, ubicada en la comunidad de Manitea Alta, donde tiene su propia casa. Desde su adolescencia empezó como ayudante, trabajando en la chacra de su vecino y todo lo que ganaba se lo guardaba. Luego de un tiempo adquirió una parcela considerable, en donde producía y comercializaba cacao y café, desde entonces sus ventas fueron incrementándose. Actualmente comercializa su producción a los grandes mayoristas y a los centros de acopio de su comunidad a un precio competitivo, eso le da mucha ventaja en las ganancias. Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en temporada de sembrío y cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones para que lo pueda facilitar la extracción de su producto final. Sus planes a futuro es terminar de construir su casa a base de material noble, con la finalidad de mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además augura un porvenir en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de insumos y abono para mejorar la producción de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Fidel, 25, is single and has no children. He lives in his own house in the town of Manitea Alta in the Peruvian jungle. As a boy, he worked as a field hand, laboring on a local farm and saving everything he earned. He eventually managed to buy his own farm where he grows cocoa and coffee. His output has steadily increased and he now sells his crop to the large wholesaleers and warehouses in his town, an advantage because he can get a better price. He normally works on his own but he hires laborers to help him during the planting and harvesting seasons. Fidel would like to finish building his house, something that will improve his quality of life. This is his second MFP loan and he is committed to repaying it on time. He hopes to work with the community group in the future, as well. He will use this loan to buy supplies and manure to improve his production of cacao and coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business

loans.name: Flamencos Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, Collpani, se reúnen cada 28 días la  Asociación Comunal FLAMENCOS. Su presidenta es Gregoria Q. de 60 años, ella se dedica a vender productos de chifleria (medicina natural a base de yerbas), hace dos años y necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería. Gregoria tiene su puesto de venta en la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto, en la zona 12 de Octubre y vende todos los días, cuenta con el apoyo de su hija. 
Las demás  integrantes de esta Asociación tienen variados negocios que se dedican a la comercialización, producción y servicio.
texts.en:
The FLAMECOS community group meets every 28 days at Collpani, a Pro Mujer office. Its president is Gregoria Q., 60, who has operated a business selling "chifleria" (a herbal medicine) for two years. She needs the loan to buy merchandise. Gregoria operates her business at the La Ceja market in the Bolivian city of El Alto. Her daughter helps her and they work there every day. The other members of the community group have various sales, production and service businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Essential supplies for various businesses

loans.name: Mireya Esther

texts.es: Mireya P. tiene un hijo de 15 años y es la propietaria de la "Sala de Belleza Mireya Fashion"  ubicada en el barrio Alquería de Bogotá, la capital de Colombia.  Su negocio es vender imagen personal y profesional  y está dirigido a mujeres, hombres, niños y niñas, a quienes ofrece servicios de   tratamientos de hidratación capilar profunda, imagen rejuvenecida,  asesoría de imagen, cortes cepillados depilación y servicios de belleza adaptados a las necesidades de cada cliente y de acuerdo a sus edad. Ella inició esta actividad  desde Junio del 2006, cuando puso en marcha su más significativo sueño. Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando por un monto de $2.000.000 COP, lo va a invertir principalmente en la compra de  productos de rejuvenecimiento especialmente en unidades de botox capilar. Su mayor desafío es el manejo del tiempo, porque dedica gran parte de él  a su negocio, lo cual le resta para tener un espacio de esparcimiento compartido  con su hijo. Mireya sueña con ser muy reconocida  y con unidades de negocios o sucursales en zonas importantes de la ciudad. En la actualidad se siente satisfecha de vivir  en un bonito y comercial sector que potencializa un flujo importante de clientes constantemente y sobre todo de su hijo es su motivación principal.
texts.en:
Mireya P. has a 15-year-old son and is owner of a beauty salon called: "Sala de Belleza Mireya Fashion” located in the Alquería neighborhood of Bogotá, Colombia’s capital. He business consists in selling personal and professional appearance and is aimed at women, men and children to whom she offers deep hair hydration treatments, rejuvenated appearance, image consultancy, haircuts, hair removal, and age-appropriate beauty treatments designed to order based on each customer’s needs. She started her business in June, 2006, when she launched her dream. This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she’s asking for $2.000.000 pesos to invest primarily in rejuvenating treatments, especially hair Botox. Her greatest challenge is time management because she spends so much time at work that she lacks time to spend with her son. Mireya dreams with becoming very well-known and with having branch establishments in important areas of the city. She is currently very satisfied to be living in a beautiful, commercial sector that has a potentially important stream of customers available constantly; her son is her main motivation.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rejuvenating products, especially hair Botox.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of computers

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva,  de 22 años,  es una joven con ansias de salir adelante, vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y de  sus 2 hermanos.Trabaja e invierte su dinero en la tienda de comestibles que tiene su madre. Los días que no labora  se dedica íntegramente a este negocio, pues el 30% es su capital. Sus  clientes son sus vecinos del barrio  y algunos  transeúntes, a quienes les atiende calidamente. Desde que tiene 17 años trabaja en diversos oficios relacionados a las ventas, y siempre muestra sus ganas de salir adelante, por ello de a pocos viene forjando su capital de trabajo. Trabaja  en sociedad con su madre; y lo que le parece difícil es que no puede surtir el negocio como quisiera, además su mayor anhelo es ampliar la tienda de comestibles, y después quiere independizarse del negocio de  su madre, y tener el suyo propio.Este es su primer  préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete en pagar sus cuotas oportunamente.Elva tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en incrementar su mercadería en comestibles, y de ese modo desea tener su negocio bien surtido.
texts.en:
Elva, 22 years old, is a young woman with hopes of succeeding. She lives in her parents' home with her two brothers. She works and invests her money in a grocery store that her mother has. On days that she's not working, she's paying attention to the business; 30% of which is her investment. Her clients are neighbors from her neighborhood and some passersby, whom she waits on graciously. Ever since she was 17 years old she's been working in diverse roles related to sales. She's always had a desire to go out on her own and be successful, and because of that, she's forging her working capital. She's working in partnership with her mother, and what seems difficult is that she can't operate the business as she would like. In addition to that, her biggest wish is to expand the grocery store and later, she wants to become independent of her mother and have her own store. This is the first loan she's had with MFP, and she knows that the loan with help her increase her capital in the work, and for that she promises to make her payments on time. Elva is planning to invest the money in increasing her grocery supplies, and in this way she hopes her business will be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries (food supplies) to sustain her business

loans.name: Zoila Esther

texts.es:
Zoila Florián  vive y  tiene su negocio en Campeche, el corregimiento  reconocido en Colombia porque realiza el festival de la Ciruela, con la  exhibición de dulces, jaleas, jugos, ensaladas y otros manjares, que tienen como ingrediente principal esta fruta tropical. Es allí donde Zoila se dedica esmeradamente al servicio de transcripciones,  fotocopiado y tele comunicaciones vía celular, además de vender mercancías a crédito como ropa  cosméticos calzado etc,  Ella inició su negocio hace 3 años, vendiendo mercancías y ofreciendo servicios de telecomunicaciones, a lo que luego agrego transcripiones, pero hace  algo menos de un año acudió a su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y compró su fotocopiadora, integrando este nuevo servicio, con el que aumentó mas sus ingresos.
En la actualidad solicita su segundo crédito y está aplicando a un monto de $1.100.000 COP, para comprar nuevos celulares y planes y  para prestar el servicio de internet tan útil y necesitado en este corregimiento; su  meta principal es independizar su negocio de su espacio doméstico y planea a futuro construir su propio local.
Zoila es una mujer que ama a  su familia,  vive con su cónyuge y tiene 4 hijos, entre los 19 a 26 años de edad, y es muy reconocida en este corregimiento perteneciente al Municipio de  Branoa  en el  Departamento del Atlántico.
texts.en:
Zoila Florián lives and owns a business in Campeche, an area well known in Colombia for holding the plum festival, where they exhibit candies, jellies, juices, salads, and other delicacies which feature this tropical fruit as their main ingredient. It is here where Zoila diligently provides a transcription service, a photocopy service, and a cellphone service. She also sells merchandise on credit such as clothes, cosmetics, footwear, ETC. She started her business about three years ago, selling merchandise and offering telecommunications services. She later added transcription services. Then, less than a year ago she obtained her first loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and bought her photocopier, and integrated this new service into her business, which helped to increase her income. For this, her second loan, she is requesting an amount of 1,100,000 Columbian Pesos, in order to purchase cellular telephones and plans, and to offer Internet service, something which is very much needed and useful in this region. Her primary goal is to move her business out of her home and in the future she plans to build her own building. Zoila is a woman who loves her family. She lives with her husband and she has four children ranging in age from 19 to 26. She is quite well known in this area, which belongs to the Municipality of Branoa in the Department Atlántico.

Translated from Spanish by Aaron Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phones, plans, and to offer Internet Services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of photocopiers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of general grocery products

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 39 años de edad, es soltero y tiene dos hijos, Ineas de 9 y Yefer de 7 años de edad. Juntos residen en la comunidad de Manitea Alta, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Hace 19 años, Víctor no tenía capital para invertir en un negocio, pero gracias a la ayuda de su familia pudo establecerse en la cultivo de cacao. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia, pero en temporada de cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones para que le faciliten la extracción de su producto. En la actualidad ya tiene segmentado su mercado, es por ello que la producción de éste fruto le esta generando buenos ingresos económicos. Pero él es consciente que le falta mucho por crecer, es por ello que tiene un plan ambicioso, para que pueda cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, que es comprar terrenos para cultivar otros productos que tengan mucha demanda. Sus productos son vendidos a los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además se siente conforme por el buen trabajo de su grupo comunal. Con el dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en comprar terrenos con el propósito de cultivar cacao, para que así pueda abastecer a sus compradores potenciales.
texts.en:
Victor, 39, is single and has 2 children: Ineas, who is 9, and Yefer, who is 7 years old. They live together in the community of Manitea Alta, located in the beautiful Cuzqueñan rainforest, where they have their own house made of wood. Nineteen years ago Victor did not have capital to invest in a business, but thanks to the help of his family he was able to establish himself in the cultivation of cocoa. At times he receives help from his family, but at harvest time he hires and supervises workers who help him with the harvest of his product. Now he has found a niche in the market, and for this reason the production of this fruit is generating a good income for him. But he is aware that there is much that he lacks to be able to grow. For this reason, he has an ambitious plan, so that he will be able to meet the needs of his customers. His plan is to buy land to cultivate other products that are in high demand. His products are sold at a collection center in his own community. This is his 4th loan with MFP, and he is committed to making his payments according the payment schedule. In addition, he feels good about the work with his communal group. With the money he requests he will buy land with the objective of cultivating cocoa, so that he can supply his potential buyers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy lands to cultivate cocoa

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of palm nuts

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi A. est une femme de 46 ans qui vit à Atakpamé une ville située à 100 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est une revendeuse de maïs et elle exerce cette activité il y a 18 ans, avec ce crédit, Essi voudrait acheter du maïs dans les fermes pour en faire le stock. Dans les moments de pénurie du maïs Essi souhaiterait vendre son stock pour avoir beaucoup de bénéfices. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, elle  préférerait prendre soins de sa petite famille et dans l’avenir elle compte vendre à Lomé.
texts.en:
Massi Koumako est une femme de 48 ans qui vit à Atakpamé avec sa famille et ses 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de noix de palme et elle exerce cette activité il y a 20 ans, elle va dans les fermes qui environnent Atakpamé pour se ravitailler. Avec ce crédit, Massi voudrait acheter en gros où le prix du bol de noix de palme est moins cher afin de réalisés beaucoup de bénéfices. Avec les bénéfices réalisés, Massi souhaiterait subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et dans l’avenir elle souhaiterait avoir à Lomé un marché qui lui ferait gagner beaucoup d’argent.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: achat du maïs pour le stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase seeds for his farm and also fresh foods like beans for resale

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira, de 52 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su pequeña hija Mery.Elvira tiene una pequeña tienda instalada en una carreta ambulante, donde  vende golosinas  y letreros, sus clientes son sus vecinos. Además su esposo es experto en el pintado de letreros, cada una de las inscripciones, mencionan los recorridos de los buses, y los compradores de estos letreros, son los chóferes y ayudantes de las líneas que circulan cerca. Anteriormente ella y su esposo pintaban estos letreros, pero hoy en día, por las mañanas se dedica solo a la compra de sus golosinas, para que su carreta esté bien surtida y muy llamativa para los clientes. Es así que lleva 5 años con esta labor, aunque siente que su negocio es algo tedioso; no se queja porque tiene buenas ganancias económicas. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio y después quiere adquirir un Kiosco fijo, para que su tienda sea más estable.Este es su octavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por lo que se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, y en su grupo de trabajo  es reconocida por su seriedad.Elvira tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de  golosinas, pinturas acrílicas, para mejorar su negocio, y dice que si le sobra algo del dinero lo invertirá en el mejoramiento de su carreta.
texts.en:
Elvira, age 52, is a very hard-working woman. She lives in her own house together with her husband and her young daughter, Mery. Elvira has a little store installed on a mobile cart, from which she sells snacks and signs. Her neighbors are her customers. Her husband is an expert in painting signs. The inscriptions mention the bus routes, and the people who buy these signs are the drivers and assistants on the bus lines serving the area. Previously, she and her husband both painted the signs, but now Elvira dedicates herself in the mornings to buying her snacks, to make sure her wagon will be well-stocked and attractive to her customers. She has done this work for 5 years; although she feels that the business can be a bit tedious, she doesn't complain, because she obtains good economic returns. Her greatest desire is to expand her business and later to acquire a permanent kiosk, so that her store will be more stable. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and she knows that it will benefit her greatly by increasing her working capital. She is committed to making her payments on time, and she is known within her work group for being serious and responsible. Elvira plans to invest the funds she is requesting in buying a larger quantity of snacks, as well as acrylic paints, to improve her business, and she says that if there is any money left over, she will invest it in improving her wagon.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise and paint that she needs to improve her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of mustard seeds

loans.name: Richar Jesus

texts.es:
Richar G. P. es un joven con mucha fuerza de trabajo, que todo lo ha conseguido con su buen comportamiento, disciplina y autocontrol; como buen Santandereano , a su edad es ya propietario de una Tienda de Abastos, vive con su padre y sus hermanas de 13 a 23 años ; llegó a la Costa Caribe buscando mejores oportunidades e inició trabajando en una panadería y cuando aprendió  quiso independizarse, por lo que el dueño de este negocio,  viendo su gran responsabilidad le presto los primeros $200.000 COP y posteriormente $10.000.000 COP asì fuè como se trajo a su papa de Norte de Santander y empezaron a trabajar en su propia tienda después de la enfermedad de su madre ya fallecida; en la actualidad  cada uno atiende su negocio.
Este es su segundo crédito con La Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el primero pudo bajar muchas de sus deudas, pero gracias a Dios hoy todo se ha normalizado;  además con esta inyección de capital de trabajo logró comprar de contado a los proveedores, lo cual  le garantizó mejores precios para competir en el mercado. Esta es la razón por la que  Richar está aplicando  por un crédito de $1.800.000 COP,  él quiere comprar de contado la mayor parte de sus mercancías: arroz, azúcar, café, aceite, enlatados, refrescos y bebidas.
Su sueño más adelante es tener su casa propia, apoyar a su familia y sacar tiempo para estudiar y seguir preparándose, pero lo que más añora es buscar espacios de diversión y esparcimiento porque en la actualidad solo vive trabajando.
texts.en:
Richar G. P. is a young man with a strong work ethic; everything he’s accomplished has been due to his good behavior, discipline and self-control. As a good citizen of Santander, at his young age he already owns a grocery store. He lives with his father and sisters who are 13 and 23 years of age. He came to the Caribbean coast region looking for better opportunities and started working in a bakery. Having learned those skills, he sought to become independent. The owner of the bakery, recognizing Richar’s sense of responsibility, lent him the initial $200.000 pesos and later an additional $10.000.000 pesos. This is how he was able to bring his father from north Santander and they began to work in their own store after the illness and death of his mother. Currently, each tends to his business. This is his 2nd loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He used the first one to pay down several of his debts; thanks to God everything has normalized now. With this capital input he was able to pay cash to his suppliers which guaranteed lower prices and allowed him to be competitive in the marketplace. This is why Richar is now applying for a $1.800.000 pesos loan; he wants to pay cash for most of his merchandise like: rice, coffee, cooking oil, canned goods, beverages and soft-drinks. His future dream includes owning his own home, helping out his family, and carving out some free time to go to school to continue preparing himself. However, what he would most like is to find ways to relax and enjoy himself because currently all he does is work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay cash for most of his stock merchandise.

loans.name: Deylin Francisco

texts.es: El señor Deylin Francisco tiene 25 años, es casado y tiene un hijo menor de edad. El señor tiene una unidad de moto taxi, la cual circula en el área urbana desde las seis de la mañana hasta las diez de la noche. El maneja dicha moto taxi y ya tiene tres años de tenerla. Anteriormente él trabajaba como chofer pero esto no le generaba ingresos mayores para  él. Está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de realizarse unas mejoras a la moto taxi que tiene, con el objetivo de brindar un mejor servicio. Algo que afecta a él en el transporte es que las calles están bastante malas lo que hace que los vehículos se deterioren con mayor facilidad. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a comprar un microbús, con el objetivo de obtener mayores ganancias en su negocio de transporte.
texts.en:
Deylin Francisco is 25, married and has a young child. He has a motorcycle taxi unit, and he circulates through the urban area from 6 am to 10 pm. He drives the motorcycle taxi and has had it for three years already. Previously, he worked as a driver but this did not earn him much income. He is requesting this loan to make some improvements to his motorcycle taxi, with the goal of offering a better service. Something that affects him is that the streets are pretty bad and this makes vehicles deteriorate more easily. His dream has always been to buy a minibus, in order to obtain better earnings in his transportation business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy tiene 23 años, comparte su vida con sus padres y vive en cada de ellos. Hace mas de 5 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, anteriormente trabajaba de manera dependiente pero con el arduo trabajo, pudo ahorrar y comprar su propia movilidad que ahora es su principal herramienta de trabajo. Ahora labora durante todo el día, cubriendo la ruta local de su ciudad, puesto que es socio de una empresa de transportes. Freddy ha visto que su trabajo es muy rentable, es por ello que quiere ser propietario de más autos y de esa manera aumentar sus ganancias. Es la primera vez que esta solicitando un crédito con MFP, por lo que será muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de 2 llantas nuevas y restaurar la pintura de su carro.
texts.en:
Freddy, 23, shares his life with his parents and lives in their house. For over 5 years he has provided public transportation services. He used to work as an employee but, thanks to hard work, he was able to save and buy his own vehicle which is now his main work tool. He works all day covering a local route in his city because he’s a member of a transportation enterprise. Freddy has seen that his work is quite profitable so he’d like to own several autos in order to increase his income. This is the first time he has asked for funds from MFP so he will be very responsible with regards to his repayments. He is grateful to all the people who will make the loan possible for it will be very useful to him for his business’ progress. He will use the requested funds to buy two new tires and to refresh the paint on his car.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two new tires and repair the car's paint.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor, de 35 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive con sus dos hijos, en la casa de sus suegros.Realiza los acabados en chompas industriales para ser exportadas. Es diestra en el manejo del crochet, con el que aplica los diversos bordados a los bordes y detalles de las chompas, guiándose de las fotografías. Sus clientes fijos son los dueños de galerías y  tiendas de artesanía de un mercado muy conocido en la ciudad. En sus inicios  trabajaba en casa de la persona que le da el trabajo, últimamente lo realiza en su casa, mientras cuida a sus hijos.Se siente muy contenta con lo que hace, pues obtiene regulares ganancias; y lleva 9 años realizando esta actividad que le ha permitido desarrollarse. En adelante piensa independizarse con algún negocio adicional.Este es el octavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente, y en las reuniones de su grupo es muy solidaria.Flor tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la compra de chompas ya tejidas, ya que anhela tener su propio negocio de bordado en chompas, pues quiere continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Flor, 35, is a very cheerful and hard-working mother; she lives with her two children in her in laws’ house. She works doing finishing touches on industrial sweaters for export. She is an expert at crochet which she uses to apply the various embroidery and details to the sweaters guided by photographs. Her regular customers are owners of galleries and crafts stores in a well-known market in the city. At the beginning, she used to work in the home of the person who gave her the job but lately she has been doing the work in her own home while she cares for her children. She is happy with what she does because she earns regular income. She has been in this line of work for 9 years and it has allowed her to grow and develop. She hopes in the future to become independent with an additional business. This is her 8th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion; she is also very cooperative in the group meetings. Flor plans to use the requested funds to buy already woven sweaters because she hopes to have her own sweater embroidery business and thus continue to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweaters.

loans.name: Veronica Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Verónica Del Socorro tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene una hija menor de edad. La señora tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada, este negocio está ubicado en el costado oeste del mercado. Ella ya tiene 5 años de tener este negocio, cabe señalarse antes lo tenía en su casa pero lo llevo al mercado para vender más. La señora está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de invertirle a su negocio y comprar ropa usada. En los últimos días, la señora ha estado un poco afectada por los recientes cambios en todos los artículos, sin embargo dice que a pesar de todo ha logrado incrementar sus ventas en el mercado. Su sueño en el futuro es brindar la educación universitaria que ella no tuvo a su hija a través de las ganancias obtenidas en el negocio.
texts.en:
Verónica Del Socorro, 27, is married and has a minor daughter. She sells used clothing from a stand located on the western side of the market. She has been in this line of work for 5 years. It’s worth noting that she used to sell from home but took her business to the market in order to increase sales. She is asking for funds to invest in her business and buy used clothing. The last few days she has been somewhat affected by all the changes in the articles but she says that, despite everything, she has managed to increase sales in the market. Her future dream is to use profits form the business to provide her daughter with a university education, something she herself never had.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Jimmy Alberto

texts.es: EL Señor Jimmy Alberto tiene el negocio de brindar el servicio de taxi. El trabaja en este negocio desde hace 3 años por lo que está muy feliz, ya que así genera más ingresos a su familia y le dedica más tiempo a la misa. Por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en este negocio, el disfruta de relacionarse con sus clientes pues él una persona muy humilde y responsable. Por lo que se siente muy agradecido por esta oportunidad con créditos ya que es su primera experiencia y se encuentra muy emocionado. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de repuestos, herramientas, cambio de focos entre otras cosas. Sueña con terminar de construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jimmy Alberto provides taxi service. He has been in this line of work for 3 years which makes him very happy because he generates more income for his family and can spend more time with them. He has a lot of experience in this type of work and enjoys relating to his customers because he is a very humble and responsible person. He is grateful for the opportunity these loans provide since this is his first experience with them and he is very excited about it. He will use the funds to buy replacement parts, tools and to replace his headlights. He dreams with finishing building a room onto his dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair
